Except for the Sunday, Im relatively new to them, because I used to believe that the Saturday puzzle, at least, was for the truly suicidal. It just goes to show that practice makes, if not perfect, a lot better. Thats a good thing, and I hope that people who are afraid to try them sit down and give them a chance. And then another and another, until they can crack them almost as easily as they do a midweek puzzle.

title: Looming Layoffs at Schools Imperil Bloombergs Legacy
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs threats of teacher layoffs have had a ring of dj vu. He used the same threat last year to squeeze more money from the federal government and to press his case for abolishing the state law that protects the most senior teachers from losing their jobs.

title: In New York, Mayor Seeks Teacher Cuts
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg proposed on Friday to lay off 5,400 New York City workers, including 5 percent of all schoolteachers, in what would be the first significant city job cuts in two decades.

title: A Union of Comfort Foods
description: The seemingly boundless popularity of burger joints and cupcake shops inspired Rick Ross and his wife, Cathy, to try combining the two. Their Bucu Burger Bar and Bakery on Route 4 in Paramus brings both food trends under the same roof.

title: A Szechuan Adventure Behind a Shopping Mall
description: SQUEEZED next to a Home Goods store behind the Willowbrook Mall in Wayne, Chengdu 23 looks like little more than a place for weary shoppers to get a quick pick-me-up of moo shu or kung pao. But something happens when you take your seat, scan the menu and inhale scents of jasmine, garlic and others, harder to name, that waft by with every passing plate. Your appetite swells, as does your adventurousness.

title: At 80s Party, White Hair Crowns an August Head
description: The 80s theme was laid on so thick at an auction and party for the public arts group Creative Time on Thursday night that if a member of the Brat Pack had sauntered by, we wouldnt have blinked.

title: Sales Surge 50% for Maker of Monster Energy Drinks
description: The Hansen Natural Corporation, the maker of Monster Energy drinks, posted a 50 percent increase in quarterly sales, setting off a 4.5 percent gain in its share price on Friday. The company said after the close of trading Thursday that its sales rose to $356.4 million, and profit rose to 59 cents a share, topping the 49 cents analysts had expected. Stock in Hansen, which is based in Corona, Calif., rose $2.80, to $64.74 a share.

title: JPMorgan in Talks to Settle S.E.C. Inquiry Into Securities
description: JPMorgan Chase & Company is in negotiations to resolve its role in a Securities and Exchange Commission investigation into how mortgage-linked securities were packaged and sold as the housing market came apart.

title: At a Strip Mall, Fans Keep Vigil for a Champion
description: Some of the best things  and biggest mysteries  in this city can be found hidden in the nondescript strip malls that line miles of thoroughfares, most famously exotic ethnic restaurants tucked into plain storefronts.

title: Yankees Adjust to Loss of the Versatile Chavez
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  The ripples from Eric Chavezs broken left foot spread throughout the Yankees on Friday, from them calling up Ramiro Pena to potentially giving Jorge Posada repetitions at first base to planning when to rest the aging stars patrolling the left side of their infield.

title: Drone Strike Said to Kill at Least 8 in Pakistan
description: Missiles believed to have been fired by an American drone killed at least eight suspected militants and wounded four in Pakistans tribal regions on Friday, according to a Pakistani security official and a resident in the area of the strike. Later, seven more bodies were recovered, bringing the death toll to 15, the resident said.

title: Ethier Extends Streak, but Mets Win the Day
description: Just 13 pitches into Fridays game, the big question of the day was answered virtually without suspense. Andre Ethier, the third batter of the evening, belted a 3-0 fastball into center field for a base hit, and with that his hitting streak moved up a level.

title: Elliott Erwitts Best Picture? The Next One.
description: On Tuesday, the Magnum photographer and filmmaker Elliott Erwitt, 82, will receive the Infinity Award for Lifetime Achievement from the International Center of Photography, which will exhibit his favorite pictures as Personal Best, beginning May 20. For the occasion, he agreed to let his son Misha Erwitt, a photographer himself, present him with a list of questions that family members have long wanted to ask.

title: Photo Replay: May 6
description: A look at the day in sports, from the opening ceremony of the Giro dItalia cycling race to the morning workouts at Churchill Downs.

title: Bruins Finish Off Flyers, Leaving Bad Taste Behind
description: BOSTON  The Bruins exorcised some very persistent demons Friday night. It is too soon to tell if they have done so as thoroughly as the Red Sox did when they overcame nearly a century of futility by rallying from three games down in a playoff series against the Yankees in 2004.

title: Nova Finds His Pitch, Leaving Rangers Helpless
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Ignore the detail that the Texas Rangers were playing without the sluggers Josh Hamilton and Nelson Cruz, and that their flight from Seattle arrived Friday morning after the newspapers had hit the driveways. Just consider the facts. On a muggy night, in a stadium where the ball travels well, and facing a lineup still loaded with power and speed, Ivan Nova dominated like no other starter for the Yankees this season.

title: With Death Outpacing Birth, a County Slows to a Shuffle
description: WEIRTON, W. Va.  Life in this industrial area has slowed to a shuffle along with the steel mills that used to power it. Young people have moved away, leaving an aging population that no longer has the energy to put on street fairs or holiday parades.

title: Friday Night Lights Watch: Save the Children
description: We are covering the final season of Friday Night Lights according to the NBC schedule. We ask that readers who have already seen the season on DirecTV or on DVD to please refrain from giving away future plot points in the comments section.Can this child be saved? That was the underlying theme of the latest episode of Friday Night Lights, as we watched Epyck lash out, fight and get suspended and Buddys son roll into town with his quasi-vegan-induced anger and disillusionment. Who among us wouldnt become cranky if subjected to a step-parent mandated diet of seitan? It seems to take Buddy Jr. about 10 seconds of being in Dillon to steal his fathers credit card and break into the booze and another 20 for everyone to figure that the cure for what ails Buddy is going to be two-a-days. Im already feeling too optimistic about Buddys future, and I dont want to feel optimistic. I hope for more screeching engines and rebellion, a challenge to Buddys narrowly circumscribed gridiron view of the world.

title: Israel Continues Airstrikes on Gaza
description: The Israeli Army declared some areas around Gaza closed military zones, as Israeli aircraft attacked key Hamas symbols of power, raising the death toll to more than 300.

title: Face That Screamed Wars Pain Looks Back, 6 Hard Years Later
description: MOSUL, Iraq  Until the past week, Samar Hassan had never glimpsed the photograph of her that millions had seen, never knew it had become one of the most famous images of the Iraq war.

title: With Fourth-Quarter Rally, Mavericks Push Jackson and Lakers to Brink
description: DALLAS  For all of their shared highs, the championships topped with championships, Kobe Bryant and Phil Jackson have never been pinned by the new low the Dallas Mavericks presented Friday evening.

title: Seve Ballesteros, Dashing Golf Champion, Dies at 54
description: Seve Ballesteros, the charismatic Spanish golfer who won the Masters twice and the British Open three times and helped propel Europes rise in the Ryder Cup competition with the United States, died early Saturday at his home in northern Spain, where his struggle with brain cancer had gained wide attention in the sports world. He was 54.

title: In Majorca, Atoning for the Sins of 1691
description: PALMA, MAJORCA  The old stones of the historic quarter of the Spanish island of Majorca are worn smooth with secrets ignored by most tourists that pour into this city from cruise liners on the sparkling Mediterranean.

title: As Syria Steps Up Efforts to Crush Unrest, Dissidents Report Attack on a City
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Hundreds of troops backed by at least seven tanks stormed a city on Syrias Mediterranean coast before dawn on Saturday, cutting electricity and phone lines and besieging neighborhoods in a locale that has emerged as one of the most restive in the seven-week uprising, opposition groups and human rights activists said.

title: The Weekend Word: Aftermath
description: Todays Times

title: 27 Feared Dead in Indonesia Crash
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Up to 27 people were believed to be dead after a passenger plane crashed into the sea in eastern Indonesia on Saturday, officials said, the latest in a long series of transportation accidents in the archipelago nation.

title: When One Is Enough
description: Molly Jo Rosen has been involved with thoroughbred racing from coast to coast: from Churchill Downs to TVG to Smarty Joness personal assistant to managing a major New York racing operation. She now runs Community Communications at GradeOneRacing, finds future superstars at 2yoSales.com, and serves her blend of pony punditry on her blog, Focused Filly.

title: Classic Ad: A Chrysler Mash-Up
description: Theres something about this ad for the 1971 Chrysler 300 that just isnt quite right.

title: Shadow of the Torturers
description: After reading John Yoos attack on the president for not taking Osama alive and bringing him to Gitmo, I thought I might take a minute to explain something I sometimes say. Once in a while I mention, in passing, that the Bush administration saw torturing people as a plus, not a cost. And whenever I do, some readers clutch their breasts and reach for the smelling salts: how dare I say such a thing?

title: A Healers Horse Repays the Favor
description: If Midnight Interlude wins the Kentucky Derby, Bob Baffert should place his friend Philip Thomas on the payroll through the Belmont. In 2002, Bafferts Derby horse War Emblem bit his groom before winning the Derby. He bit the same groom before winning the Preakness. Word is that the groom disappeared before the Belmont which War Emblem lost. This week, Bafferts Derby horse Midnight Interlude bit Phillip Thomas twice on the arm. In the world of racetrack superstitions, Baffert views this as a very good sign.

title: Volatile Prices Are Volatile
description: Commodity Rout Lends Credence to Bernankes Inflation Outlook, says Real Time Economics. Well, yes. Volatile prices are volatile, which is why they shouldnt be used to determine monetary policy.

title: Race-Day Drugs: Clearing the Air
description: Chris McCarron is a Hall of Fame jockey and the founder and lead instructor of the North American Racing Academy in Lexington, Ky.

title: On Derby Morning, Dialed In Looks Ready
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  This morning I ventured over to the backside for the final time before the 137th running of the Kentucky Derby. My host, Bob, and I stopped off at Wagners to pick up a cup of coffee on the way.

title: Moving the Goal Posts on Pay
description: PEOPLE scrutinize just about everything Wal-Mart does. As Michael T. Duke, the companys chief executive, put it recently, What we do and how we perform is watched closely not only by our customers and shareholders, but also by the whole world.

title: Libya Strikes Fuel Supply in City Held by Rebels
description: MISURATA, Libya  Military forces loyal to Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi struck the fuel terminal of this rebel-controlled city early Saturday with ground-to-ground rockets, igniting a fire that threatened the citys fuel supply.

title: Drugs in Racing: Dj Vu All Over Again
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Four years ago, the Derby week chatter among Twin Spires railbirds centered on the likelihood that the 2008 edition of the Kentucky Derby might be the last in which horses were allowed to compete with anabolic steroids as part of their race regimen. It was.

title: The Prince of Lord & Taylor
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Answers in a Teenager's Murder, Four Decades Later
description: Police reports offer new details about the murder of Johnny McCabe in 1969.

title: Browns Peyton Hillis Hopes to Defy Madden NFL Curse
description: With some extra downtime during the N.F.L. lockout, Peyton Hillis, a Cleveland Browns running back, has become proficient at the Madden NFL video game by EA Sports. He also became its unlikely cover boy for Madden NFL 12, winning the sports video game version of American Idol. He beat out more glamorous names like Michael Vick and Aaron Rogers after a six-week online fan voting campaign that generated more than 12.7 million votes.

title: Lessons on Going Viral
description: A class on persuasive technology at Stanford University ended up becoming a laboratory for start-ups making simple products aimed at attracting large numbers of users.

title: The Class That Built Apps, and Fortunes
description: STANFORD, Calif.

title: Far From Perfection, but Closer to Vindication
description: If Jim Qualls had a penny for every time he was mentioned for breaking up Tom Seavers perfect game, he might be a bit more solvent while he drives a tractor in western Illinois.

title: For Dorfman, 100 Percent of the Game Was Mental
description: A vast majority of baseball fans never heard of Harvey Dorfman. But for 30 years until his death in February at 75, he had a profound effect on hundreds of major league players. Dorfman was hired by the Oakland Athletics in the mid-1980s to serve as their mental performance coach, and worked his magic with some of the games biggest stars.

title: Yes, Everyone Can Be Stupid for a Minute
description: This interview with  Dominic Orr, president and C.E.O. of Aruba Networks, a wireless networking company, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Strong Arms, Long Memories for Smoltz and Morris
description: SECAUCUS, N.J.  It was the most magical night a pitcher has ever had, an extra-inning shutout to win the World Series, and Jack Morris wishes he could share it with you. If every person could experience one moment like that, he says, and reach a goal in extraordinary circumstances, think of the positive energy it could bring to the world.

title: In Rarity, a Player Speaks Out for Gay Rights
description: Since September, advocates for same-sex marriage in New York have released 30-second videos of celebrities endorsing their cause. More than 30 have taken part, including the actors Julianne Moore and Sam Waterston, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and the former first daughter Barbara Bush. On Thursday, former President Bill Clinton released a written statement of support, too.

title: When a Players Union Doesnt Help the Players
description: Having grown up during the New Deal, my parents made me keenly aware that unions gave workers what they lacked individually  a voice. My childhood hero was Marvin Miller, the labor economist who in 1968 negotiated the Major League Baseball Players Associations first collective bargaining agreement with team owners. Millers own new deal raised the minimum salary to $10,000 from $6,000, the first increase since the 1940s. (Its now $414,000.)

title: How to Be Contrarian in a Year of Contrarians
description: Everybody knows that all the favorites in this years Kentucky Derby have serious vulnerabilities and that lots of long-priced horses have hidden virtues. Everybody wants to go contrarian, but you got be different from everybody if you want to be contrarian. I cant add to what everybody already knows. Rather than look at the race comprehensively in a limited space, I will take this opportunity to explore a pure contrarian opportunity in this race that could produce value in a race screaming out for a contrarian approach.

title: An Engines Tall Order: Streamline the Search
description: WHEN a kidney stone had me writhing in pain a few months back, I did what a lot of people with medical ailments do: I headed straight to Google for help with a self-diagnosis.

title: The Next Step for Researchers Is Not Finding Brain Trauma
description: When the N.F.L. veteran Andre Waters killed himself in late 2006, the subsequent discovery of damage in his brain shocked the football community into asking how many other retired players might have an incurable disease.

title: For the Phillies Polanco, Its the Little Things
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Philadelphia Phillies led the Washington Nationals by a run in the seventh inning last Tuesday at Citizens Bank Park. Shane Victorino hit a leadoff single, and Phillies Manager Charlie Manuel called for a hit-and-run. He knew he could trust the hitter, Placido Polanco.

title: Fish Hooks Designed to Avoid the Wrong Catch
description: MOST angling gear is designed to hold onto fish. But some new equipment is fine-tuned to be more selective  holding tight to some fish and letting go of others, especially if they are Atlantic bluefin tuna  a fish whose numbers have fallen sharply.

title: Huntsman, Ex-Envoy to China, Tests Political Waters With Speech
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  A week after resigning his post as ambassador to China, Jon M. Huntsman Jr. made his debut on the American political stage here on Saturday and defended his service in the Obama administration as he began exploring whether to join the Republican presidential race.

title: A Warranty She Didnt Want
description: HAGGLER regulars may recall a two-episode cliffhanger a few months back involving an auto dealership in New York City and an unhappy customer who said hed been overcharged by roughly $6,000.

title: Greek Leader Irked by Speculation on Debt
description: PARIS  Prime Minister George Papandreou of Greece on Saturday attacked rumor mongering and speculation after a German magazine reported that Athens was threatening to leave the euro zone in order to bargain for easier terms on its huge debt obligations.

title: Which Horse Will Have What It Takes?
description: Bruno De Julio has been a workout analyst and thoroughbred owner for the past 20 years. He is the author of Bruno on Workouts: Exposing the Mystery and can be found daily at Racing With Bruno and Grade One Racing.

title: Variety: A Parental Acrostic
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  Todays acrostic contains a beautiful quote, and perhaps Im feeling sentimental about it because I am raising two young people who, like their peers, truly do feel the way youth is described here. My job, apparently, is to reassure them that their experiences are not abnormal and their crises are not final.

title: Bird Week | Watching and Counting
If You Have the Answers, Tell Me
description: AFTER more than a quarter-century as a professional economist, I have a confession to make: There is a lot I dont know about the economy. Indeed, the area of economics where I have devoted most of my energy and attention  the ups and downs of the business cycle  is where I find myself most often confronting important questions without obvious answers.

title: Tech Stocks May Become an Unlikely Haven
description: THE stock market has been fighting an army of economic worries  including slowing economic growth and corporate earnings, a weakening dollar and what until last week were surging oil prices.

title: Overqualified? Dont Be Overwrought
description: Q. During the recession, you needed a job and wound up taking one for which you are overqualified. Although you were initially grateful just to have the work, you now feel bored and depressed. Is there any way to change that?

title: Frogs, Chessboards and Grids
description: I COME from a family of mathematicians. My mother taught math in middle school, high school and college, and my father was a math professor. He was also a poet, a musician and a chess player  a true renaissance man who had an extraordinary influence on me. Id come home from school to find him listening to orchestra music while following along with the musical score and pretending he was conducting.

title: Briefing on Bin Laden Documents
description: The Obama administration has briefed reporters on Saturday, including The Timess Elisabeth Bumiller, on the contents of some videos seized during the commando raid of Osama bin Ladens compound in Abbottabad, Pakistan. The Lede will provide updates.

title: Fighting Words
description: A Minnesota legislator took aim at the writer Neil Gaiman, for accepting a $45,000 speaking fee from the state. (Mr. Gaiman says he gave the money to charity.)

title: Laugh Lines
description: JAY LENO

title: Ballesteros Could Get Up and Down Out of a Garbage Can
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The reality of the death of the great golf champion Seve Ballesteros in Spain at the age of 54 dawned on Quail Hollow Club on Saturday morning, its arrival fittingly wrapped in a thick fog that shrouded the golf course and delayed the start of play for 90 minutes.

title: No-Hitter Droughts
description: Before the Minnesota Twins Francisco Liriano threw a no-hitter against them last week, the Chicago White Sox had not been no-hit since Bret Saberhagen stymied them on Aug. 26, 1991. The crosstown Cubs, though, have gone much longer.

title: Law Schools, Grades and Scholarships
description: Law Schools, Grades And Scholarships

title: A Familys Long Wait for Answers
description: William McCabe kept after the police in Lowell, Mass., for years, calling them early in the morning or late at night, reminding them about his son, Johnny, and reminding them not to let him be forgotten after his murder on Sept. 26, 1969. Four decades after the murder, three men have been arrested in connection with the case.

title: Persistence of a Father Brings News in a Killing
description: LOWELL, Mass.  Even though he has answers now after so many years when there were none  his grief scabbing over but never healing, his stubbornness and persistence all that kept him going  William McCabe is still adding to the book about his son.

title: Norwich City and Whitbread Movin on Up
description: Norwich City is going back to the English Premier League for the first time since 2005, and the club is taking its American defender Zak Whitbread with it.

title: Share Your Memories of Seve Ballesteros
description: Seve Ballesteros, the charismatic Spanish golfer who won the Masters twice and the British Open three times and helped propel Europes rise in the Ryder Cup competition with the United States, died early Saturday at his home in northern Spain, where his struggle with brain cancer had gained wide attention in the sports world. He was 54.

title: Long Odds for the Leagues Old Guard
description: Boston

title: Theres No Data Sheriff on the Wild Web
description: A company suffers a catastrophic attack on its servers. Gone are names, e-mail addresses, home phone numbers, passwords, credit card numbers.

title: Posada Fights to Keep Positive Outlook
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  It took one question for Jorge Posada to release six weeks of disappointment, one question for his emotions to come tumbling out, and once they did he could not stop. At first, he described his season as a little frustrating. The next sentence, he called it really frustrating. By the end of his 28-second response, it had become very frustrating, and anyone in the same ZIP code as Posada on Friday night, with his brow furrowed and his arms crossed, could sense how much this all gnaws at him.

title: The Morning Line: Derby Day Talk Centers on Horse Who Wont Run
description: Even on the morning of Derby Day, the scratching of Uncle Mo is the major news story. Kevin Van Valkenberg, (whose coverage appears in the Los Angeles Times, the Washington Post, the Baltimore Sun, the Chicago Tribune, and assorted other Tribune Co. papers) writes that the reality of the 2011 Derby is the horse that isnt in the race might be a bigger story than the ones that are.

title: Role Players Help the Lightning Strike Twice in Playoff Series
description: The surprise team of the Stanley Cup playoffs, the Tampa Bay Lightning, advanced to the semifinal stage of the tournament last week by sweeping the top-seeded, glamorous Washington Capitals, an outcome few had predicted.

title: Derek Jeter and the Curse of Age
description: Heres a prediction for how Derek Jeter, the Yankees Cooperstown-bound shortstop, will finish his season.

title: Ecuador Votes on Bid to Give More Control to President
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Ecuadoreans voted on Saturday in a referendum that includes measures aimed at strengthening the power of President Rafael Correa, especially over Ecuadors independent media organizations and the nations judiciary.

title: Situation: Ambiguous
description: Rarely has a photo revealed so little while evoking so much. It shows an intent President Obama and other officials in the White House Situation Room, but tells little about what exactly the situation is, except that they are watching something off to the left.

title: Videos From Bin Ladens Hide-Out Released
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Saturday released five videos recovered from Osama bin Ladens hide-out in Abbottabad, Pakistan, that an intelligence official said showed the Qaeda founder threatening the United States, condemning capitalism and at some points flubbing his lines and missing a cue. In the most candid scenes, Bin Laden can be seen watching news coverage of himself on television.

title: Opposition Makes Inroads in Singapore
description: BANGKOK  The ruling Peoples Action Party led by Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong was returned to power on Sunday with a majority of 60 percent of the vote after a hard-fought parliamentary campaign in which opposition parties made their strongest inroads since Singapores independence in 1965.

title: Charlie Mortons Step Forward
description: The Pirates Charlie Morton was historically terrible in 2010. In 17 starts, he was 2-12 with a 7.57 earned run average . Only one other pitcher has made so many starts with an E.R.A. so high and a winning percentage so low: Ed Holley, who was 1-11 with an 8.12 E.R.A. for two teams in 1934.

title: Home Videos of Bin Laden
description: Videos of Osama Bin Laden released on Saturday by the Obama administration. (These videos have no sound.)

title: Albert Bachmann, a Colorful Swiss Spymaster, Dies at 81
description: Albert Bachmann, Switzerlands least effective but most colorful spymaster, whose dread of a Soviet invasion led him to create a secret intelligence service and guerrilla force unknown to the Swiss government in the 1970s, died on April 12 in Cork, Ireland. He was 81.

title: A World Trade Center Progress Report
description: After Sept. 11, it took nearly a decade to locate and kill Osama bin Laden, perhaps giving the nation, and especially the families of those lost in the attacks, some sense of closure.

title: Bin Laden Watches Himself on TV
description: In a video released by the U.S. Department of Defense, Osama bin Laden is seen watching himself on television.

title: Bin Laden Video Released
description: First of five videos of Osama bin Laden released Saturday by the United States.

title: Deadly Attack by Insurgents in Kandahar
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Insurgents staged a complicated attack in Kandahar on Saturday that killed four, including an intelligence officer, a police officer and two civilians, and wounded 45 people.

title: Third Home Video of Bin Laden
description: In the third of the Osama bin Laden videos, he is seen speaking against a black background.

title: Bostons Murphy Waits to Help in Exasperating Year
description: WALTHAM, Mass.  Talking to Troy Murphy, one gets the distinct feeling that when he releases his life story, it will mention precious little, if anything, about what has been a humbling, vexing 2010-11 season.

title: Fourth Video of Bin Laden
description: In the fourth of the Bin Laden videos, he is seen speaking against a wooden background.

title: Fifth Video of Bin Laden
description: In the fifth, and final, video released by the U.S. Department of Defense today, Bin Laden is seen speaking against a blue wrinkled backdrop. The video has no audio.

title: A Record of Nuclear Oversight
description: Since the partial meltdown at Three Mile Islands unit 2 reactor in 1979, on 35 occasions reactors have been forced out of service for a year or longer in order to restore safe operation because of a systemic, cumulative degradation of the reactors components.

title: Physician, Heel Thyself
description: Pittsburgh

title: Freddie Roach to Join Olympians
description: Freddie Roach, widely acknowledged as the best boxing trainer in the world, said Friday he would work with the United States team on a volunteer basis in preparation for the London Olympics in 2012. Roach, who will be director of boxing strategy, said he had always dreamed of winning an Olympic medal.

title: Woman With Gun Arrested in Waldorfs Lobby, Police Say
description: A woman staying at the Waldorf-Astoria was arrested in the lobby of the Manhattan hotel on Saturday morning after a security officer spotted a pistol jutting out of her jacket pocket, the police said.

title: Rays Upton Suspended
description: Tampa Bay Rays outfielder B. J. Upton was suspended two games and fined an undisclosed amount by Major League Baseball on Saturday for launching into a tirade following an ejection earlier last week. Upton was to begin serving his suspension Saturday but decided to appeal, and he played against the Baltimore Orioles.

title: Fighting the Mississippi
description: The battle against North Americas longest river is never-ending. Photographs show some of the Mississippis worst floods.

title: The Untamable Mississippi River
description: The rain-swollen Mississippi River crested to an all-time high last week as it surged past Cairo, Ill., exceeding the 1937 record by 2 feet. Government engineers were left with two choices: Let Cairo flood or explode a levee to save the town. They blew up the levee. But while Cairo was saved, other communities may not be so lucky.

title: Animal Kingdom Wins Kentucky Derby
description: Animal Kingdom, who had never run a race on dirt, beat Nehro by two and three-quarter lengths to win the 137th running of the Kentucky Derby on Saturday in his fifth career start. Trained by Graham Motion and owned by Team Valor International, Animal Kingdom had won twice and finished second twice in his previous four starts. Mucho Macho Man finished third.

title: Federal Tax Chutzpah
description: Chutzpah, according to the traditional definition, is when you murder your mother and father, then plead for mercy from the court on the grounds that youre an orphan.

title: 30 Seconds With Juan Marichal
description: In 1963, Juan Marichal was making a name for himself, fresh off a no-hitter and on the way to a 25-win season for the San Francisco Giants. On July 2, his Milwaukee Braves opponent was Warren Spahn, 42 and nearing the end of his career. Marichal and Spahn pitched scoreless inning after scoreless inning until the 16th, when Willie Mays homered to win it for the Giants. The game is celebrated in Jim Kaplans book The Greatest Game Ever Pitched. Marichal, 73, now has a farm in the Dominican Republic and still remembers the game vividly.

title: Change With a Straight Face Barrels Into the Castro
description: Theres an old saying in San Francisco: Market Street is straight, until it reaches the Castro.

title: Watery Grave, Murky Law
description: Nashville

title: Bin Laden Was Dead Already
description: Paris

title: Why We Celebrate a Killing
description: Charlottesville, Va.

title: Bin Laden and the New Unknown in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  From the Talibans hidden mud compounds to NATOs headquarters in Brussels and the Pentagon, combatants in a decade-long war are asking versions of the same question: How does Osama bin Ladens death change the struggle over who will control Afghanistan?

title: Bin Ladens Secret Life in a Diminished World
description: WASHINGTON  The worlds most wanted terrorist lived his last five years imprisoned behind the barbed wire and high walls of his home in Abbottabad, Pakistan, his days consumed by dark arts and domesticity.

title: A Reporters Quest for Osama bin Laden, the Unholy Grail
description: As reporting opportunities go, few can have been more spectacularly flubbed than the one that came my way on a long-ago spring day in the former Northwest Frontier Province of Pakistan. The year was 1989; the location a cramped room at a ramshackle indoctrination camp for Arab militants in the hinterland outside Peshawar, the frontier town that was a staging area for the mujahedeen who forced Soviet troops to withdraw from Afghanistan earlier that year.

title: Steven Orszag, Pioneer in Fluid Dynamics Study, Dies at 68
description: Steven A. Orszag, a mathematician who performed pioneering work in the field of fluid dynamics and whose research had wide-ranging applications in airplane and auto design, meteorology and astrophysics, died May 1 in New Haven. He was 68.

title: Louis Stumberg, Who Brought Tex-Mex to TV Dinners, Dies at 87
description: Louis Stumberg, who along with his father and his brother shrugged off their German ancestry to found Patio Foods in 1946, bringing frozen Tex-Mex (after quick heating, of course) to dinner tables and TV viewers laps across the nation, died Wednesday at a hospital near his home in San Antonio. He was 87.

title: Joanna Russ, Who Drew Women to Sci-Fi, Dies at 74
description: Joanna Russ, a writer who four decades ago helped deliver science fiction into the hands of the most alien creatures the genre had yet seen  women  died on April 29 in Tucson. She was 74.

title: Events in Westchester
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around the Hudson Valley. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Calendar, Metropolitan, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405.

title: Events in New Jersey
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to New Jersey Calendar, Metropolitan, The New York Times, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: End of Mideast Wholesale
description: If you look into the different shop windows across the Middle East, it is increasingly apparent that the Arab uprisings are bringing to a close the era of Middle East Wholesale and ushering in the era of Middle East Retail. Everyone is going to have to pay more for their stability.

title: Running for Mayor, but With Her Money Not in Play
description: Elizabeth Lesly Stevens writes a column for The Bay Citizen.

title: Events in Connecticut
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Connecticut. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com, or by mail to Connecticut Calendar, Metropolitan, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405.

title: Events on Long Island
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Calendar, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405.

title: Food Trucks Are Stalled by Process
description: San Franciscos small army of food trucks feeds happy consumers every day. But behind the scenes, the mobile vendors have been complaining to the city for several years about a notoriously convoluted permit process.

title: Flocking to a Park to Stalk Prey
description: ALONG a wooded path in Central Parks Ramble, two photographers had set up next to each other last Sunday morning, with heavy tripods supporting elaborate cameras partly concealed by leafy camouflage material.

title: Mothers We Could Save
description: BALIGUBADLE, Somaliland

title: 30-Year-Old Capital Case Returns to Court, With Defense Alleging Bias
description: For the second time in three decades, a Texas court is preparing to decide whether Delma Banks Jr. should be executed for the 1980 shooting death of 16-year-old Richard Whitehead.

title: Women Against the Hangman
description: Benghazi, Libya

title: Mixed Reviews for Brownsville Ban on Plastic Bags
description: BROWNSVILLE  While buying groceries at the A&V Lopez supermarket this week, Rosie Orozco also spent 79 cents on something to put them in: a reusable bag emblazoned Keep Texas Green.

title: Dewhursts Curious Role in the Theater of Politics
description: Ross Ramsey, managing editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a column for the Tribune.

title: Why Should Teachers Be Blamed?
description: To the Editor:

title: Singer, Songwriter, Prodigy, All at 19
description: A little over two years ago, when Sarah Jarosz was still just 16, Alison Krauss, the acoustic music icon, listened to her demos and politely declined to co-produce her debut record. After explaining that she would be too busy working with Robert Plant, Ms. Krauss sent this message through an intermediary at Ms. Jaroszs label: Tell her theres three songs there Id cut right now. She shouldnt let me and should keep them for herself, but I think shes that good.

title: Corporate Donors
description: To the Editor:

title: Killing Evil Doesnt Make Us Evil
description: WASHINGTON

title: Chaplains for Atheists
description: To the Editor:

title: Personal Data: Safer in America or in Europe?
description: To the Editor:

title: Sunday: Working in Opposition
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Some people just like to be difficult. You say day, I say night. Tomato, tomahto. You get the idea. In todays puzzle, however, Daniel Finan has decided to play both sides of the coin, and I think it works very well.

title: Never Mind the Vast Wasteland. Minow Has More to Say
description: James Warren writes a column for the Chicago News Cooperative.

title: Pure Logo Wackiness in Wilmington
description: In Fort Wayne, Ind., fans root for the snarling apple logo of the Tin Caps, in honor of Johnny Appleseed. In Las Vegas, home of the 51s, folks cheer for an alien with a baseball-shaped head. A bear with a suitcase once promoted the Asheville (N.C.) Tourists, who now use a smiling moon wearing sunglasses.

title: Group Homes to Nurture At-Risk Youths
description: For more than 20 years, the Rev. Bruce Wellems has been a cheerleader, a confidant, a voice of reason and, at times, the only advocate for troubled children in Back of the Yards.

title: A Highly Praised Schools Bill Hits Some Snags
description: A sweeping schools bill that advocacy groups lauded as a landmark and that the federal secretary of education, Arne Duncan, described as a national model is hitting snags in the Illinois House.

title: Reader Comments on my Family Planning Column
description: My Sunday column is from Somaliland but makes an argument closer to home: that Republican cuts in family planning assistance are short-sighted and will lead to more maternal deaths. And on Mothers Day (or, as I like to style it, Mothers Day), shouldnt saving mothers lives be a top priority?

title: Democrats, Seduced by Secret Dollars
description: Last year several pro-Republican advocacy groups degraded the Congressional elections by spending at least $138 million in secret donations on advertisements. The public did not know which lobbying interests gave money, or how much, or what they would demand in return. But the donations became a significant factor in the Republican gains in the House and the Senate.

title: Videos From Bin Ladens Compound
description: On Saturday, the Obama administration released portions of five videos seized from Osama bin Ladens compound, none with audio, in part to promote its intelligence triumph.

title: New Federal Crackdown Confounds States That Allow Medical Marijuana
description: SEATTLE  Marijuana remains illegal under federal law, but that has not stopped a fuzzy industry of marijuana farms and dispensaries from rising to serve the 15 states that allow the drug to be used for medical purposes. Under President Obama, the federal government had seemed to make a point of paying little attention  until now.

title: When the Court Wont Let Go
description: ANGEL MARQUEZ was a New York City handball legend. He wore down opponents with his hustling-and-diving playing style, winning countless tournament championships since the 1970s.

title: Standing Up for Floridas Courts
description: A handful of Republican state senators in Florida bucked G.O.P. leaders last week to help Democrats block a brazenly partisan court-packing plan from gaining a place on next years ballot.

title: The Goody Pile Survives Bad News
description: The summer people will soon discover that one of their secret vacation pleasures  the obligation to personally tote their refuse to the local dump  is being altered by governments on Long Islands East End. NO salvaging, scavenging and/or picking of recyclables boomed the new sign at the Shelter Island town recycling center.

title: Fernando Torres and That Other Title Race
description: We hate you so much because we loved you so much.

title: In China, Fear of Fake Eggs and Recycled Buns
description: SHANGHAI  On a bustling corner near downtown Shanghai recently, some shoppers avoided the steamed buns sold by Zhu Qinghe in a street-side cubbyhole. Instead, they bought the packaged buns in the freezer section of Hualian, a supermarket chain store in the same building.

title: Uprooted by Rising Waters, but Not Ready to Walk Away
description: LA CENTER, Ky.  If there ever was a time for Bob Simpson to retire to his farm near this Kentucky high ground, it is now.

title: When We Hated Mom
description: Olympia, Wash.

title: Love and Junk Food
description: Cleveland Heights, Ohio

title: Pitzer College in California Adds Major in Secularism
description: Colleges and universities have long offered majors in religion or theology. But with more and more people now saying they have no religion, one college has decided to be the first to offer a major in secularism.

title: Bluegrass Blues and Grays
description: I hope to have God on my side, but I must have Kentucky, President Abraham Lincoln is reputed to have said in 1861. Whether or not he actually uttered these words, Lincoln made clear his views of his native state in a letter in the fall of that year. I think to lose Kentucky is nearly the same as to lose the whole game. Kentucky gone, we can not hold Missouri, nor, as I think, Maryland. These all against us, and the job on our hands is too large for us. We would as well consent to separation at once, including the surrender of this capitol.

title: Another M.L.S. Star Seriously Injured
description: Real Salt Lakes Javier Morales, one of the top players in Major League Soccer, sustained a broken left ankle Saturday in a match against Chivas USA at Rio Tinto Stadium in Sandy, Utah.

title: Secret Held if Bin Laden Lived Here, Village Says
description: CHAK SHAH MUHAMMAD, Pakistan  Chak Shah Muhammad, a small farming village of low brick houses, poultry farms and wheat fields, is reportedly one of Osama bin Ladens last hiding places.

title: At Last Minute, Mets Young Is Scratched
description: At 7:05 p.m. Saturday, five minutes before the Mets took the field against the Los Angeles Dodgers, the Mets announced that the right-hander Chris Young would be scratched from his start because he could not get loose in the bullpen. The rookie right-hander Dillon Gee started instead.

title: Talking to China
description: China has vowed to smooth relations with the United States. Since June, it has allowed its artificially cheap currency to rise about 5 percent against the dollar. Its huge trade surplus  a drag on global growth  has shrunk by half since its 2007 peak. During a January visit to Washington, President Hu Jintao promised to end software piracy by government agencies and procurement policies that discriminate against foreign companies. He even admitted that China had to make progress on human rights.

title: The White Houses Bedtime Bombshell
description: As Helene Cooper, a White House correspondent for The New York Times, recalled it:

title: Quartet to Present a Sonic Collage
description: Nicholas Kitchen, a founding member of Music From Copland House, speaks with great admiration about his violin. Its held together with animal glue, he said. Theres not a nail in it. And if you play it a certain way, with proper tone projection, it will speak comfortably to 3,000 people in a huge hall. Thats pretty amazing without even one volt of electricity.

title: Keeping It Classical in Interpreting French Works
description: IN a life of tremendous sweep  political refugee and Oscar winner are just two of the labels attached to his name  the pianist, composer and conductor Andr Previn has never stopped playing jazz. Mr. Previn, 82, started recording the music as a teenager, won a Grammy for it in his 30s and plays it, time and health allowing, in top clubs to this day.

title: David Mamet, Gone Victorian
description: HUDSON STAGE is doing a David Mamet play. You know what that means: fast-talking, hard-driving, foulmouthed men like the real estate agents in Glengarry Glen Ross, the small-time crooks in American Buffalo and the Hollywood types in Speed-the-Plow.

title: Lakers Face Early Exit, and the Potential for Many Off-Season Departures
description: DALLAS  Kobe Bryant moved out of the giant shadow cast by Shaquille ONeal last summer, when a grinning Bryant celebrated his fifth championship by gloating, Just got one more than Shaq.

title: A Visual Look at The Times in Overdrive
description: My column this week looks at the extraordinary efforts of Times staffers as they responded to the news of Osama Bin Ladens death in a raid by Navy Seals. Because the news broke late on print deadlines, The Times took extraordinary measures to stop the presses, remake print pages and rush to get updated copies not only to New York readers but to many readers in major cities nationwide. On top of that, the Times mounted an intense global reporting effort aimed at delivering fresh stories through the night for publication on NYTimes.com, which became the key venue for breaking developments after the print edition closed at 12:45 a.m. Monday. The result was an outpouring of fresh copy that was published online-only and then superseded eventually by new stories on Monday, some of which ultimately fed a 10-page special print section titled The Death of Bin Laden that was delivered Tuesday.

title: First Things First: Feed the Fish
description: A man of many morphs, Fred Armisen, 44, formerly the drummer for the band Trenchmouth and the male half of the comedy duo ThunderAnt, is winding up his ninth season on Saturday Night Live, where his goofily earnest impression of President Obama is a staple. He was a creator, writer and star of the cult hit Portlandia this year on IFC, and is gearing up to write Season 2. Twice divorced, he spends much, if not all, of Sunday in the Upper West Side apartment he shares with Fischie, a red cap oranda.

title: Putting Romance on the Therapists Couch
description: Prudences first date with Bruce does not go well. He talked about my breasts, she tells her psychiatrist, he has a male lover, and he wept at the table.

title: Rules and Reality Test Chefs Who Think Locally
description: CAROLE PECK cant forget the horseradish incident: 15 quarts of locally grown and preserved horseradish in the walk-in cooler of her well-known Woodbury restaurant, Good News Cafe, confiscated by the local health inspector.

title: The Taut Dance of Word and Image
description: Art and literature used to be linked more closely than they are today. Poets and novelists wrote art criticism; artists painted, sculptured and photographed writers. Now, artists are more likely to depict media celebrities, and younger critics are often the product of art history departments. So its as if one steps back in time when visiting Julio Sarmento: Artists and Writers/House and Home, a cross-media show at the Parrish Art Museum in Southampton.

title: Answers to Questions About New York
Run of Seven Birdies in Nine Holes Puts Byrd in Lead
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Before this week, Jonathan Byrd had made just one cut in seven tries at the Wells Fargo Championship, and he had shot only one round in the 60s on the demanding Quail Hollow Club course.

title: Corrections
description: NATIONAL

title: VSP Economics
description: Dean Baker and Mark Thoma both wax indignant  and rightly  over a WaPo editorial on economic policy, which says that we must act urgently on unemployment, then rules out any action.

title: A Winners Circle Full of Firsts
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Late Thursday night, John Velazquez didnt know what was worse, failing to get to the winners circle of the Kentucky Derby in 12 previous tries or not even making the starting gate with a favorite, as he had for the third straight year. He had gotten the news that Uncle Mo, last years Juvenile champion and racings latest wonder horse, was still not himself after a stomach infection and would not run.

title: The Battle for Libya | May 7
description: An attack on Misuratas fuel terminal was another escalation against the besieged city, and the second pinpoint attack by Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis forces in two nights.

title: Big G.O.P. Donors Adopt Wait-and-See 2012 Tack
description: The vaunted Republican network of high-dollar donors and fund-raisers, for so long a fear factor for Democrats, has been slow to commit itself to the 2012 presidential candidates, contributing to the faltering start of the partys drive to unseat President Obama.

title: Nuclear Agency Is Criticized as Too Close to Its Industry
description: In the fall of 2007, workers at the Byron nuclear power plant in Illinois were using a wire brush to clean a badly corroded steel pipe  one in a series that circulate cooling water to essential emergency equipment  when something unexpected happened: the brush poked through.

title: Now, to Find a Parking Spot, Drivers Look on Their Phones
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It is the urban drivers most agonizing everyday experience: the search for an empty parking place.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, May 8
description: A week after President Obama announced Osama bin Laden had been killed, the Sunday talk shows are still buzzing about what his death means for the United States. Mr. Obamas national security adviser, Thomas E. Donilon, appears on Fox News Sunday, ABCs This Week, NBCs Meet the Press and CNNs State of the Union to talk about the raid that brought down the 9/11 mastermind who has eluded capture for years.

title: Its All in the Programming: Computer Falls to a Beginner
description: It has been commonly accepted for about a decade that computers are better than people at chess. But a couple of weeks ago, a widely circulated story out of Ukraine suggested that a man who learned to play the game less than a year ago had beaten the worlds best chess program.

title: Lottery Numbers
Ethnic Soccer Teams Drift Toward Diversity
description: At first glance, it seems to be your average barren lot next to a railroad track, a sight not uncommon in the industrial neighborhood of Maspeth, Queens. But venture past the tall iron gates, at what is, oddly enough, considered the intersection of 59th and 60th Streets, and the Metropolitan Oval plays host to a good chunk of the citys ethnic soccer teams.

title: Mets Stop Ethier With a Fill-In Starters Help
description: The person most disappointed to learn that Chris Young would not pitch Saturday might have been on the opposing bench. At 7:05 p.m., five minutes before the scheduled start of the game, the Mets announced that Young could not get loose in the bullpen warming up and would be replaced by the rookie right-hander Dillon Gee.

title: Rondo Plays Through Pain as Celtics Hang On
description: BOSTON  The elbow was dislocated, according to the medical report, a diagnosis that should have sent Rajon Rondo to a hospital and the Boston Celtics into an epic tailspin. Star point guards generally need two arms to carry a team, or at least to keep their passes and shots on target.

title: Yankees Fall to the Rangers On a Play They Saw Coming
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Much happens, and much is forgotten over the course of 162 games. A result may linger, but not the final score. A great play can stick in the memory bank, but not its participants. And then there are moments that endure because of their audacity as much as their impact. One such moment occurred at Rangers Ballpark last Sept. 12, in the Yankees final regular-season meeting with Texas, and save for a few insignificant details it all but happened again Saturday night.

title: Archarcharch Fractures a Leg
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Archarcharch was pulled up past the finish line of the 137th running of the Kentucky Derby on Saturday after fracturing his left front leg. The injury was not life-threatening, according to an on-call veterinarian, Dr. Larry Bramlage.

title: Designed to Sell
description: Images from the visual books under review.

title: Kentucky Derby Replay, May 8, 2011
description: Highlights from the 137th Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs in Louisville, Ky.

title: Pacquiao Takes Decision, but Disappoints Fans
description: LAS VEGAS  For much of his welterweight title defense on Saturday, Manny Pacquiao heard from the MGM Grand crowd a unified sound rarely belted at his boxing matches. As Pacquiao and Shane Mosley tapped gloves, made small talk and generally engaged in a glorified sparring session, the crowd, once rowdy, once standing, once into it, simply booed.

title: Images of NASAs Future
description: A look at the next generation of NASA space vehicles.

title: Officers and Inmates Are Killed in Iraq Jail Revolt
description: BAGHDAD  An insurgent leader accused of plotting the deadly siege against an Iraqi church last autumn led a bloody revolt for several hours early on Sunday morning inside a Baghdad prison, the security authorities said. The prison holds some of the people suspected of being the countrys most violent terrorists.

title: Ancient Roman Portraiture Comes to Life
description: As the Romans expanded their territory and conquered the Mediterranean, they, in turn, were captivated by the portraiture of their subjugated peoples. Images of private citizens, politicians and philosophers in Etruria (what is now central Italy) and Greece influenced the way the Romans portrayed themselves in their own artwork. These external factors were blended with local traditions and gave birth to a portraiture style that was uniquely Roman.

title: Bird Week | Urban Bird Habitats
Is a Human Here and Now Bias Clouding Climate Reasoning?
description: Heres a Your Dot contribution from Jacob Tanenbaum, a computer technology teacher from Tappan, N.Y., who sent the following thoughts after reading On Birth Certificates, Climate Risk and an Inconvenient Mind:

title: When Technology Attacks
description: I recently received a panicked text from a friend who had bumped into his handsome crush on the street, an unrequited love interest who had stood him up after the two made plans for a casual date. He wanted to know what he should do. I hastily tapped out a reply. I tried to send RUNNNNNN! which my phone mistook for SEEEEEEEEEEEEEE and I accidentally sent that instead. My poor friend sent back a frantic HUH!? and I had to send a handful more to clarify and calm him down.

title: Mother Knows Best | Alanis Morissette
description: Ironic or not, the singer-songwriter Alanis Morissette does not welcome rain or clouds this Mothers Day. The Los Angeles-based mother is looking forward to repeating her familys one-year-old Mothers Day tradition of picnicking with snacks on the beach and nestling in a hammock with her husband, Mario Treadway, and son, Ever Imre, also known as lil man. She may be new to the momma gang, as she calls it, but Morissette isnt opposed to enjoying every minute of her son and the holidays perks. On her wish list? A Gracious Home picnic basket, Lainey blanket and beach bag from Heather Heron for the familys beach excursion and a Loup Charmant slip dress. Older traditions die hard. I always sing Happy Mothers Day to my mom in the tune of Happy birthday,  Morissette says. Its a sweet little offeringa thank you for having me.

title: Mama Didnt Take Your Kodachrome, She Just Moved It
description: Back in the olden days of photography  maybe 10 years ago  you carefully picked the film you used because it contributed as much to the look of your images as lighting or a lens filter. Each film had it own distinctive grain, color and contrast. If you wanted eye-popping greens for scenery, Fuji Velvia 50 was the stuff. Flattering skin tones? Kodak Portra. The list goes on.

title: Syria Broadens Deadly Crackdown on Protesters
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A military crackdown on Syrias seven-week uprising escalated Sunday, with reinforcements sent to two cities, more forces deployed in a southern town and nearly all communications severed to besieged locales, activists and human rights groups said. Fourteen people were killed in the city of Homs, they said, and hundreds were arrested.

title: The Inflation Monster Under the Bed
description: Im glad to see Greg Mankiw agreeing with me on the absence of any inflation risk in the current environment. Maybe he should have a word with everyone else in his party.

title: Japan Reaffirms Nuclear Energy Use
description: TOKYO  Japan remains committed to nuclear power despite the crisis at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Station, Prime Minister Naoto Kan indicated Sunday, as workers moved closer to repairing the crippled plant by opening the doors of a damaged reactor building.

title: Overhaul Time for U.S. Nuclear Overseers
description: Im convinced that the United States will be better off keeping existing nuclear power stations running, where their management can be demonstrated to be reliable, rather than initiating a decades-long decommissioning process that would not resolve community concerns about spent fuel and many other sources of risk.

title: Clashes in Cairo Leave 12 Dead and 2 Churches in Flames
description: CAIRO  A night of street fighting between hundreds of Muslims and Christians left at least 12 people dead and two churches in flames on Sunday in the latest outbreak of sectarian tensions in the three months since the revolution that ousted President Hosni Mubarak.

title: Dozens Injured as Train Crashes in New Jersey
description: Roughly 30 people were injured on Sunday as their PATH train in Hoboken, N.J., hit a rubberized barrier at the end of the line, said a spokesman for the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, which operates the line.

title: Montage: 'A Minister's Wife'
description: Scenes from the new musical at Lincoln Center Theater. (Video courtesy of the production.)

title: Hume Day
description: Henry Farrell tells me that I missed David Humes birthday. So, a few late notes.

title: Jack Morris Talks About His Place in History
description: I promised myself I wouldnt use any part of Sundays feature about Game 7 of the 1991 World Series to stump for Jack Morris for the Hall of Fame. Ive done that before (here and here and here), making the case as strongly as I can. More than half of the Hall of Fame voters agree, but at 53.5 percent, hes still well shy of the 75 percent needed for election.

title: Southeast Asia Talks Leave Two Key Issues Unresolved
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  A meeting of Southeast Asian leaders ended here on Sunday with two significant issues unresolved, which led some analysts to question the leaders ability to confront entrenched problems.

title: Vote Forces Singapores Leader to Reconsider Style
description: BANGKOK  Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said Sunday that his Peoples Action Party would re-examine its style of government after it was returned to power with its lowest percentage of the popular vote and its biggest loss of parliamentary seats since Singapores independence in 1965.

title: Israeli Strike on Iran Would Be Stupid, Ex-Spy Chief Says
description: JERUSALEM  Israels former intelligence chief has said that a strike on Irans nuclear installations would be a stupid idea, adding that military action might not achieve all of its goals and could lead to a long war.

title: The Invisible Bond Vigilantes Have Resumed Their Invisible Attack
description: Look at 10-year TIPS yields:

title: A Regrettable First for U.S. Tennis
description: Monday is a historic day for United States tennis, one that will generate no rejoicing in the American tennis community.

title: Abbas Urges Continuation of U.S. Aid Despite Agreement With Hamas
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority beseeched a group of visiting American Jews on Sunday to urge Congress not to cut off hundreds of millions of dollars in aid as a result of his recent unity agreement with Hamas, the Islamist group that controls Gaza.

title: U.S. Raises Pressure on Pakistan in Raids Wake
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas national security adviser demanded Sunday that Pakistan let American investigators interview Osama bin Ladens three widows, adding new pressure in a relationship now fraught over how Bin Laden could have been hiding near Islamabad for years before he was killed by commandos last week.

title: Derby Winner Sets Shining Example for Wayward Industry
description: LOUSIVILLE, KY  Even though the winner has a Brazilian-bred sire and a German-bred dam, the 137th Kentucky Derby made a big run toward retaining its eminence as the worlds greatest race. The reasons are legion.

title: Bahrain Says It Will End State of Emergency
description: JERUSALEM  The king of Bahrain said Sunday that the state of emergency he imposed in mid-March to quell antigovernment protests on that strategic and contested island will end June 1.

title: Feel The Rapacity
description: One commenter on my inflation monster post suggests that while private-sector wages may be going nowhere, the story is different for rapacious workers in the public sector. Ah, those pillaging schoolteachers (because thats largely who were talking about).

title: Reads & Reactions
description: In this edition of Reads & Reactions: partisan labels, gasoline politics, a G.O.P. debate, birth certificates and blogging for free.

title: Vettel Dominates Eventful Turkish Grand Prix
description: ISTANBUL  Sebastian Vettel cruised from pole to victory in the Turkish Grand Prix on Sunday, taking his third victory out of four races this season.

title: Vettel Dominates Eventful Turkish Grand Prix
description: ISTANBUL  Sebastian Vettel cruised from pole to victory in the Turkish Grand Prix on Sunday, taking his third victory out of four races this season.

title: Nearing 50th Birthday, Pate Looks Forward to New Tour
description: ATHENS, Ga.  What does Steve Pate have to look forward to when he turns 50 at the end of this month?

title: European Ventures Seek to Fill a Void in World News
description: PARIS  As news organizations around the world close down foreign bureaus, journalists, entrepreneurs and even government bodies in Europe are creating news ventures to try to fill the void.

title: Muscle Memory: The Training of Navy Seals Commandos
description: They are Americas Jedi knights: the elite of the elite, an all-star team of commandos, tier one special operations warriors given mission-impossible assignments in the most dangerous parts of the planet. A week ago, when Seal Team 6 took out public enemy No. 1, Osama bin Laden, Jon Stewart hailed its members as real-life X-Men, ABC compared them to Superman, and Newsweek described them as the coolest guys in the world, working anonymously and without public recognition. Each year, according to the Navy Seals Web site, about 1,000 men start Seals training, and usually about only 200 to 250 succeed. Basic training includes the infamous hell week: five and a half days in which candidates sleep only a total of four hours and must run more than 200 miles, and do physical training for more than 20 hours per day. And after years of more training, only a fraction of experienced Seals members go on to join Seal Team 6, a secret unit created after the failed attempt in 1980 to rescue American hostages in Iran and tasked mainly with counterterrorism and counterinsurgency assignments.

title: The Morning Line: Spoils Go to Animal Kingdom
description: With the running of the Kentucky Derby, the saga of Uncle Mo has largely been forgotten, and all the news concerns the running and the race and the victory of 20 -1 Animal Kingdom.

title: Feeding Time at the Nest
description: A video recorded on Sunday submitted by a reader, Jeff Folmsbee.

title: A Well-Traveled Sailor Tackles Prospect Park
description: Under an angry sky, the young captain stood the helm surveying unfamiliar waters.

title: Young Put on D.L.; Offense Cant Pick Up Slack
description: Black equipment bags cluttered the floor of the Mets clubhouse late Sunday afternoon, a sign that the team was about to hit the road. So much has gone right for the Mets in the last 18 days that they generally regarded splitting a six-game homestand as a disappointment.

title: ONeal, No Stranger to Change, May Soon See More
description: BOSTON  Shaquille ONeal received an ovation from the TD Garden crowd for standing up and walking to the scorers table late in the first quarter. Along the way, he sustained no injury and made it through eight and a half minutes of his first game action in more than two months.

title: AOLs Leader Undaunted in Overhaul Efforts
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  Tim Armstrong, AOLs chief executive, will tell just about anyone who will listen that AOL is not some washed-up tech company from another era.

title: Now to Sell Advertisers on Tablets
description: If you wanted to get your message in front of a reader of The New Yorker, it would cost you $141,174 for a full-page ad in the magazines glossy pages.

title: Televisions Curse Was Its Blessing
description: Television shows, Web sites and apps are not considered cultural artifacts, and never will be. Theyre public health hazards, like cigarettes and junk food.

title: To Grow, an Agency Breaks Down Walls
description: ALEADING digital agency is expanding its portfolio of services as part of efforts to help wean marketers and other agencies  and perhaps reporters, too  off the notion that agencies still need to be labeled digital or traditional.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: An Idol Reunion on The X Factor
description: Simon Cowells televised singing competition The X Factor, coming to Fox in September, now appears to have a complete cast. Fox announced on Saturday that the singer Nicole Scherzinger and British television personality Steve Jones would host the show. And on Sunday Paula Abdul was named a judge. Ms. Abdul will fill the final seat at the judges table, where Mr. Cowell, Antonio Reid (known as L..A.) and Cheryl Cole will also sit.

title: Incentives Play Role in Success of Netflix
The Partisan Corners of the News
Plush and Lyrical Strauss (and Thats Just the Conducting)
description: These days people may forget that Fabio Luisi, the Metropolitan Operas principal guest conductor, made his acclaimed company debut in 2005 in Verdis Don Carlo. In the last couple of seasons Mr. Luisi has appeared at the company mostly as a pinch-hitter for James Levine. In April he stepped in again for an ailing Mr. Levine and conducted a compelling performance of Wagners Rheingold.

title: A Digital Critique of a Famous Autobiography
description: IARRIVED at Butler Library on the Columbia campus last week, showed my ID and was directed to a fifth-floor room where I could examine in person a trove of documents related to Malcolm X.

title: Monday: No Matter What Happens
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Its always a pleasure to see people who are longtime solvers learn the art of puzzle construction. Constructing is a totally different skill set than solving, and contrary to popular opinion, its also a different skill set than that needed to be good at a game like Scrabble.

title: Nurturer of Authors Is Closing the Book
description: If anyone is qualified to talk about the good old days of book publishing, it is Robert Loomis.

title: A Crusher of Cars, a Molder of Metal
description: SHELTER ISLAND, N.Y.  When a visitor pulled up outside an elegant shingled house here on a recent morning, three intact cars with familiar names  a Mitsubishi, a Land Rover, a Ford  were parked in the driveway. Next to them, wheel-less and sitting atop shipping pallets, were two sinuous, towering conglomerations of paint-encrusted steel that had clearly once been cars but that had been crushed, twisted, crumpled and squeezed into another realm of existence, somewhere between oblivion and timelessness.

title: Cavendish Craftiness
description: The final 28-board session of the Cavendish Invitational Pairs was played on Sunday in Henderson, Nev., ending late in the day. (Results are at cavendish.bridgewinners.com.) Leading going into Sunday were Bobby Levin and Steve Weinstein, who were trying for a threepeat.

title: Obamas YouTube Star Turn
description: President Obama was a YouTube star twice over the last week.

title: Casting Light on Taiwanese Cinema
description: At the turn of the century Taiwanese cinema had a moment, albeit a quiet one that the average American filmgoer probably missed. Edward Yangs magnificent family drama Yi Yi was named the best film of 2000, in any language, by the National Society of Film Critics. Hou Hsiao-Hsien and Tsai Ming-Liang, Mr. Yangs compatriots in the movement known as the Taiwanese New Wave or the New Taiwan Cinema, were at or near the peaks of their renown; Mr. Hous Millennium Mambo and Mr. Tsais What Time Is It Over There? were both released in 2001.

title: Tens of Thousands March in Mexico City
description: MEXICO CITY  Javier Sicilia, the poet who has become an unlikely hero in a movement calling for an end to Mexicos drug war, asked for five minutes of silence at the end of a Sunday rally in this citys giant central plaza.

title: Jeter Finds Power Stroke, and Texas Pays
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Divining the key to Derek Jeters success over 17 seasons is not difficult. He abides by a simple credo, believing that keeping things uncomplicated is the only way to live. As his Yankees teammates and coaches hailed his revival after Sundays 12-5 victory against the Rangers, Jeter offered a verbal shrug.

title: The Mystery That Wont Go Away
description: It is hard to think of another mystery in recent history that has fired the engines of cultural production quite like the disappearance of Natalee Holloway, the Alabama teenager presumed to have been killed during a senior class trip to Aruba in 2005. The case has been the subject of more than a half-dozen nonfiction books (the latest, Portrait of a Monster: Joran van der Sloot, a Murder in Peru, and the Natalee Holloway Mystery, arrives in July), episodes on both Law & Order: SVU and Law & Order: Criminal Intent, uncountable hours of Nancy Grace on CNN and an entire subspecies of dramatic programming on Lifetime.

title: Diving Into the Simulacrum, Moptop First
description: Yuck really nails the drone, that low, slow guitar moan of the early 1990s  not guttural in a grunge way, but something a little more restrained and polite, maybe even a bit resigned.

title: Something Borrowed and Something New
description: Spring for Music, the new festival of North American symphony and chamber orchestras at Carnegie Hall, started on a relatively subdued note on Friday night with the Orpheus Chamber Orchestra, but caught fire on Saturday evening with the Toledo Symphony.

title: Response to Volatility in Silver Takes Hold
description: On April 25, half a dozen officials from the CME Group, which runs many of the nations commodities exchanges, met via videophone to discuss the eye-popping rise in the price of silver, which had doubled in just six months to about $47 a troy ounce.

title: Roaring Back With Rumba and Religion
description: Rhythm serves both gods and lovers in the music of Los Muequitos de Matanzas, the venerable Cuban group that returned to New York City last week for the first time since 2002 with concerts at Symphony Space. Presented by the World Music Institute, the three shows were part of the citywide S Cuba! festival.

title: Bacharach Musical to Open in San Diego
description: Burt Bacharachs new musical, Some Lovers, will have its debut at the Old Globe theater in San Diego this year, Playbill reported. Mr. Bacharach, whose I Say a Little Prayer and Do You Know the Way to San Jose? are among his most famous pop songs, wrote the music to the show, which is based on The Gift of the Magi, the O. Henry short story. The book and lyrics are by Steven Sater (Spring Awakening). Some Lovers is to run Nov. 26 to Dec. 31 as part of the Old Globes 2011-12 season, which also includes the premieres of works by Matthew Lopez (The Whipping Man), Gaby Alter and Itamar Moses, and Jonathan Caren, as well as the West Coast premiere of The Scottsboro Boys.

title: Thor Shows Box-Office Muscle
description: Marvel did it again: Thor, a thundering big-screen debut for the comic-book realms god of thunder, played by Chris Hemsworth, right, was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend with an estimated $66 million in ticket sales. Imax theaters, showing their might with the fan-boy audience, contributed a notable 10 percent of that total. Thor (produced by Disney-owned Marvel for about $150 million and distributed by Paramount Pictures) has taken in an additional $176 million overseas. Fast Five (Universal Pictures) dropped 62 percent in its second weekend to second place, taking in about $32.5 million for a new total of about $140 million, according to Hollywood.com, which compiles box-office statistics. Jumping the Broom (Sony Pictures Entertainment) was third with a stronger-than-expected $13.7 million. Something Borrowed, a romantic comedy from Warner Brothers, was fourth with about $13.2 million. Rio (20th Century Fox) chugged along in fifth place, selling about $8.2 million in tickets for a four-week total of $114.9 million. The Beaver, representing Mel Gibsons first film since his domestic meltdown and Jodie Fosters third attempt at directing, was essentially ignored, taking in $104,000 in 22 theaters.

title: Contrite Cisco Regroups Before Skeptical Wall St.
description: SAN FRANCISCO  John T. Chambers, one of the best salesmen in Silicon Valley, has been having trouble selling anyone on his companys future.

title: Books to Square Off on a Facebook App
description: Simon & Schuster has created a Facebook app called Book Battle, a literary version of hotornot.com. Users can vote on book covers, games, authors or characters, which will be presented in slide-show format. The app could give the publisher the opportunity to gauge readers preferences, drum up interest in its books and build a presence in social media. The first matchups on the app will feature two young-adult series by Cassandra Clare, The Mortal Instruments and The Infernal Devices, the publisher said on Sunday.

title: Exit for Jackson Comes Sooner Than Expected
description: DALLAS  Phil Jackson took the final stroll alone. His players rushed in front of him and into an off-season of scrutiny and uncertainty. His faithful assistants  Frank Hamblen, Brian Shaw and Jim Cleamons  paced behind him. Away from the court and in the concrete maze in the depths of the American Airlines Center, Jackson cracked a smile, the calm in the storm, during his walk toward retirement Sunday.

title: Favoring Immigration if Not the Immigrant
description: WASHINGTON  So deeply has the phrase a nation of immigrants seeped into the American psyche that millions of people reflexively use it while few know who coined the phrase. (It was Senator John F. Kennedy, in a 1958 book by that name.)

title: Ariadne auf Naxos
description: Photos from the production at the Metropolitan Opera.

title: A TV Project Planned on Female Leadership
description: The Independent Television Service and the Corporation for Public Broadcasting are teaming up for a three-year, 50-film project called Women and Girls Lead, which will put a documentary spotlight on leadership roles of women and girls and the challenges they face in the United States and worldwide.

title: Reaction to Manchester United-Chelsea
description: Manchester United essentially won the Premier League title on Sunday, stunning Chelsea with a first-minute goal by Javier Hernandez and holding on to win, 2-1.

title: N.F.L. Considers Forcing New Testing Standards
description: The N.F.L. has talked to the World Anti-Doping Agency about overseeing testing of players for performance-enhancing drugs if a federal appeals court forces the league to stop the lockout and put in place rules for operating the league this season, an N.F.L. official briefed on its planning said.

title: A Daring Improviser Who Made Amazing Look Simple
description: The joy of watching the worlds best golfers, especially Jack Nicklaus and Tiger Woods, involved their accuracy and precision. In the fairway off the tee, on the green in regulation, often with a makeable birdie putt. But with Seve Ballesteros, the dashing matador from Spain who died over the weekend with complications from a brain tumor, the joy was watching him escape from tangled rough or clumps of bushes or towering tree limbs.

title: Bulldogs Under the Rug? Signs of a Putin-Medvedev Rift
description: MOSCOW  For three years, the power-sharing tandem of Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin and President Dmitri A. Medvedev purred along like a sports car, quieting skeptics who said that any division of executive authority in Russia would lead to instability. The ambiguous arrangement seemed to soothe tensions, allowing everyone, from pro-Western technocrats to hawkish hard-liners, to believe they were represented at the very top.

title: Balancing Radiations Benefits and Risks
description: To the Editor:

title: Justice Dept. to Continue Policy Against Same-Sex Marriage
description: After two instances in which deportations were suspended in immigration cases involving same-sex couples, the Justice Department has cautioned that it will continue to enforce a law that bars the federal government from recognizing same-sex marriages.

title: A Jewish Date, Then a Movie
description: LOS ANGELES  JDate, the Web-based dating service, has been helping singles find friendship, romance and lifelong partners within the Jewish faith. It can also hook you up with a movie.

title: Tight Race for Congress Prompts Visit by Boehner
