title: Details on the Investigation of George Raab III
description: A letter to the chancellor of New York Citys public schools provides details on how the former chief financial officer, George Raab III, used consultants time and the e-mail system inappropriately to plot his exit to a private financial firm.

title: Mets Medical Report
description: CHICAGO  General Manager Sandy Alderson provided several updates regarding injured players late Tuesday night, most notably regarding David Wright and Johan Santana.

title: Heats Superstars Grind Out a Win
description: MIAMI  Shots were blocked, basketballs clanked off rims and turnovers abounded, testing the egos of the superstars who dotted the floor of American Airlines Arena on Tuesday night.

title: The South Endures the Buzz of the Latest Cicada Year
description: ATLANTA  We may not be able to predict the Rapture. But here in the South, people can tell you the exact week the cicada plague will hit. Every 13 years, the cicadas come like clockwork, or a biblical curse.

title: French Minister to Seek Top I.M.F. Job
description: PARIS  Europes top candidate to lead the International Monetary Fund, Christine Lagarde, the French finance minister, formally announced her bid on Wednesday, as developing nations issued an unusual joint complaint about the custom of always naming a European to one of the most important jobs in global finance.

title: News Quiz | May 25, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: The Facts (and Fiction) of Tornadoes
description: Q: How bad has this years tornado season been, relative to other years?

title: After a Silent Spring, NASA Gives Up on Spirit
description: NASA said on Tuesday that it was abandoning efforts to get back in touch with the Spirit, one of the two rovers on Mars. The Spirit got stuck in a sand trap two years ago and then fell silent last year as winter arrived and its solar panels could no longer generate enough electricity. Engineers had hoped it would revive in the spring, but they never heard from it again. Its twin, Opportunity, continues to operate on the other side of the planet.

title: Obama Will Visit Puerto Rico
description: President Obama will visit Puerto Rico on June 14, the first official visit by a sitting president since John F. Kennedy stopped there, in 1961. Since the beginning of my administration, we have been working in close collaboration with the president and his administration to make this historic visit a reality, Gov. Luis Fortuno, of Puerto Rico, a Republican, said in announcing the trip. President Gerald R. Ford visited in 1976, but he was there as a member of the Group of Seven economic summit, not on an official presidential visit.

title: California: San Jose Moves to Cut Budget Gap
description: San Jose approved plans on Tuesday to work on measures that could cut city contributions to retirement plans for current employees, raise retirement ages and tighten eligibility for retirees health care. Mayor Chuck Reed, a Democrat, said the measures were necessary to confront a $115 million budget gap. The city eliminated 800 jobs last year and is facing a fiscal disaster, Mr. Reed said.

title: Test Yourself | Math, May 25, 2011
description: Test your math skills with todays question, created by Kari Kokka at Math for America from the article The Class That Built Apps, and Fortunes.

title: Brazil: Amazon Bill Advances
description: Brazils lower house of Congress overwhelmingly approved revisions to a key environmental law that would open up land in the Amazon rain forest for agriculture and grant amnesty to producers who deforested protected areas. The Senate still must vote on the measure, which conservationists say could accelerate the pace of deforestation.

title: The End of an Oprah Era

title: Joplin Faces Sad Task of Clearing the Rubble
description: JOPLIN, Mo.  As rescue workers continue to sift through the wreckage of this city piece by piece, hoping to unearth survivors and victims of a lethal tornado, local leaders have been wrestling with the difficult question of when to start cleaning up the destroyed area.

title: Is 14 a Magic Age for Forming Cultural Tastes?
description: In an Op-Ed celebrating Bob Dylans 70th birthday Tuesday, one writer suggests that the cultural tastes you develop at age 14, especially in music, can influence your tastes for the rest of your life. What music did you love at 14? What books, movies, television shows or video games? How do you think these artistic tastes will continue to influence you?

title: At Least 14 People Are Killed in Storms in 3 States
description: Residents of the South and Midwest braced for another round of severe weather on Wednesday, only hours after at least 15 people were killed in a series of storms that struck portions of Arkansas, Kansas and Oklahoma, where nine people died.

The official White House photo by Pete Souza  showing the two leaders huddling outside the Oval Office on Friday  didnt make life easy for picture editors.

title: German Air Traffic Resumes

title: Could Conjoined Twins Share a Mind?
description: It was bedtime for Krista and Tatiana Hogan, and the 4-year-old twin girls were doing what 4-year-olds everywhere do at bedtime. They were stalling, angling for more time awake. Their grandmother, Louise McKay, who lives with the girls and their parents in Vernon, a small city in British Columbia, was speaking to them in soothing tones, but the girls resorted to sleep-deferring classics of the toddler repertory. I want one more hug! Krista said to their grandmother, and then a few minutes later, they both called out to her, in unison, I miss you!

title: Aw, Shucks | Elliotts Oyster House
description: Theres a renaissance in the shellfish world right now, especially oysters, says Robert Spaulding, the executive chef at Elliotts Oyster House in Seattle. Elliotts considers the oyster to be emblematic of the Pacific Northwests thriving farm-to-table  or, in this case, beach-to-bar  dining scene. Elliotts has an expansive raw bar and many direct relationships with Northwestern oyster growers. As Spaulding puts it, shucking knife in hand and flanked by a seemingly endless battalion of shells on ice, Its part of that movement to get out there and create something yourself.

title: Pretty Princesses, Not So Grimm
description: Because there is nothing original about Grimms fairy tales, theyre fair game for endless reimagining and revamping, even if it means turning Little Red Riding Hood into a very grown-up-looking Amanda Seyfried. Two new picture book retellings, Rapunzel, by Sarah Gibb (The Tiara Club), and Twelve Dancing Princesses by Brigette Barrager, take a gentler approach, bringing lovely, distinctive illustrations to highly sweetened variations on two Grimms classics.

description: PARIS  Kei Nishikori of Japan searched the crowd with a glance after he won the second set Wednesday against Sergiy Stakhovsky of Ukraine. About a thousand spectators had crowded into seats on Court 6 at Roland Garros.

title: An Ancient Watery Underworld

title: Who Made That Purple Heart?
description: In 1782, George Washington created the Badge of Military Merit to honor any enlisted American for, in Washingtons words, any singularly meritorious action  not only instances of unusual gallantry, but also of extraordinary fidelity and essential service in any way. Washington described the form of the honor as the figure of a heart in purple cloth or silk, edged with narrow lace or binding. Only a handful of people have been known to receive that high standing, all of which were awarded in 1783.

title: Washington National Opera Names Glimmerglass Chief as Artistic Adviser
description: Francesca Zambello, a busy director of opera and theater and the artistic and executive director of the Glimmerglass Festival, has been appointed artistic adviser of the Washington National Opera  heralding a possible link between the institutions, officials said on Wednesday. The appointment is part of the Washington companys reorganization as it merges with the Kennedy Center, which was a response to the Washington operas financial troubles. Plcido Domingo, the companys general manager, is departing next month. Washington National Opera also announced that its chief operating officer, Michael L. Mael, had been named executive director.

title: Jerusalem Gets Four-Week Extension on Broadway
description: Mark Rylance had better have a healthy appetite for the concoction of milk and a raw egg that he consumes at the opening of Jerusalem eight shows a week, because hes going to be swigging it down for an additional month: that Jez Butterworth play, in which Mr. Rylance stars as the manly, mangy, quasi-magical trailer denizen Johnny Rooster Byron, will extend its run at Broadways Music Box Theater by four weeks, press representatives for the production said on Wednesday. Its limited run will now end on Aug. 21, having previously been scheduled to conclude on July 24.

title: U.N. Warns of Ethnic Cleansing in Sudan Town
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  After seizing a disputed town on the border of the breakaway region of southern Sudan on Saturday, the army of northern Sudan is now facilitating a relatively large influx of nomadic people into the area, according to new United Nations field reports.

description: A look at some of the production designs for Kung Fu Panda 2.

title: On the Up | GoDown Arts Centre
description: Watch me, watch me, says a young boy in a bright yellow T-shirt, as he juggles a set of large clubs with his small hands. He hasnt quite gotten the moves down, but his clumsy performance is eclipsed by his giant smile. Across the lofty room, a group of young men practice balancing on two piles of rough-edged bricks  on two hands, on one hand, legs moving in all directions.

description: PARIS  The French Open opened Wednesday without a cloud in the sky, and the tournament favorites in action have found clear sailing heading toward the evening.

description: NEW DELHI  When Bob Haygooni paid a midflight visit to a cockpit at his new employer, Air India, he was shocked. The pilots, he said, had completely covered the windows with newspaper to keep out the sun.

title: Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo.
description: As Steven Pinker points out, the above is a grammatical sentence. You have to posit that theres a kind of buffalo called a Buffalo buffalo; what the sentence then asserts is that beast of this kind, if buffaloed  that is, intimidated  by fellow members of their species, go on to do the same to other co-speciesists. Buffalo buffalo that are buffaloed by Buffalo buffalo go on to buffalo Buffalo buffalo themselves.

title: Joyce Meets Twitter: Boiling Down Ulysses
description: Stately, plump Buck Mulligan came from the stairhead, bearing a bowl of lather on which a mirror and a razor lay crossed. Seventeen characters left to complete a tweet. It just might work. What would James Joyce think of Twitter? More important, what would his handle be? Its impossible not to imagine the inherent fun the great English-language experimentalist would find in translating his voluminous ideas onto the 140-character template, or at least the irresistible challenge.

title: Tahrir Square: Is It Good for the Christians?
description: After the flags were packed away, the euphoria faded and protesters swept all of the dropped signs and cigarette butts out of Tahrir Square, politicians around the world started to ask what if? What if the Muslim Brotherhood gains power? What if they stifle freedoms in Egypt or threaten peace with Israel? President Obama recently announced $1 billion of debt relief and $1 billion in loans for Egypt. But as David E. Sanger reported this weekend, one of Obamas strategists said, We think theres a Muslim Brotherhood exception to the aid package.
