description: Who: AmorePacific, one of South Koreas oldest beauty brands.

title: Spamalytics
description: Term used by a team of computer scientists investigating spam emails.(Spam + analytics.)

title: Creating Kegasus
description: The Paulick Report talked with Jimmy Learned, the founder and president of the advertising agency Elevation Ltd., which created the Get Your Preak On and Kegasus campaigns for the Preakness in 2010 and 2011:

title: American Hero in Canada
description: There are a variety of possible reactions to the Miami Heat appearing poised to crash the N.B.A. finals after Tuesday nights victory over the Chicago Bulls: joy, grudging acceptance, pure unadulterated misery (headquarters: Cleveland) and just plain fatigue. Yes, the Big Three, above all its other attributes, is overexposed, every sigh and hangnail analyzed for social and political implications. Well get to todays overexposure, but first, perhaps, a bit of an antidote.

title: Bikini-Ready? Whos Judging?
description: EVERY spring, as sure as cherry blossoms bloom, so does the notion that women should diet, exercise and even liposuction their way to bikini-ready bodies. Magazines like Shape and Self reinforce the idea that preparation is essential, with months-long bikini body countdowns (100-calorie snack tips included) and workout DVDs like Bikini Ready Fast! as if the beach reveal were a test on par with the MCAT and only a slacker would settle for a one-piece.

title: Panda vs. Peacock: The Showdown
description: HOW hard is it to maintain a life of awesomeness? Its not as simple as one particular panda skilled in the martial arts would like. In Kung Fu Panda 2, the follow-up to Dreamworks Animations 2008 hit, Jack Black returns as the voice of Po, the clownish panda with a laid-back vibe who becomes the Dragon Warrior, keeping order in the Valley of Peace with help from his fellow kung fu masters, the Furious Five. But when a villainous peacock, Lord Shen (Gary Oldman), emerges with a weapon that will aid him in taking over not just the valley but all of China and put an end to kung fu, Po and the Furious Five must figure out a way to defeat this dangerous fowl.

title: House Hunting in ... Finland
description: TWO-BEDROOM CO-OP WITH A SEA VIEW IN HELSINKI

title: Israelis See Netanyahu Trip as Diplomatic Failure
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel returned from Washington on Wednesday to a nearly unanimous assessment among Israelis that despite his forceful defense of Israels security interests, hopes were dashed that his visit might advance peace negotiations with the Palestinians.

title: Fossil Extends Life Span of a Marine Predator
description: The largest animal species of the Cambrian period, a marine predator with a segmented body and a pair of grasping appendages, lived much longer than previously thought and grew to sizes much larger than previously known.

title: A New York Debut for Textile Recycling
description: No more hauling your hand-me-downs in plastic bags and shopping carts to your nearest green market or thrift shop, New Yorkers. City officials say they have partnered with Housing Works, a group that helps homeless people infected with the H.I.V. virus, to pick up donated clothing at apartment buildings in one of the first large-scale consumer textile recycling programs in the Country.

title: Obamas Reference to Kenyan Roots Draws Applause in Britain
description: Unlike the American Congress, which interrupted the Israeli prime ministers speech with 29 standing ovations on Tuesday, the British Parliament forced Americas president to stop for applause just once during his address in London on Wednesday.

title: Battle Over Lagoon Cleanup Divides a Surfing Haven
description: MALIBU, Calif.  It was a cool weekday afternoon, but dozens of surfers were bobbing in the water, waiting for a wave. This was Malibu: the national symbol of surfing, adored by California wave riders for 50 years, near the famous stretch of coast where Annette Funicello and Frankie Avalon partied on the beach.

title: Thomaz Belluccis Improving Game
description: Thomaz Bellucci advanced to the third round with a convincing straight-sets win over Andreas Seppi. Bellucci was never broken, and kept Seppi off balance by varying his lefty serve like a pitcher with masterly control. Of the 67 points Bellucci served, Seppi managed to win only 13 points, and only 5 points on Belluccis first serve.

title: Dont Stop, Stevie Fans
description: A Night of 1,000 Stevies in New York City.

title: A Former Geek Offers Hope
description: A FEW years ago I wrote an article about Rosie ODonnell that made her mad. She told a gossip columnist I must have been that nerdy Jewish kid in high school who ran the A.V. club. The columnist called me for a reaction, and I had to correct Ms. ODonnell. Actually, I was the president of the Herpetology Society.

title: The Crossover on Display
description: The crossover is one of the most lethal offensive moves in the N.B.A. Miamis Dwyane Wade found inspiration for his version from players like Allen Iverson and Tim Hardaway.

title: Miamis Fluid Rotation Pays Off
description: For a night, Mike Miller was a star. He converted from inside and out, initiated the fast break and racked up rebounds in Game 4. His influence on the court was just as significant as that of any player on the floor; despite sharing the court with the likes of LeBron James, Derrick Rose and Dwyane Wade, Miller posted the games highest plus-minus rating (plus-36), a testament to his impact. He did the little things and hit the big shots, and in a game with a razor-thin margin for error, its not hyperbolic to say that Millers 12 points and team-high nine rebounds made all the difference.

title: Detroit Symphony Orchestra Concertmaster Is Leaving
description: The Detroit Symphony Orchestra, struggling to find its feet after a bitter six-month strike, has suffered another loss. Its concertmaster of 23 years, Emmanuelle Boisvert, is moving to the Dallas Symphony Orchestra as an associate concertmaster. The announcement, which came on Wednesday, was made not by the Detroit Symphony but by a committee of orchestra members that was set up during the strike and sponsored their own concerts. The orchestras spokeswoman, Elizabeth Weigandt, confirmed the move and said Ms. Boisvert had told the players but not yet formally informed orchestra management. Management has the news release, and thats what weve got, she said.

title: Rafalski Retires, Pain Trumping Money
description: In the end, Red Wings defenseman Brian Rafalski couldnt deny the painful truth his body had been telling him all season.

title: Rolls-Royce Photographer Channels Ecstasy, but Not in Manhattan
description: At the Milk Gallery in Manhattans meatpacking district on Tuesday night, hundreds of guests wandered among the photographs of a new show by Rankin, the British photographer of fashion, celebrities and titillating nudes.

title: East 79th Street, 10:26 A.M.
description: City Councilwoman Melissa Mark-Viverito, left, joined protesters against the citys marijuana arrest policies at demonstration half a block from the mayors house. More people were arrested in New York City on marijuana possession charges last year than in the entire period from 1978 to 1996. The arrests cost $75 million and disproportionately involve blacks and Hispanics, advocates say.

title: Survival Strategies for Orchestras
description: FROM the recent string of crises at symphony orchestras you might conclude that orchestral business models are as outdated as the musicians Victorian attire. The Philadelphia Orchestra filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in April; the Honolulu Symphony and the Syracuse Symphony Orchestra recently folded; and musicians of the Detroit Symphony had their pay cut after a six-month strike. In a turbulent economy that has carried a wide range of organizations, including arts groups, banks and newspapers, to the brink, orchestras are being forced to re-examine their missions and structures to accommodate a changing fiscal and social landscape.

title: Tweet on the Street
description: Most Wall Street employees cant access sites like Facebook and Twitter, a move by banks to control the dissemination of information.

title: On Top, Unafraid to Step Back
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.

title: Bartoli Outlasts Govortsova to Reach Third Round
description: PARIS  Marion Bartolis long black hair stretches to her waist and often flies into her face during especially prolonged rallies, when she runs from sideline to sideline.

title: Caucus | Democrat Takes G.O.P Seat
description: Megan Liberman and Carolyn Ryan discuss the upset in New York's 26th Congressional District and what it might mean for the fight over Medicare.

title: Finding the Next Mark Zuckerberg
description: Peter Thiel University is now in session.

title: On Bloomberg Editorials, the Comptroller, and Housekeepers
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg rarely misses a chance to proclaim his views at daily news conferences  on the economy, politics, philanthropy, art, traffic and, well, you get the idea.

title: Reyes Ties Record for Consecutive Winless Starts
description: Jo-Jo Reyes didnt take long to tie a major league record Tuesday.

title: Ignoring Typical Siblings
description: The cover story of The New York Times Magazine this weekend (you can read it online here) is a riveting look at two 4-year-old girls  conjoined twins  who seem able to feel each others sensations and read each others thoughts. It is fascinating science. It is also a thought-provoking parenting story.

title: Getting Cheaper Vanguard Funds in Your 401(k)
description: In response to Ron Liebers column on why 401(k) plans should offer more low-cost index funds, a reader wrote asking why, as a 401(k) participant, he cant buy a lower-expense class of Vanguard shares that are available to clients who have individual Vanguard brokerage or IRA accounts.

title: The Morning Line: Baffert Looking to the Belmont
description: Not unexpectedly, Wednesday is fairly slow for Triple Crown news.

title: Derivatives Without Borders vs. Dodd-Frank
description: The Dodd-Frank financial regulatory law spans nearly 1,000 pages  but apparently not the United States border.

title: Wistful Country, Politics and a Hint of the Divine
description: Matraca Berg

title: Classical Recordings
description: HARRISON BIRTWISTLE: NIGHTS BLACK BIRD,

title: After Long Dry Spell, a German Revival
description: PARIS  It is early, much too early, to start talking about a full-blown German tennis renaissance.

title: Russia Is Invited to Join O.E.C.D. Anti-Bribery Pact
description: MOSCOW  A group of nations working to outlaw bribery in international trade invited Russia to join their pact at a ceremony Wednesday in Paris, after the Russian Parliament passed a law this spring prohibiting Russian companies from bribing foreign officials.

title: Draghi Receives Warm Welcome in Germany
description: BERLIN  Mario Draghi received a warm welcome Wednesday in his first public appearance in Germany since being officially nominated to become the next president of the European Central Bank.

title: U.S. Government Adds Hybrids and E.V.s to Car Fleet
description: As part of its effort to make the federal fleet greener and put a million hybrid and electric vehicles on the road by 2015, the Obama administration took a relatively small step Tuesday by purchasing 101 Chevrolet Volt plug-in hybrids, as well as 15 battery-powered E.V.s.

title: UBS Hires 2 From Morgan Stanley
description: UBS, which announced last that it had hired Thomas Langford from Morgan Stanley to be global head of energy investment banking, has now poached two more from Morgan Stanley.

title: Video: Was the Special Election a Bellwether?
description: Megan Liberman talks with Carolyn Ryan, Metro editor, discuss the upset in New Yorks 26th Congressional District and what it might mean for the fight over Medicare.

title: No Rest for the Weary? Analyzing Sleep Habits
description: Overview | How much sleep does the average teenager need? How do the natural sleep rhythms of most adolescents sometimes conflict with the typical high school schedule? In this lesson, students explore their own sleep habits by keeping sleep logs. They look for patterns in the data they collect, explore current research on adolescent sleep needs and make suggestions to their local school boards regarding sleep and school schedules.

title: CNBC Marks the Death of Anchor Mark Haines
description: Mark Haines, an anchor at CNBC who for years narrated the vicissitudes of the markets, died on Tuesday evening at his home in Marlboro, N.J., the network said Wednesday. He was 65.

title: M.T.A. Chief Says Panhandlers Exist, but in Smaller Numbers
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, who proudly includes himself among the mass transit-using public (even if his is a peculiar, infrequent style of subway-going), recently caused a bit of a snit when he declared that the era of the underground beggar had all but come to an end.

title: Havanas Sphere of Influence
description: IN Cuba, where dancers  especially male ones  seem to grow like weeds, ballet is a noble profession. There every taxi driver knows the names of the dancers, Mikhail Baryshnikov said in a recent interview. This is unheard of. Try it in New York.

title: Does It All Come Down to Medicare?
description: Gail Collins: David, this is going to be our last conversation until after Labor Day. Im already nostalgic  weve been doing this for almost three years to the day, and this will be our first real break. Ive been remembering all our fun times  like how plucky you were about finding ways to communicate during severe power outages  which, I must point out, seem to follow you around the country. And the night the Republicans won the Ted Kennedy Senate seat and I carried on my half of the conversation by e-mail while curled up in a fetal position under a hotel bed.

title: Suspect in Shooting of Giffords Ruled Unfit for Trial
description: TUCSON  A federal judge ruled Wednesday that Jared L. Loughner was not mentally competent to stand trial on charges that he opened fire at a constituent event for Representative Gabrielle Giffords in January, killing six and injuring her and 12 others.

title: Homes for $450,000
description: A log cabin in Lousiana, a 1912 bungalow in Idaho and a contemporary house in Maine.

title: In Upset, Dancing Tops Idol
description: In a rare ratings victory over Foxs American Idol, the ABC reality show Dancing With the Stars drew more viewers on Tuesday night as the Pittsburgh Steelers wide receiver Hines Ward and his dancing partner, Kym Johnson, were crowned winners of the shows 12th season.

title: What You Get for ... $450,000
description: FOLSOM, La.

title: After Upsetting Berdych, Robert Is Ousted
description: PARIS  The Frenchman who scored the tournaments biggest upset so far just two days ago ran out of energy and crashed out of the tournament Wednesday, winning only three games in three straight sets.

title: Tornadoes and Natural Gas in the Greenhouse
description: May 26, 12:28 p.m. | Updated Im in the middle of a two-day faculty meeting on innovation in university education (with great talks on borderless learning by Gardner Campbell of Virginia Tech and Tamar Lewin of The Times). But I wanted to note some fresh coverage of a couple of issues explored here recently  the climate implications of expanded drilling for natural gas and the relationship, if any, of tornadoes to human-driven climate change.Tornadoes and warming

title: 3 Men and a Monkey-Baby
description: The funniest, most reckless moments in The Hangover Part II, the largely mirthless sequel to the 2009 hit The Hangover, take place in the final credits, when still images flash by detailing the latest misadventures of the storys overgrown lost boys. The outrages, most of which are once again carefully elided in the actual movie, involve a slipped knife, a tribal tattoo and Thai bar girls performing specialized party tricks. The final credits are the time when viewers meander or flee from the theater or sit in stunned or ecstatic silence or chattering communion. Here the credits just emphasize how deeply square this flick is.

title: 2 Former Employees Accuse French Official of Sexual Assault
description: PARIS  Two women have brought sexual harassment suits against a junior minister here, with one saying explicitly that she was spurred by the accusations of sexual assault against the French economist Dominique Strauss-Kahn, the newspaper Le Parisien reported Wednesday.

title: 9 States Get New Chance at Federal Education Aid
description: Nine states that were also-rans in last years Race to the Top school improvement competition will get another chance, the Obama administration announced on Wednesday, though this time $200 million will be up for grabs, compared with $4 billion awarded last year.

title: Wells Fargo Bankers Answer Criticism of Lending Practices
description: Back in the darkest days of the economic crisis, few people had anything good to say about the nations biggest banks, least of all small-business owners. The big banks took federal bailout money, if in some cases reluctantly, and then faced accusations of being stingy with all of that capital. Even some business owners with longstanding banking relationships reported difficulty getting new loans. Others claimed their banks had dropped them altogether.

title: Jon Shook in Fish, a Film By R. J. Cutler
description: R. J. Cutler is a documentary film director who on another blog would be introduced as the guy who made The September Issue, about Anna Wintour and Vogue. Here at Diners Journal, however, Mr. Cutler is known as a food maniac  a restaurant enthusiast and scratch cook who is always game for a late dinner reservation in whatever city he visits, and who has a wood-burning pizza oven in his outdoor kitchen at his home high in the hills of Los Angeles.

title: Maria Sharapova Extends Her Reach
description: WHEN Maria Sharapova won her first grand slam title in 2004, at age 17, she made the cover of Sports Illustrated. The issue showed Ms. Sharapova at the moment she became a household name, proudly beaming on court at Wimbledon in a body-skimming white tank dress from Nike. Star Power, the headline read.

title: Poised for an Upset, Lisicki Falters and Is Carried Off the Court
description: PARIS - The days most compelling match ended at dusk, with Sabine Lisicki of Germany carried away on a stretcher, sobbing.

title: Wells Fargo Bankers Will Take Your Questions
description: Today, were publishing an interview The Agenda conducted with Wells Fargos two top executives for small-business lending, Marc Bernstein and Doug Case. Small-business owners have criticized big banks  and Wells Fargo is among the biggest  for doing little to help them through the most difficult days of the recent recession, but Mr. Bernstein and Mr. Case were resolute. Whatever the merit of the complaints against the banking industry, the officials said, the complaints were misdirected when it came to Wells Fargo.

title: TimesCast | May 25, 2011
description: President Obama wraps up a two-day visit to Britain; the search for survivors continues in Joplin, Mo.; and Oprah Winfrey's final episode of her daily show.

title: S.E.C. Adopts Its Revised Rules for Whistle-Blowers
description: 7:52 p.m. | Updated

title: House Bookkeeping Criticized in Audit
description: The House had trouble keeping its own financial house in order in 2009, according to a memo sent Wednesday to members of the oversight subcommittee. The memo said an extensive audit had found deficiencies for the first time in 12 years.

title: The Lowdown | Alec Friedman
description: Alec Friedman has the hustler mentality of the native New Yorker that he is. He is most often contextualized by the work he does as the associate creative director of the uber-hip, twice-a-year glossy Dossier Journal. Friedman, who is constantly on the move, can be found at the chicest parties world round, including the photographer Tim Barbers late night bash during Miami Basel (see above). The ultimate consultant, he is also one of the nicest guys in fashion and publishing, a soft-spoken example of how far a smile can go in a generally cutthroat universe. Brands have begun to tap him for his creative insight, not to mention his casting skills, asking him to nominate cool kids and artists for modeling gigs and video spots. Friedman himself is something of a style icon in the downtown creative scene, and appears regularly in the pages of magazines, and lately in subway entrances via the most recent Cole Haan campaign, along with the rest of the stylish Dossier staff.

title: Christine Lagarde's Statement on Leading the I.M.F.
description: Finance Minister Christine Lagarde of France is seen as a front-runner to succeed Dominique Strauss-Kahn, who resigned from the International Monetary Fund last week to fight sexual assault charges.

title: Milestone for Yankees Rivera Is Tempered by a Setback for Soriano
description: The overhand throwing motion is about as unnatural an action as there is in sports, placing stress on muscles and joints and tendons, and rare is the athlete who lasts an entire career without feeling its effects.

title: Signs Grow That Palin May Run
description: WASHINGTON  Sarah Palin is fortifying her small staff of advisers, buying a house in Arizona  where associates have said she could base a national campaign  and reviving her schedule of public appearances. The moves are the most concrete signals yet that Ms. Palin, the former governor of Alaska, is seriously weighing a Republican presidential bid.

title: Winning Iraqi Hearts and Minds  One Camel Rescue at a Time
description: CONTINGENCY OPERATING BASE ADDER, Iraq  As the United States winds down its military operations in Iraq, American troops here in the southern part of the country are spending their days applying the gentler forms of military power.

title: New York Harbor, 11:15 A.M.
Guardian of the Pines
description: ANDREW KIRTZMAN was there alongside Rudolph W. Giuliani, marching through the dust-clogged streets of Lower Manhattan after the World Trade Center collapsed. He was there alongside Michael R. Bloomberg, hunkered down in City Hall during the 2003 blackout. He was there alongside David Dinkins, on a good-will tour of Tel Aviv after the Crown Heights riots.

title: New Works by Ballet Theater
description: The theater presented new ballets by Alexei Ratmansky, Benjamin Millepied and Christopher Wheeldon on Tuesday at the Met.

title: On Location
description: A building, in Arbcies, Spain, houses a family butcher business on the bottom floor and living quarters on the top three floors.

title: Not So New, but Not Forgotten
description: WHEN 1 of a Find, a high-end vintage clothing store, arrived on Lincoln Place in Park Slope, Brooklyn, during the spring of 2008, it was greeted with bland indifference.

title: Combat in the First Person: Haruti
description: Spc. Michael Gannon guides us through a mission in Haruti by sharing the video he captured on a helmet camera.

title: In Spain, the Modern Transformation of a Family Home
description: ARBCIES, Spain  In 2005, Joan Badia and Mireia Cerd were at a crossroads in their relationship. After five years of dating, they were ready to move in together, but where they would live was another story. The couple had grown up in the picturesque Catalonian village of Arbcies, about 50 miles northeast of Barcelona, and were content in the small town nestled in the rugged hills of the Montseny mountains. They considered building a home in the countryside, but they relished the idea of raising a family in their charming community with its pastel-colored row houses and cobblestone paths.

title: A Magazine That Wont Smudge
description: EVEN as the publishing rivals Cond Nast and Hearst Magazines race to one-up each other with plans to translate their old-fashioned fashion magazines for the new generation of tablets  adding features like a talking editors letter (Elle) or an iPad-only reality series (Glamour)  there is still the sense in some quarters that those companies havent yet fully embraced the digital medium.

title: Pictures of the Day: Missouri and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Missouri, Libya, Afghanistan and Spain.

title: Elbow to Sideline Soriano for Six to Eight Weeks
description: Yankees reliever Rafael Soriano will miss the next six to eight weeks after a magnetic resonance imaging test revealed an inflamed ligament in his right elbow. Soriano was examined Wednesday by the renowned orthopedist Dr. James Andrews, who recommended rest for the next two weeks before beginning a conservative throwing program. General Manager Brian Cashman said the Yankees hope that Soriano can face hitters four to six weeks after that, which would place his potential return around the All-Star game, which is July 12.

title: Bill Allows Military to Use High-Carbon Liquid Coal
description: An amendment to a major military spending bill before the House would rescind a 2007 federal law barring the Defense Department from using alternative fuels, like synthetic oil made from coal, that produce more climate-altering pollution than conventional fuels.

title: Classical Recordings
description: MOMPOU:

title: Somalis Are Told to Stop Bickering or Lose Financing
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Members of the United Nations Security Council sent an unusually blunt message to Somalias leaders on Wednesday to stop fighting among themselves or risk losing millions of dollars a year from Western donors.

title: Belarus Leader May Trade Rivals Freedom for Aid
description: MOSCOW  Facing a deepening economic crisis in Belarus, the countrys authoritarian president, Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, indicated on Wednesday that he might free his imprisoned political rivals, a signal that he could be ready to strike a deal with Western governments in exchange for financial support.

title: Yahoos Bartz Holds Her Tongue on Alibaba
description: Carol A. Bartz, Yahoos outspoken chief executive, was anything but on Wednesday while being questioned about her companys dispute with Alibaba Group, the Chinese Internet giant that it partly owns.

title: Twitter Acquires TweetDeck Software
description: After days of speculation on technology blogs, Twitter officially announced Wednesday that it had agreed to acquire TweetDeck, a service that organizes Twitter feeds to make them more useful. According to people who had been briefed on the deal who were not authorized to speak publicly, Twitter agreed to pay about $40 million.

title: Angle Pulls Out of Nevada House Race
description: LAS VEGAS  Well, that was a short political comeback.

title: What to Watch Thursday at the French Open
description: PARIS - The weather at the French Open, near perfect and sunny through the first four days - there were rumors of a cloud somewhere over Paris Wednesday, but that has not been confirmed  is expected to turn a bit cool and blustery on Thursday. But the tennis should remain plenty hot.

title: Its a Turban, Its a Dress (Its a Scarf)
description: MARIANGELA MELATO could work a scarf like Salome. In Swept Away, Lina Wertmllers 1974 screen exploration of class and gender warfare, her character, a castaway, makes do mostly with a single wardrobe item, an outsize scarf that she presses into service as a head wrap, a sultry halter dress, a lens-fogging slit-to-the-hip sarong and, when the waters get choppy, a sheltering cocoon.

title: Tatiana and Kristas Special Connection
description: In this weeks magazine, Susan Dominus writes about Tatiana and Krista Hogan, 4-year-old conjoined twins whose brains are linked by a neural bridge. Its an incredible story that leads to all kinds of fascinating questions about empathy, consciousness and the nature of the self: If the girls share sensation, could they also share higher thoughts? Do they experience some kind of cross-talk in their brains that they are constantly having to filter out? Will their identities merge together over time or become more differentiated?

title: For Public Hospital Employees, New Training on Gay Patients
description: A doctor asks a girl if she is using condoms, and a boy if he has a girlfriend. A woman has to fill out the usual medical forms, asking whether she needs birth control, and if she is married, single, divorced or widowed.

title: Strauss-Kahn Finds a New Home
description: Updated 7:50 p.m. | Dominique Strauss-Kahn is about to be on the move again.

title: Pictures of the Day: Missouri and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Missouri, Libya, Afghanistan and Spain.

title: Apple Operating System Affected by Malware
description: For years Apple Mac users have boasted about the lack of malware on their computers. In comparison, Microsoft Windows owners haveregularly felt the brunt of viruses and malware that can easily debilitate an entire computer system in minutes.

title: Laurents Left Book, Play and Plan for Gypsy Film
description: In the month before his death, on May 5, the Tony Award-winning writer and director Arthur Laurents gave his blessing to a plan for a new film version of Gypsy, starring Barbra Streisand, and also finished a full-length play as well as his third memoir, Laurentss agent and several associates said this week.

title: Less Active at Work, Americans Have Packed on Pounds
description: Looking beyond poor eating habits and a couch-potato lifestyle, a group of researchers has found a new culprit in the obesity epidemic: the American workplace.

title: Shopping for Modernist Flatware With S. Russell Groves
description: Mr. Groves selects flatware, looking for silver pieces with an eye toward both shape and materials.

title: TimesCast | Search Continues in Joplin
description: May 25, 2011 - The search for survivors continues in Joplin, Mo.

title: Television Diva Gives Thanks and Signs Off
description: The surprise was that at long last there werent any more surprises. Oprah Winfrey took her final bow on Wednesday by holding back. There will be no makeovers, no surprises  really, no surprises, she told her studio audience. You will not be getting a car or a tree. This last hour is really about me saying thank you.

title: Classical Recordings
description: BERLIOZ: LES NUITS DT; HANDEL: ARIAS

title: A Noble Panda Takes On a Nightmare Enemy
description: In Kung Fu Panda 2 the hero, a roly-poly panda named Po, voiced by the irrepressible Jack Black, undergoes an identity crisis. Raised by a doting, dithering, noodle-shop-owning goose, Po experiences flashbacks to a traumatic infancy, including hazy recollections of his parents that look sketched by hand, in contrast to the computer-polished, 3-D images that dominate the movie.

title: Turkey Calls for Syrian Reforms on Order of Shock Therapy
description: KONYA, Turkey  The foreign minister of Turkey said Wednesday that President Bashar al-Assad of Syria must deliver reforms that would constitute shock therapy to his country if he had any hope of ending a nine-week crisis that was roiling the region.

title: Scouting Report
description: OPENINGS

title: Beauty Spots
description: Its Skin Cancer Awareness Month, and beach season starts this weekend, so heres a selection of new sunscreens. HILARY HOWARD

title: Extricating Wilderness From Political Limbo
description: In wildness is the preservation of the world   Henry David Thoreau

title: Q&A: Sending a Gmail Vacation Reply
description: Q.

title: TimesCast | Obama and Cameron
description: May 25, 2011 - President Obama wraps up a two-day visit to Britain.

title: Duck Hunting on the Internet
description: REGULAR Facebook perusers are no doubt familiar with a certain photographic expression: a pout-producing, cheekbone-enhancing pose featuring pooched-out lips and sucked-in cheeks.

title: Exploring Biodiversity in the Philippines
description: Rich Mooi, curator of invertebrate zoology and geology at the California Academy of Sciences, writes from the Philippines, where he is surveying echinoderms off the coast of Luzon Island.

title: Pianists Embracing the New
description: Some contemporary-music festivals make a point of exploring a particular style or branch of composition. Not Keys to the Future, a festival of contemporary solo piano music, which opened its sixth mini-season on Tuesday night at the Abrons Arts Center on the Lower East Side. This embracing festival espouses no dogma.

title: A Big House, Big Names, New Twists
description: American Ballet Theater keeps trying its damnedest to be both Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde.

title: E-Business Is the Buzz at Book Fair
description: Authors are shrugging off publishers to self-publish their work. Publishers are advancing into retail. Barnes & Noble is getting deeper into the gadget business, and Amazon is stepping into publishing.

title: Person-to-Person Payments Get Easier at Big Banks
description: Three of the nations biggest banks introduced a service that will enable their customers to move money from their checking accounts using only an e-mail address or a mobile phone number.

title: At Home With Allee Willis
description: Allee Willis, songwriter, and her house, a monument to kitsch.

title: Whats a Cortelyou? And Will the Van Wyck Get Me There?
description: Youd think there would only be so many ways to pronounce, or mispronounce, a name.

title: Angry Parents in Japan Confront Government Over Radiation Levels
description: FUKUSHIMA CITY, Japan  The accusations flew on Wednesday at the local school board meeting, packed with parents worried and angry about radiation levels in this city at the heart of Japans nuclear crisis.

title: In Brooklyn, a Boschscape of Vows, Song and Flesh
description: I dont want to miss my cue, the festively dressed man sitting next to me explained as he edged his chair closer to see the left side of the tableau before us: 120 people arrayed over tiered platforms at one end of the extraordinary Skylight One Hanson, a majestic Art Deco space in the former Williamsburgh Savings Bank building, a towering landmark in downtown Brooklyn.

title: Light Bulb Saving Time
description: BUNNY WILLIAMS, the no-nonsense decorator known for her lush English-style rooms, is laying in light bulbs like canned goods. Incandescent bulbs, that is  60 and 75 watters  because she likes a double-cluster lamp with a high- and a low-watt bulb, one for reading, one for mood.

title: The Ryan Budgets Unforced Errors
description: Yesterday, while the backlash against the House Republican budget was helping the Democrats snap up a House seat in conservative territory, Peter Suderman discussed how the Republicans helped bring this on their own head:

title: Bopping to Her Own Beat
description: Los Angeles

title: Getting a Head Start on That Musical Night on the Town
description: In a rational world, you should be able to open an app wherever you are on a Friday night and have it deliver a comprehensive list of nearby concerts or weekend music festivals you would enjoy.

title: A Library of Listening, Made by You
description: Want to know the real problem with the digital age? Theres not enough to listen to.

title: A Lifetime of Anxiety and Lust
description: I love my worldliness, my snobbery, my ease, the great literary critic Alfred Kazin confided to his journal in 1959, when he was 43. He was at the apex of his powers as a writer and as a man.

title: Rock Songs Turned Testaments of Triumphant Soul
description: To choose a song at random from the soul singer Bettye LaVettes astounding two-hour show at the Caf Carlyle on Tuesday evening, how about that jolly 1971 Ringo Starr singalong, It Dont Come Easy? If you are like me, you probably never paid much attention to the lyrics of a number thats catchy enough but no great shakes as a piece of songwriting.

title: Spoons for Thinkers
description: EVERYTHING about S. Russell Groves is just so, from his style of dress to his choice of words; nothing is superfluous. A modernist who worked for Richard Meier and Peter Marino before starting his own architecture and design firm in 1995, Mr. Groves does not seem like the sort of person who would amass anything in quantity.

title: Hard Times at a Factory of Legends
description: Long Beach Polytechnic High School in California is not much like the fictional East Dillon High of Friday Night Lights or even, for that matter, the wealthier rival Panthers across town with their championship victories. Poly, as the locals call it, exists in a realm unto its own: Sports Illustrated called it sports school of the century.

title: Clouds Have Lifted, and the Hamptons Beckon
description: IS it summer already? It certainly feels that way in the Hamptons, where a post-recession lift brings new places to dine, shop and, of course, party. Mercifully, the mood has shifted from the go-go 2000s. Instead of magnums of Cristal, its now about communal seaplanes, hipster charities, hippie festivals, Montauk and more Montauk. Our guide:

title: Melodramatic Sounds of Young Love
description: Verismo operas were the reality television of their time. Dispensing with the typical operatic kings and gods, they featured recognizably ordinary characters experiencing way-larger-than-life emotions. Capped by generous helpings of sex and violence, these operas made it hard to look away.

title: Freescale Prices Its I.P.O. at $18 a Share
description: It hardly seems possible in the current environment where investors are clamoring for newly public companies like LinkedIn and Yandex.

title: Im Moving. And the Plants?
description: A BERRY bush may be natures answer to the gumball machine. There the thing stands, dispensing bits of cheer by the palmful. And a berry bush needs no coins; the currency is grab and go.

title: Yet Again, Adele Tops the Charts
description: The old news about the latest music sales: Adele is No. 1, yet again. The new news: Thanks to an aggressive marketing campaign and some apparently unsolicited promotion by Amazon, Lady Gaga is selling even better than expected.

title: Prepare Ye the Way of the Lord': Godspell Revival Coming to Broadway
description: Godspell, the parable-driven musical based on the Gospel of Matthew that ran on various New York stages from 1971 to 1977, will be revived on Broadway for the first time this fall, the producers announced on Wednesday. The revival had originally been aiming to open on Broadway in the summer of 2008, but its financing plans did not come together, largely due to the approaching economic recession. The lead producer of the upcoming production, Ken Davenport, said on Wednesday that the musical would be staged at Broadways only in-the-round theater, Circle in the Square. Preview performances of the open-ended run are scheduled to begin on Oct. 13, with an opening night of Nov. 7.

title: Two Overcalls: One Worked, One Didnt
description: In a team event, when one side gains a sizable swing, it is usually because one pair did something especially meritorious. Occasionally, though, both pairs combine well  as in the diagramed deal, Board 62 from the Bermuda Bowl world championship trial in Henderson, Nev., this month.

title: Collegiate Living: Honeys, Im Home
description: WE would meet in the kitchen just after sunrise each morning  he in his white terry robe, I in my black embroidered caftan. We would talk groggily while making coffee  he meticulously nursing a drip cone over a single mug, I stoking up the automatic for a tub of caffeine.

title: Scene City: The Whitney Heads Downtown
description: The Whitney Museum tries hard to show off a younger, hipper side.

title: Pour
description: Martin Bresnick created the score for this film about an inventive casting technique.

title: A Celebrity Designer in the Service of Glamour
description: The interior designer Martyn Lawrence Bullard is a favorite of Los Angeles celebrities. Since moving to the city from London 19 years ago, he has amassed a list of high-profile clients that includes Elton John, Kid Rock, Cher and Edward Norton, among other notable names.

title: A Summer Show House on the Jersey Shore
description: Dcor by the Shore, a show house to benefit the Sephardic Community Center of Brooklyn, opens Wednesday in Deal, N.J.

title: Following a Lure to Delicate Lamps
description: When you hold a lure in your hand, it is so delicate that you feel you could crush it like an eggshell, said Alison Berger, explaining the inspiration for her latest piece, the Lure sconce. The glass for the sconce is also super-delicate  you just sigh into the glass to get that shape.

title: My Blog Is Also Paying My Bills
description: Casting the digital equivalent of a message-in-a-bottle into the Internets vast sea of content, many people start Web sites or blogs hoping that they will find an appreciative audience for their precocious parrot videos, cupcake recipes or pithy commentary on everyday life. The dream, of course, is that they will develop a large and loyal following  and potentially profit from it.

title: Cutlery and Tables to Put It On
description: Some floor model furniture, artwork, textiles and accessories are 20 to 50 percent off at Michael Hennessy Home, through June 5 (the white oak Farmhouse table, originally $3,200, is $1,600; a walnut Retro console cabinet with fossil knobs, regularly $7,995, is $5,596); 207 West 18th Street (Seventh Avenue), (646) 370-6575, mhhome.net.

title: Ballmer Must Go, Einhorn Says
description: David Einhorn, the head of the hedge fund Greenlight Capital, called on Wednesday for the removal of Steven A. Ballmer as Microsofts chief executive, telling an investor conference in New York that his leadership was the biggest overhang on the companys stock price.

title: Answers About Pip and Violet
description: This week, Dr. Elizabeth Bunting, a wildlife veterinarian at the Animal Health Diagnostic Center at Cornell College of Veterinary Medicine, and other experts will be responding to readers questions about Pip, the red-tailed hawk hatchling, or eyas, who emerged from the egg on May 6 in a nest on a 12th-floor ledge at New York University  and about Pips mother, Violet, about whose injured leg many of you have expressed concern.

title: Fresh Design for an Antiques Town
description: For two years, the furniture designer Chris Lehrecke has had a 600-square-foot shop in Hudson, N.Y. Last week he opened a new space, nearly double the size, across the street. The little store was just a tester, Mr. Lehrecke explained. If I put any major pieces of furniture in there, it looked ridiculous.

title: Honoring a Designer Who Gave Computers Their Fonts
description: If influence can be measured in the quantity of typewritten words produced, then the most powerful wordmonger in history may be Matthew Carter. The British-born designer, 73, has created typefaces for newspapers (including The New York Times), phone books and computer companies; he designed the fonts Verdana and Georgia that Microsoft added to Windows in 1996 and later distributed freely.

title: The Buzz
description: A PREVIEW of the must-attend parties, talked-about openings and fashionable nightspots for the week ahead.

title: Not Just Hoarders
description: To the Editor:

title: Garden Nibblers
description: To the Editor:

title: New E.P.A. Window Stickers Make Debut
description: On Wednesday, Transportation Secretary Ray LaHood unveiled a new window sticker that would be required for all 2013 model-year vehicles on dealer lots. The sticker revises the current version, which provides only basic information regarding the average fuel consumption of a vehicle.

title: Media Decoder: Oprah Says Farewell
description: Brian Stelter on Oprah Winfrey's final episode of her daily show.

title: Video: Oprah Says Farewell
description: Brian Stelter on Oprah Winfreys final episode of her daily show.

title: A Whos Who of Slightly Familiar Faces
description: There were so many somebodies that nobody seemed to know who anybody was. Such was the conundrum that a phalanx of reporters and photographers faced on the red carpet at the Drama Desk Awards, held at the Hammerstein Ballroom in Midtown on Monday night.

title: Late Pickups Help Fuel Canucks Run to Stanley Cup Finals
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  Chris Higgins has this dream. It is summertime on Long Island, and he is on a beach, hoisting the Stanley Cup in front of friends and family and celebrating through the night.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 4,444 American service members who have died since the start of the Iraq war and 1,571 who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans this week:

title: As Lockout Goes On, N.F.L. May Expand Rosters
description: INDIANAPOLIS  N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell did not rule out the possibility Wednesday of expanding rosters if training camps and preseason games are cut short or eliminated by the N.F.L.s labor stalemate.

title: The Churchs Actions on Child Abuse
description: To the Editor:

title: Euro Crisis Looms for Group of 8
description: PARIS  The euro crisis hangs over the coming meeting of the Group of 8 industrialized countries, with Greeces renewed problems destabilizing markets, worrying Washington and influencing the debate over who should be the next managing director of the International Monetary Fund.

title: Blagojevich Did Not Seek Favors, Emanuel Testifies at Retrial
description: CHICAGO  Testifying in the retrial of former Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich of Illinois may not have been high on the list of ways Rahm Emanuel hoped to spend his second week in office as mayor.

title: A Statue of Pope John Paul II Brings Out the Critic in Italians
description: ROME  The backdrop may be the Termini train station, but the chatter these days evokes a Damien Hirst opening. The object of the attention is a 17-foot-tall bronze sculpture of Pope John Paul II unveiled on May 18, his birthday.

title: Natural Court Colors Give Way to a Kaleidoscope of Shades
description: PARIS  As managing director of a company called DecoTurf, John Graham oversees the design and construction of many of the worlds best-known tennis courts. One tool he uses with increasing frequency is a color wheel.

title: Scotty McCreery Wins American Idol
description: All the mom-baiting in the world couldnt save Lauren Alaina, it turns out. Scotty McCreery is this years American Idol, his inertia too great for Lauren to overcome with one great night. Instead the title belongs to Scotty, whos been this seasons most consistent performer, and often its most invigorating. What do you think about Scottys victory? Tell us below in the comments field.

title: House Tour: Cheviot, N.Y.
description: A fully renovated Victorian house on the Hudson sits atop a gentle slope in a hamlet that dates to the 1700s.;

title: Mexico: Man Arrested in Murder Tied to Drug Cartel
description: In a case that has galvanized a protest movement against the governments conduct of the campaign against drug traffickers, the authorities said that they had arrested a man believed to have ordered the murder of seven people. Among the victims was Juan Francisco Sicilia, 24, the son of the poet and journalist Javier Sicilia, left, who has since led marches demanding a change in the governments strategy. The suspect, Julio de Jess Radilla, who was arrested Tuesday, is the leader of the South Pacific cartel in the central state of Morelos, said Luis Crdenas Palomino, chief of regional security for the federal police. Mr. Radilla is accused of ordering the killings after two of the younger Mr. Sicilias friends got into an argument with members of the cartel. Juan Francisco Sicilia was found bound and fatally shot along with six friends in the city of Cuernavaca in March.

title: China: Mongolian Students Protest Handling of Death
description: Nearly 2,000 Mongolian students on Wednesday marched on a government building in the city of Xilinhot in Inner Mongolia Province to demand that Chinese officials respect the rights of Mongolian herders, according to the Southern Mongolia Human Rights Information Center. The center, an advocacy group based in New York, posted on its Web site photographs of the protesters, the vast majority of whom were dressed in yellow or blue athletic jackets. The protest was over the way Chinese officials handled the death on May 10 of a Mongolian herder named Mergen, who was run over during a dispute by a coal truck driven by an ethnic Han, according to Mongolians in the area. The Han are the dominant ethnicity in China and make up the majority of the population in Inner Mongolia. The protest on Tuesday ended after government officials made several promises, including addressing the case of Mergen. Though many Mongolians resent the Han, the Mongolians in Inner Mongolia have rarely held large protests.

title: When Chicago Turns as Hot as Baton Rouge
description: To the Editor:

title: Should John Lindh, Who Aided the Taliban, Go Free?
description: To the Editor:

title: Weakening the Rule of Law
description: To the Editor:

title: Corporate Contributions
description: To the Editor:

title: Paul Splittorff, Royals Biggest Winner, Dies at 64
description: Paul Splittorff, a lanky left-hander who pitched more innings and won more games for the Kansas City Royals than any other pitcher, died Wednesday at his home in Blue Springs, Mo., a Kansas City suburb. He was 64.

title: No Man's Land
description: With Spain and its neighbors facing economic turmoil, there are nearly 10,000 African migrants living in tent communities in the woods without papers or jobs and with little food and water.

title: Voter Group Flexes Muscle in Ads Aimed at Senators
description: WASHINGTON  The League of Women Voters is typically thought of as an earnest, civic-minded organization best known for hosting sober candidate debates and distributing studious voter guides to keep the citizenry informed.

title: FIFA Cant Ignore Insiders Charges of Corruption
description: Sepp Blatter has long contended that FIFA was not corrupt during his 13-year reign as president of soccers world governing body. But he has also promised not to ignore evidence of wrongdoing. Now we will learn if he is a man of his word.

title: Chasing Riches From Africa to Europe and Finding Only Squalor
description: PALOS DE LA FRONTERA, Spain  Back home in Gambia, Amadou Jallow was, at 22, a lover of reggae who had just finished college and had landed a job teaching science in a high school.

title: Heat Exposes Bulls Deficiencies on Offense
description: CHICAGO

title: MSNBC Suspends Schultz Over Ingraham Remark
description: MSNBC announced what amounted to a suspension of one week without pay for its talk show host Ed Schultz Wednesday after pejorative comments he made on his syndicated radio program about the conservative commentator Laura Ingraham.

title: Lakers Near Agreement to Hire Mike Brown as Coach
description: Mike Brown left the epicenter of the N.B.A. last summer when his Cleveland Cavaliers imploded in the playoffs against the Boston Celtics and LeBron James arrived at his long-speculated free agency.

title: Growth in Education Spending Slowed in 2009
description: The nations overall education spending grew at a slower pace in 2009 than at any other time in more than a decade, amid deepening state fiscal woes and flatter tax revenues, according to new census figures released Wednesday.

title: Squandering Medicares Money
description: San Francisco

title: Complete Game Rarity for Yanks
description: Pitchers rarely throw a nine-inning complete game for the Yankees, and for one very simple reason, as C. C. Sabathia pointed out Tuesday night: Mariano Rivera. The ninth inning has been Riveras domain for the last 15 seasons, and his dominance has eased the workload of many a starter.

title: Heineken Aims Its Ads at Young Digital Devotees
description: AWORLDWIDE initiative by the Dutch brewer Heineken to embrace nontraditional methods of delivering pitches to consumers has been deemed successful enough to continue.

title: Patriot Act Battle Could Hinder Investigators
description: WASHINGTON  A dispute in the Senate over the Patriot Act that created a legislative impasse Wednesday has raised the prospect that several of the Federal Bureau of Investigations counterterrorism powers may temporarily lapse at the end of the week.

title: New York Fed Investigates Goldman Loan Division
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York has begun an investigation into the mortgage-servicing arm of Goldman Sachs, looking at whether it systematically rejected borrowers efforts to lower their loan payments through government programs.

title: NATO and Afghan Forces Push Taliban Out of Seized Town
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  NATO and Afghan forces pushed back hundreds of Taliban fighters from a district center in northeastern Afghanistan on Wednesday, sending them fleeing into the rugged mountainside just hours after the fighters had seized control over a portion of that same area, Afghan officials said.

title: State Ends a Practice of Rescoring Regents Tests
description: Responding to a suspicious spike in the number of students barely passing high school Regents exams, New York State education officials have ordered schools to end the longstanding but controversial practice of rescoring tests that fall just below the passing grade.

title: The Battle for Libya | May 25, 2011
description: United Nations Secretary General Ban Ki-moon reiterated the urgent need for a ceasefire in Libya and for Tripoli to hold talks aimed at forming a transitional government.

title: The Elaines That I Knew
description: ONE night, after Id pulled the rolling metal gates down over the storefront of Elaines, the legendary restaurant on the Upper East Side, and just as I was about to put the padlocks on, I realized that I wasnt sure if my boss, Elaine Kaufman, had left or not.

title: An Actor Who Knows Start-Ups
description: Ashton Kutcher, a former model, rose to fame in Hollywood by playing a handsome ditz in Dude, Wheres My Car? and on That 70s Show. But in certain circles, people know that he is no dummy when it comes to technology.

title: Egypt to Open Border With Gaza, in the Face of Israeli Objections
description: CAIRO  Egypt will permanently open its border with the Gaza Strip on Saturday despite Israeli protests, Egypts transitional government confirmed Wednesday, upending the dynamics of regional politics in a bid to shake up the deadlocked peace process and better respond to Egyptian public opinion.

title: Storms Create a Scramble to Install Shelters
description: ATLANTA  Gloria Jones climbed out of a relatives storm shelter in an Oklahoma City suburb on Wednesday night and saw only rubble where the house used to be.

title: Ticket-Fixing Case Tests Officers on the Stand
description: In a thinly populated Bronx courtroom, a plain vanilla drunken driving case was in progress. More than four years ago, a red 1988 Oldsmobile driven by a beer-imbibing man collided with a 2002 Chevrolet Suburban on the Grand Concourse. The arresting officer was on the stand on Wednesday in State Supreme Court for defense cross-examination. But she was being asked about something quite different.

title: Raiding a Brothel in India
description: KOLKATA, India

title: Mumbai Plotter Testifies About Training
description: CHICAGO  A Pakistani-American who has confessed to helping plot the 2008 terrorist attack in Mumbai, India, testified in federal court here on Wednesday that the Drug Enforcement Administration had asked him to infiltrate Islamic extremist groups while working as an informant.

title: Prague 1970: Music in Spring
description: I.

title: Assistant Commissioner Who Faked Time Sheets Is Demoted
description: The Bloomberg administration demoted a high-ranking agency official on Wednesday after she admitted falsifying time sheets and collecting more than $22,000 that she had not earned.

title: New Prosecution Team as Strauss-Kahn Moves
description: The Manhattan district attorneys office has assigned two senior prosecutors to the sexual assault case against Dominique Strauss-Kahn for what promises to be a vigorous court battle.

title: Insiders Claims of Corruption Put Pressure on FIFA
description: Accusations of corruption against top FIFA officials are nothing new, sadly. But the latest ones, delivered by an executive committee member, Chuck Blazer, against two other top officials, including one who is up for election to FIFAs presidency next week, will be almost impossible to ignore. Read Jer Longmans analysis here, and come back to comment.

title: Apartments Are Dedicated in Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEM  Senior Israeli government officials and dignitaries on Wednesday attended the dedication ceremony of a Jewish apartment complex in a hotly contested, predominantly Palestinian neighborhood of the city across the 1967 boundary.

title: Childrens Aid Society Sells Greenwich Village Buildings
description: In Greenwich Village, Mommy and Me classes are about to make way for luxury condominiums.

title: Democratic Happy Dance
description: Hey, did anybody notice that the Democrat won a special Congressional race in a Republican district in upstate New York? Apparently, she campaigned a lot on protecting Medicare.

title: Winding Down the Bailouts, and Trying Not to Lose Money
description: After months of planning, the federal government has sold the first batch of shares it owns in the American International Group, the most prominent reminder of the wreckage of 2008.

title: First Day in Monaco, Sunshine and Shadows
description: MONACO  I have never arrived in the paddock in Monaco and found it in such a state of construction before. No big deal for me, as the media can still get the job done. But the team members who have been going without sleep for 60 hours  as one said to me  really have it hard. All the time I was sleeping and writing my previews in the comfort of the trains from Barcelona to Monaco, these people were deconstructing, transporting and reconstructing the massive motor homes between the Barcelona paddock on Sunday to here today.

title: First Day in Monaco, Sunshine and Shadows
description: MONACO  I have never arrived in the paddock in Monaco and found it in such a state of construction before. No big deal for me, as the media can still get the job done. But the team members who have been going without sleep for 60 hours  as one said to me  really have it hard. All the time I was sleeping and writing my previews in the comfort of the trains from Barcelona to Monaco, these people were deconstructing, transporting and reconstructing the massive motor homes between the Barcelona paddock on Sunday to here today.

title: Libya Effort Is Called Violation of War Act
description: WASHINGTON  Several lawmakers from both parties on Wednesday accused President Obama of violating the War Powers Resolution by continuing American participation in NATOs air war in Libya without Congressional authorization, but they struggled with the question of what Congress can or should do about it.

title: Mark Haines, CNBC Host and Interviewer, Dies at 65
description: Mark Haines, a popular and often combative morning host of financial news programs on CNBC, including Squawk on the Street, died Tuesday at his home in Marlboro, N.J. He was 65.

title: Lottery Numbers
Energy Pipelines Offer Market-Beating Returns
description: Oil and gas pipelines offer market-beating returns. Mostly held in so-called master limited partnerships, or M.L.P.s, they looked expensive for a while. But the $245 billion sector again looks affordable. Many shun the complexity, but it means higher returns for those prepared to invest.

title: Joplin Sifts Through Tornado Wreckage
description: As rescue workers continue to sift through the wreckage of Joplin, Mo., local leaders have been wrestling with the question of when to start cleaning up the destroyed area.

title: Imagining a New Life for Women
description: Since 1996, Anne R. Elliott has been executive director of Greenhope Services for Women in East Harlem, which serves former inmates who have abused drugs or been battered, and provides an alternative to incarceration. This month, Greenhope opened Kandake House, a residence that has education, therapy and cultural programs. Dr. Elliott, a North Carolina native, is 49 and lives in Mount Vernon, N.Y.

title: Parties See Obamas Israel Policy as Wedge for 2012
description: WASHINGTON  Few issues in American politics are as bipartisan as support for Israel. Yet the question of whether President Obama is supportive enough is behind some of the most partisan maneuvering since the Middle East ally was born six decades ago, and that angling has potential ramifications for the 2012 elections.

title: Housekeeper Adds Lawyers to Team
description: The hotel housekeeper who Manhattan prosecutors say was sexually assaulted by Dominique Strauss-Kahn expanded her legal team on Wednesday, adding the noted civil liberties lawyer Norman Siegel and a former assistant United States attorney who prosecuted the police officers accused of assaulting Abner Louima.

title: Wal-Mart Security Suit Seeks Oklahomas Help
description: HOUSTON  It is hard to escape the long arm of Wal-Mart. Just ask Bruce O. Gabbard, a former computer security technician who was fired by the corporation in March 2007 for spying on company officials.

title: Mets Seem to Settle on Buyer Who Will Own Less Than Half
description: The Mets appear to have settled on a buyer who will give them at least $200 million for less than 49 percent of the team and will not receive a portion of SNY, the teams profitable cable network, a person briefed on the matter said.

title: Ex-Mob Boss Says Deputy Sought to Kill Prosecutor
description: After making a star turn from the witness box of a Mafia murder trial last month, a former mob boss returned to the stand on Wednesday to testify again against the same man, this time in the trials death penalty phase.

title: Divorce, Tennis-Style, Ends in a Second Marriage
description: PARIS - It was a partnership that soured after seven years. Now, after nearly a decade apart, Mahesh Bhupathi, 36, and Leander Paes, 37, both of India, have forged the tennis equivalent of a remarriage in the twilight of their careers.

title: The Hangover and the Age of the Jokeless Comedy
description: The Hangover Part II arrives much like a hangover  bludgeoning, harsh and relentless  yet its a notable, even groundbreaking film. It represents the logical evolution of a roughly five-year trend: someone has finally dared to make a mainstream American comedy in which nothing funny happens.

title: San Franciscos New Pop-Up Restaurant
description: Its not a coincidence that three of the countrys hottest destination restaurants are more or less dives  the kinds of places for which you have to put on your worst clothes. And its not a coincidence that they all take chances; as with television shows, the best new restaurants arent copycats. Two of these places  Torrisi Italian Specialties (written about in the magazine a few weeks ago) and M. Wells, a reborn diner  are in New York and have European roots.

title: Thursday: Private Aye
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  This is an elegant puzzle, and perfect for a Thursday.

title: A Clock Ticking to Incessant Wailing
description: Parenthood is considered from both the hypothetical and actual perspectives in Cradle and All, a slight but mostly satisfying comedy by Daniel Goldfarb that opened Wednesday night at City Center in a Manhattan Theater Club production. The mewling of an 11-month-old baby is sweet, seductive music to one of the two heroines in Mr. Goldfarbs play, a torture from the depths of hell to the other. Can you guess which one is the new mom?

title: Company Overseeing Payroll Project Fires Manager
description: Doubts about CityTime, a troubled New York City payroll automation project, grew on Wednesday as the company overseeing the project said it had fired a senior employee for misrepresenting the number of hours he had worked.

title: Abidal, to Barcelonas Delight, Is Ready to Go
description: Two months ago, Eric Abidal was wondering whether he would play for Barcelona again. Now hes wondering how much hell play in Saturdays Champions League final.

title: The Crossover: Genealogy of a 'Vicious' Move
description: A look at the use and effectiveness of the crossover move in basketball.

title: Corrections
description: NEW YORK

title: Reject the Tax Cap
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo and the New York State Legislature have already adopted a state budget that drastically cuts funds to schools and local communities  cuts that were far deeper than needed to balance the budget because of Mr. Cuomos indefensible refusal to extend a tax surcharge on New Yorks wealthiest residents. Now they want to adopt a cheap political tool  a 2 percent property tax cap  that would only further devastate communities around the state that can least afford it.

title: Kafka Couldnt Have Built a Better System
description: The credit reporting industry has vast reach and power. The information it gathers and sells is used to determine eligibility for credit cards, mortgages and even some jobs. Federal regulators havent had the authority or the means to protect consumers who have been victims of inaccurate reports. The new Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will have that authority. It has a big job ahead.

title: Tech Talk Podcast: Vacation Apps
description: Time to start getting ready for that summer vacation! On this weeks episode of Bits: Tech Talk, Bettina Edelstein, J.D. Biersdorfer and Pedro Rafael Rosado chat about mobile apps for travel on the road, in the air and with children.

title: The Republicans ChutzPAC
description: Since Watergate, federal office holders and candidates have been barred from soliciting unlimited money for partisan campaign machines. Now three members of the Republican National Committee are trying to turn the law on its head with a new Republican Super PAC.

title: Running on Medicare the Right Way
description: After their surprise victory in a heavily Republican Congressional district of western New York, Democrats believe they have the magic formula for winning back the House next year. Medicare, Medicare, and Medicare, said Representative Steve Israel of Long Island, who runs the Democratic election effort in the House. There is enormous power in Mr. Israels new cudgel. Even Paul Ryan, the Wisconsin Republican who wrote the plan to privatize Medicare and end its guarantee to the elderly, admitted that it played a significant role in the victory by Kathy Hochul, the Democrat. Nonetheless, effective as the playbook was in one special election, Democrats cannot expect to build their entire 2012 campaign around attacking the Ryan plan. Its a useful reminder of the vast differences between the parties, but defines only the Republicans, not the Democrats.

title: Riot Police Break Up Protest by Opposition in Georgian Capital
description: MOSCOW  An opposition protest in the Georgian capital of Tbilisi was violently broken up by riot police officers late Wednesday, scattering about a thousand demonstrators who had occupied a viewing stand where President Mikheil Saakashvili was scheduled to preside over a military parade on Thursday.

title: Teams Looking at Reyes, Who Remains on a Roll
description: Fred Wilpons recent published comments and the Mets financial distress paint a dreary picture for the teams prospects of re-signing Jose Reyes. But there are other teams that have the resources and interest to land him, one of which presents a surprising possibility.

title: A Sign Full of Symbolism Goes Too Far for Hollywood
description: LOS ANGELESNot much is sacred in Hollywood. Classics are remade; final cuts are subjected to focus groups and re-edited.

title: Bloggingheads: A Time for Peace?
description: Heather Hurlburt, left, of the National Security Network and Eli Lake of The Washington Times debate prospects for Israeli-Palestinian peace.

title: City Will Pay $2 Million After an Inmates Death
description: New York City has agreed to pay $2 million to settle a lawsuit alleging that a postal worker died in jail because his severe alcohol withdrawal went untreated.

title: Plane Crashes in New Delhi, Killing 10
description: NEW DELHI  A plane being used as an air ambulance crashed in a congested residential area near New Delhi on Wednesday night, killing at least 10 people, officials said.

title: Photo Replay: May 25
description: A look at the day sports from tennis at the French Open to baseball at Yankee Stadium.

title: Ford Focus, Honda Civic and Nissan Juke Among I.I.H.S. Top Safety Picks
description: On Thursday, the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety released crash-test results for 13 small cars. Six earned top scores, bringing the total number of small cars named top safety picks by the institute to 22.

title: American Idol Winner Is ...American Idol

To mark their new collaboration, Joel Chen, the driving force behind one of the largest antique and vintage furniture stores in the city, and Paul Johnson of the Johnson Trading Gallery in Manhattan, which has an outpost in Chens space, have brought together an eclectic roster of 14 designers to show works that range from the primitive to the futuristic. Designers from Johnsons stable, including Max Lamb, Simon Hasan and Kwangho Lee, joined Chens invitees, who include the architects Greg Lynn, Eddy Sykes (who was first featured in Seeing Things in 2008) and Aranda/Lasch, and the artists Yassi Mazandi and Mary Brogger.

But be sure to stick around past the one-minute mark, when Mr. Fallon receives some harmonic support from a couple of Mr. Youngs real-life collaborators, Graham Nash and David Crosby. In Arizona, almost half of all Medicaid recipients smoke; while the number of obese people is unclear, about one-in-four Arizonans is overweight, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. It is, however, not all that practical. If we ceased to use all the words that readers dont want us to use, we might publish a blank magazine. Some of your explanations were erudite. title: Heaven, Texas and the Cosmic Whodunit
description: The Day of Judgment, prophesied for last weekend, has apparently been postponed, but moviegoers eager for rapture can find consolation  to say nothing of awe, amazement and grist for endless argument  in The Tree of Life, Terrence Malicks new film, which contemplates human existence from the standpoint of eternity. Recently showered with temporal glory at the Cannes Film Festival, where it won the Palme dOr, this movie, Mr. Malicks fifth feature in 38 years, folds eons of cosmic and terrestrial history into less than two and a half hours. Its most provocative sequences envision the origin of the universe, the development of life on earth (including a few soulful dinosaurs) and then, more concisely and less literally, the end of time, when the dead of all the ages shall rise and walk around on a heavenly beach.

I am grateful for the responses to the posts about prix fixe policy, the talkative owner and the restaurant itself. It may be impossible to please all the people all the time, but all the people who take the time to write please me all the time. Thank you.

title: Dont Forget the Cable Box in a Disaster
description: Many readers made thoughtful comments in response to my post earlier this week, asking what they would take if they had to leave their home quickly in a disaster. Children, pets and sentimental keepsakes topped their lists, along with wallets and credit cards. No one talked about grabbing the cable television box. But apparently, that may be a good idea.

title: Analysis: Why Clijsters Lost
description: Nature abhors a vacuum, and tennis, like physics, obeys the laws of the universe. So when Kim Clijsters got the yips late in the second set against Arantxa Rus and began backing off of her forcing groundstrokes, Rus surged in to take control. It was barely discernible for a minute or two, but when Rus saved the second match point against her with a beautiful lefty forehand cross-court winner, the energy and dominance that Clijsters showed took leave of her and the momentum shifted.

title: Stripes | Haans Nicholas Mott
description: Haans Nicholas Motts traipse into designing clothes was kind of an accident. Someone who just liked my style one day unexpectedly asked me if I wanted to work on the line with him, says Mott. Perhaps because of his background in architecture, the New York-based designer, who is 33, is very particular about the construction of his unisex private label line. The clothes have been featured alongside Rick Owens, Ann Demeulemeester and Yohji Yamamoto in editorials for SOME/THINGS magazine. His collection includes hand-painted striped tops (five to six hours of painting) that are frayed in all the right places (36 hours to machine-sew and hand finish) and have the perfect dose of weight to shield against a cool spring breeze. The fit is boyish and over sized but the imperfection of the lines add a touch of whimsy. The collection also has unconventionally shaped short jackets (another three to five days of sewing) and rich-hued duffel coats with detachable hoods (hand sewn for eight to nine days). Architecture gives you a set of problem-solving skills, he says. Once I started sewing, I got very into cutting patterns, developing stitches and constructing things. Each collection has only about a dozen pieces and is only available through special order. When things become large, you cant control it, says Mott. That firm control of his process, he says, is the most exciting part of clothing making. If the process become boring, Ill quit.

title: Doctors and the D Word

One evening, about 9 p.m., a nurse called to inform me that her patient had expired and that she would need to be assigned to a different patient for the next day.

When they polished off their Western Conference finals series against the Thunder with another admirably gritty finish, the Mavericks celebrated with only marginally more elation than if they had scored tickets to a taping of Glee. Yes, they were making the point that they have been this far before, but everyone knows how long and painful the five-year gap has been.

title: The Circle of Life: 3-D Movies, Rated G Through XXX

The movie, an erotic Hong Kong period drama called 3D Sex and Zen: Extreme Ecstasy and directed by Christopher Sun, is a remake of a 1991 film called Sex and Zen, which in turn is adapted from a 17th-century work of Chinese erotic fiction known as The Carnal Prayer Mat. (Among its characters are a lascivious scholar, his virginal bride, a duke with an estimable harem and a horse.)

title: Excerpt: 'The Best Is Yet to Come'

title: What to Do at a Yellow Light? And Other Things American Drivers Dont Know
description: If required to take a written drivers test today, nearly one in five licensed drivers would not pass, according to results of the 2011 GMAC Insurance National Drivers Test. This translates to 36.9 million American drivers, or 18 percent of the countrys total licensed motorists, who lack knowledge of some basic rules of the road  a conclusion that probably wont surprise many drivers.

title: Zach Braff Finds People for His Play All New People
description: Having been successfully located on a hotel rooftop in The Hangover  and had the good sense to stay out of trouble in its sequel, The Hangover Part II  Justin Bartha will next turn up in Second Stage Theaters production of the Zach Braff play All New People, as part of a cast that also features Anna Camp, Krysten Ritter and David Wilson Barnes, the theater company said on Thursday.

title: 36 Hours Niagara Falls
description: Its best to go back and forth between Canada and New York to get the best of both Niagaras.

title: 36 Hours in Niagara Falls
description: AT Niagara Falls, the United States is the poor relation and Canada is king. Nature gave Canada the wide-angle view of the majestic waterfall that straddles the border between the two countries, and the Canadians commercial bet on tourism landed most of the visitor comforts on their side of the Niagara River. American reliance on industry, however, ended in Rust Belt ruin. Yet the story isnt so simple. Casinos, high-rise hotels and hucksterish come-ons have so proliferated in Niagara Falls, Ontario, that it risks feeling like a tired amusement park. Meanwhile, in Niagara Falls, New York, the visitor who ventures inside the shabby, underfinanced state park is surprised to discover vestiges of something like a natural landscape. The party is in Canada. The real feel of the river, in all its awesome power, is more accessible in the United States. Hop back and forth to get the best of both Niagaras and see for yourself.

title: A Marines Mom Writes
description: Recently I read a blog item posted by a Marine currently serving in Afghanistan. It seems I read everything lately about the war in Afghanistan since my oldest son, Cpl. Joseph OBrien Jr., was sent to Sangin, Afghanistan, with the Second Battalion, Eighth Marines. To the world, he is a Marine; to me, he is Joey  my little boy.

description: Horace Greeley said, Go West, young man, and now an agency named Mr. Youth, which specializes in social marketing, is taking his advice.

title: The Morning Line: Plenty of Interest in the Belmont
description: There is speculation that the field for the June 11 running of the Belmont Stakes will be a large one. The Thoroughbred Times reports that NYRA has a list of 19 potential starters and the Belmont is a safe bet to at least match the 12-horse field from last year. The record number of starters for the Belmont was 15 in 1983, and the maximum number of starters is 16.

title: Zingaropoli

title: Technology, or Lack Thereof,  at the Podium
description: I do a lot of public speaking. My usual format is to speak off the cuff, without notes or script, and use a Keynote or PowerPoint slide show to guide me. (No, not bullet points  ugh!  but videos, funny visuals or other scenic elements.)
