description: WHEN Regina Keller Gil began to shape the Gold Coast International Film Festival  it opens Wednesday and runs for five days in five North Shore communities  she was already well aware of the power of movies to bring out a crowd. As the executive director of the Great Neck Arts Center, whose offerings include film, I can fill an auditorium at a multiplex on a Thursday night, every week, she said recently.

title: Beguiled by Humble Objects Like Peppers and Toilets
description: Is it too much to say that the history of 20th-century art can be read through its attitude toward toilets? Perhaps. But evidence that toilets played at least a cameo role is on view in Edward Weston: Life Work at the Heckscher Museum of Art in Huntington, N.Y.

title: Arizona Man Looks to Law in Bid to Retrieve Ranch
description: PHOENIX  An Arizona border activist is seeking to take advantage of a new state law restricting court awards to illegal immigrants to avoid paying nearly a million dollars that a Texas judge ruled he owes two Salvadoran migrants he detained in 2003.

title: A Weekend in Port
description: On the town with women of the Navy during Fleet Week.

title: Brunch and TV, but Still a Workday
description: When you are a writer, even Sunday is a workday. J. Courtney Sullivan, 29, whose second novel, Maine, due out next month from Knopf, is expected to be one of the major beach reads of the summer, usually goes to the Brooklyn Writers Space at some point during the day. Still, she makes time for walks with her puppy, for breakfasts fit for a lumberjack and for lazing around the apartment in Park Slope that she shares with her boyfriend, Kevin Johannesen, 34, owner of a company that manages advertising sales for Internet start-ups.  JULIE BOSMAN

title: City Critic: The New Coney Island
description: Neil Genzlinger rides the four new attractions at Scream Zone located in Coney Island's Luna Park.

title: Coney Island Gets 4 New Thrill Rides
description: Last weekend, right about the time the rapture was supposed to be happening, I was ascending. Man, was I ever ascending. I believe I even shouted a few phrases invoking divine beings. It may have been the best 0.57 seconds of my life.

title: Justices Arizona Ruling on Illegal Immigration May Embolden States
description: The decision by the Supreme Court this week upholding an Arizona law punishing employers for hiring illegal immigrants was an energy boost for state lawmakers across the country who have proposed bills this year to curb illegal immigration. As if they needed it.

title: Ailing Megachurch Is Selling Its Property
description: LOS ANGELES  Crystal Cathedral Ministries, known for the towering Orange County megachurch where Hour of Power is taped, has agreed to sell its campus to a real estate investment group as part of a plan to emerge from bankruptcy.

title: By Smallest of Margins, Bruins Seal Finals Spot
description: BOSTON  On Friday, before Game 7 of the Eastern Conference finals, Bruins goalie Tim Thomas had a dream.

title: Sports Photo Replay  May 27
description: The day in sports, from the French Open to rhythmic gymnastics.

title: Friday Night Lights Watch: Heavily Involved Parents
description: We are covering the final season of Friday Night Lights according to the NBC schedule. We ask that readers who have already seen the season on DirecTV or on DVD to please refrain from giving away future plot points in the comments section. For analysis of previous episodes, click here.

title: Making Legislative History, With Nod From Obama and Stroke of an Autopen
description: WASHINGTON  Generations of children learned the basics of the American legislative process from a Schoolhouse Rock cartoon, in which Bill sings, If he signs me, then Ill be a law.

title: Israeli Troops Move Into Gaza
description: Israel opens a ground war against Hamas after a week of intense airstrikes.

title: A Troubled Life and a Mysterious Case
description: A look at the investigation into the 2001 anthrax attacks reveals lingering uncertainty over the perpetrators true identity.

title: A 911 Call That Can Help Save a Sirloin, and the Grillers Ego
description: SCHAUMBURG, Ill.  Man. Meat. Fire.

title: Champions League Preview: Talking Tactics
description: Hyperbole is rarely in short supply on the eve of a major soccer final, but Manchester United Coach Alex Ferguson might have been on to something on Friday. In his final news conference before United faces Barcelona in Saturdays UEFA Champions League final, Ferguson predicted the matchup would produce the best game of the past 10 years.

title: Yankees Start Trip With Loss in Seattle
description: SEATTLE  For the Yankees, the western sojourn that began Friday night is not just a nine-game trip. It is a test of their mettle, measuring the efficiency of their offense, in three spacious ballparks, against starting pitchers who excel at their craft. Runs will be precious. So will victories.

title: Budget Disinformation, Part 1 Million
description: Im late in getting to Glenn Hubbards debt column, but it still needs further bashing. Heres what Hubbard says about the Obama administration:

title: The Weekend Word: Brash
description: Todays Times

title: 2010 Chargers: What the Film Revealed
description: While we wonder whether there will be a 2011 season, this is part of a series looking back at the 2010 season, with the benefit of film analysis.

title: Classic Ad: Volkswagens Blue-Sky Beetle
description: Its Memorial Day weekend, a time to rise from the cubicle, hop in the car, put the top down and take to the open road.

title: Egypt Lifts Blockade, Along With the Gazans Hopes
description: RAFAH BORDER CROSSING, Egypt  Hundreds of Palestinian residents of the Gaza Strip arrived here by the busload on Saturday to pass through the reopened border into Egypt, taking the first tangible steps out of a four-year Israeli blockade.

title: 8 Die in Bombing of Pakistan Restaurant
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  At least eight people were killed on Saturday when a bomb ripped through a restaurant in the restive northwestern tribal region of Bajaur, officials said.

title: Newt Gingrich, Small-Business Owner
description: Last Sunday, Newt Gingrich, the former House speaker and current Republican presidential candidate, told America that he was a small-business owner. The revelation came on CBSs Face the Nation, as the candidate tried to deflect questions (PDF) from Bob Schieffer, the host, about his recently revealed debts to Tiffany and Company.

title: Medicare and the Disaffected Vote
description: In the wake of the NY-26 election, both Henry Olson and Jonathan Chait pointed out that the constituency most resistant to Paul Ryans Medicare reforms seems to be conservative-leaning blue collar voters  what the Pew Research Center, in a recent report, calls the Disaffecteds. (This is a cohort that I mentioned in my column on Mike Huckabees appeal, and it overlaps to some degree with the Sams Club Republicans that Reihan Salam and I spent a whole book talking about.) Chait calls this the demographic group that should terrify Republicans, because theyre a crucial constituency for the right-of-center coalition, but theyre also more resistant to cutting Medicare and Social Security than most Democratic-leaning groups.

title: Del Potro Returns to Competitive Form
description: I watched the first two sets of the Djokovic-Del Potro match searching for any sign of weakness in the tall Argentines game. I found none, and in fact felt that he had Djokovic on the defensive when the match was called in the waning light on Friday night. Despite a years absence from the tour, and a comeback interrupted by a slight tear high in the quadricep that put his return to Roland Garros in doubt, Del Potro served well, hit out with authority on his ground strokes, and competed fearlessly against the tours dominant player. Having Del Potro back in the mix in a Grand Slam adds excitement to the mens game, and Saturdays continuation of the match has tennis fans buzzing over the high quality of the first two sets.

title: Nadal Advances to the Fourth Round
description: PARIS  Rafael Nadal of Spain used his potent forehand and a strong-arm backhand service return to move easily into the fourth round of the French Open Saturday. He defeated Antonio Veic of Croatia, the worlds 227th ranked player, 6-1, 6-3, 6-0.

title: Obama Cites Poland as Model for Arab Shift
description: WARSAW  President Obama held up Poland on Saturday as a model for Arab nations undergoing political change, saying its peaceful overthrow of Communism held lessons for Tunisia and other Arab countries grappling with the chaotic aftermath of popular revolts.

title: Murray Rolls On Despite Injury
description: PARIS - Andy Murray rolled on the red clay, his face a portrait in pain, after injuring his right ankle Saturday in his third round French Open match against Michael Berrer of Germany.

title: Success and Scandal Can Leave Everyone Weary
description: With scandal looming, soccer did the best it could in the Champions League final on Saturday  sending out the most creative team of its generation, temporarily taking everybodys mind off intrigue at the home office.

title: Murder of Activists Raises Questions of Justice in Amazon
description: Early last Tuesday, Jos Cludio Ribeiro da Silva, a forest activist and tree nut harvester, and his wife, Maria do Espirito Santo, drove a motorcycle through Brazils northern Para State, in the Amazon rain forest. As they crossed a river bridge, gunmen lying in wait opened fire with a pistol and shotgun, killing them.

title: Inflation and Debt (Wonkish)
description: As I mentioned in an earlier post, the latest OECD Economic Outlook is a remarkable document  and I mean that in the worst way. Ive already pointed to the reports insistence that we must raise interest rates, because foofa grrzt bumble shazam  OK, thats not quite what the report says, but it makes at least as much sense as the justification the report does offer.

title: Gil Scott-Heron, Voice of Black Protest Culture, Dies at 62
description: Gil Scott-Heron, the poet and recording artist whose syncopated spoken style and mordant critiques of politics, racism and mass media in pieces like The Revolution Will Not Be Televised made him a notable voice of black protest culture in the 1970s and an important early influence on hip-hop, died on Friday at a hospital in Manhattan. He was 62 and had been a longtime resident of Harlem.

title: Urban Forager | Spring Sprucing
description: Some weeks ago, I started noticing nascent light-green buds on the branches of every city conifer I encountered from Central Park down to Staten Island. Unlike mature pine needle tea  a resiny, survivalist food at best  fresh, young evergreen tips are a citrusy surprise to the palate, and I couldnt help nibbling on a choice few. At the College of Staten Island, I discovered a midsize, classic Christmas-tree-looking conifer, which friends at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden identified as a Colorado blue spruce. It had very lemony-tasting tips.

title: Bhupathi and Paes Are Eliminated
description: PARIS  Mahesh Bhupathi and Leander Paes of India, the worlds third-ranked doubles team, tumbled out of the French Open Saturday in a straight set upset loss to Stephen Huss and Ashley Fisher of Australia, 7-6 (7), 6-4.

title: Bodies Found Near Site of Protests in Georgia
description: MOSCOW  Georgias Interior Ministry reported the discovery of two bodies on a roof near the site of the past weeks antigovernment demonstrations, and said that the police were studying whether the deaths could have been related to the protests.

title: Who You Gonna Bet On? An Update
description: Its not quite a year yet since Business Week ran a piece ridiculing my concerns about prolonged economic weakness, comparing it to the wisdom of John Paulson, who saw a boom  particularly in housing  just around the corner. Still, it seems worth revisiting.

title: Accidents Overshadow Action in Monaco
description: MONACO  Todays track action in Monaco has been overshadowed by two bad accidents.

title: Accidents Overshadow Action in Monaco
description: MONACO  Todays track action in Monaco has been overshadowed by two bad accidents.

title: Torres Gift to All Fathers: Frank Talk About Prostate Cancer
description: When Joe Torre was managing, he used to receive suggestions from fans about lineups and rotations and, most helpful of all, how to handle the Boss. As if.

title: In Arena League, Theyre Ready for Some Football
description: PHILADELPHIA  The drama inside Wells Fargo Center late Friday centered not on lawyers or lockouts, but on actual professional football. Pads crunched. Passes flew. Lights flashed. Labor factored in only as it related to physical exertion.

title: Can Turkey Unify the Arabs?
description: GAZIANTEP, Turkey

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Wilpons Words Are Wise; His Timing May Not Be
description: The Mets lost their third straight game on Saturday, and Fred Wilpons popularity as the teams owner has reached its lowest point.

title: Diamondbacks Revamp Bullpen Without Costly Additions
description: In a six-game stretch from late April to mid-May, Joaquin Benoit of the Detroit Tigers allowed 12 earned runs, three more than he did all of last season for the Tampa Bay Rays. That short stretch of shaky pitching showed just how volatile a relievers results can be from year to year.

title: Variety: A Very Romantic Diagramless
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  Once youve solved this puzzle, you might think that Patrick Blindauer is a tad obsessed with the letter H, but in reading between the lines on this one, Im wondering if it also serves as a love letter to his fiancee. Each of the theme entries is a phrase that has that double H going for it, and most of them are fairly romantic. Or maybe its a love letter to Henry Hook, what do I know?

title: Have an Enjoyable Memorial Day Weekend
description: Wheels will be taking a short break in observance of Memorial Day, but well return on Tuesday, May 31, with our regular coverage. Whatever mode of transport conveys you to your destination, the editors and contributors at Wheels wish you safe and happy travels this holiday weekend.

title: When Play in Paris Resumes, So Does Djokovics Undefeated Streak
description: PARIS  Best of three. Best of five. Darkness. Daylight. Delays. Resumptions. Italian clay. French clay. None of it has affected the bottom line for Novak Djokovic in 2011. He remains unbeatable, or more to the point, undefeated.

title: When Warnings Dont Work
description: TORNADO experts had seen it all before: whole neighborhoods obliterated, big-box stores flattened, even a hospital badly damaged.

title: When Everything Is Gone, Including a Sense of Direction
description: Where is Dudes Daylight Donuts, whose glazed treats made mornings better? Where is the Elks lodge, the place to go on Friday nights for a meal, a few beers and a lot of laughs?

title: Spoelstra Raised to Be in N.B.A., and Rising to Challenge
description: Watson Spoelstra covered sports in Detroit during the middle of the last century. It was another era, another world. There were no computers, just typewriters. Reporters traveled with teams and inevitably became close with some of the players they wrote about. They might even bail a player out of jail, as Spoelstra once did for the Detroit Lions Bobby Layne.

title: A Work Ethic Shaped at an Early Age
description: This interview with Liz Elting, president and C.E.O. of TransPerfect, a translation service, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Taliban Bomber Infiltrates Afghan-NATO Meeting, Killing Police Official and Others
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A Taliban suicide bomber on Saturday infiltrated a heavily guarded governors compound in northern Afghanistan where top NATO and Afghan officials from the region were meeting, killing several people there, including the highly regarded police commander Gen. Daoud Daoud, Afghan officials said.

title: In Florida, Criminals Pose as Police More Frequently and for More Violent Ends
description: MIAMI  A black BMW flashing red and blue lights suddenly filled Alexandria Armeleys rearview mirror one evening last month. At a stoplight, the BMWs driver pulled up next to her, waved a gold badge and told her Im a cop.

title: Agencies Lack of Coordination Hindered Supply of Crucial Gas, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  The United States is running out of a rare gas that is crucial for detecting smuggled nuclear weapons materials because one arm of the Energy Department was selling the gas six times as fast as another arm could accumulate it, and the two sides failed to communicate for years, according to a new Congressional audit.

title: Dana Brand, Who Blogged of Mets Fans Delight and Despair, Dies at 56
description: He was 7  years old, sitting in his room, riveted to his familys portable radio and wearing his little plastic baseball glove. It was 1962, and Dana Brand was listening to the Mets inaugural game, and so began a love affair that would last until his death on Wednesday at 56.

title: Funny or Die: Groupons Fate Hinges on Words
description: CHICAGO

title: Partner Could Gain Control of Mets in 3 Years
description: David Einhorn, the hedge fund titan who is in negotiations to buy a $200 million stake in the Mets, could own a majority of the team in three years, a person with direct knowledge of the negotiations said Saturday.

title: Mirasol Silan and Mark Base
description: Mirasol Quinto Silan and Mark Allen Montesa Base were married Saturday at the Inn at Fox Hollow, a banquet hall in Woodbury, N.Y. The Rev. Robert J. Allmen, a priest of the Reformed Catholic Church, officiated.

title: Champions League Final: Barcelona 3, Manchester United 1
description: Coverage and live analysis of the UEFA Champions League final between Manchester United and Barcelona from Wembley Stadium in London.

title: Jennifer Balakrishnan and Vivek Venkatachalam
description: Jennifer Shyamala Sayaka Balakrishnan was married Saturday evening in Cambridge, Mass., to Vivek Venkatachalam. The Rev. Dr. Dorothy A. Austin, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Memorial Church at Harvard University, where she is a chaplain.

title: Bridget Guarasci and Mani Potnuru
description: Bridget Lauren Guarasci and Mani S. Potnuru were married Friday evening in Brooklyn. Judith N. McMahon, a State Supreme Court judge on Staten Island, officiated at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

title: Marissa Heiser, Nicholas Kohn
description: Marissa Lee Heiser and Nicholas Lee Kohn are to be married Sunday at the Highfield Theater in Falmouth, Mass. Officiating will be Judge R. Knox McMahon, who is the bridegrooms godfather and sits on the 11th Judicial Circuit in Lexington County in South Carolina; he received a one-day solemnization certificate from Massachusetts.

title: Stacey Marmor, Matthew Balaban
description: Stacey Josepher Marmor and Matthew Craig Balaban are to be married Sunday evening at the Westchester Country Club in Rye, N.Y., by Rabbi David H. Lincoln.

title: Alison Guest, James Soldano
description: Alison Erika Guest and James Wilcox Soldano were married Saturday in Newport, R.I. The Rev. Kris von Maluski, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Our Lady of Mercy Chapel at Salve Regina University.

title: Alexandra Kaufman, John Anderson-Lynch
description: Alexandra Leigh Kaufman and John Martin Anderson-Lynch were married Saturday at Willowdale Estate, an event space in Topsfield, Mass. The Rev. Ellen P. Jackson, a Universal Brotherhood minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Neema Saran, Neil Sinha
description: Neema Saran and Dr. Neil Sinha are to be married Sunday at the Doubletree Somerset Hotel in Somerset, N.J. Krishna P. Dixit, a Hindu priest, is to officiate.

title: Marnina Cherkin, Samuel Ostroff
description: Marnina Brawarsky Cherkin and Samuel Miles Ostroff are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Edward Schecter at Temple Beth Shalom in Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y. Rabbi Serena L. Fujita, a chaplain at Bucknell University, is to participate.

title: Marina Shaw, Anthony Petro
description: Vassiliki Marina Shaw and Anthony Michael Petro are to be married Sunday in New York. The Rev. Dr. Frank Marangos is to perform the ceremony at the Greek Orthodox Archdiocesan Cathedral of the Holy Trinity, where he is the dean, with the Rev. Dr. Robert G. Stephanopoulos, a former dean, taking part.

title: Mina Kim, Marcus Mucha
description: Yongmin Kim and Marcus James Omond Mucha are to be married Sunday in an outdoor civil ceremony in Grand Teton National Park, Wyo. Tom H. Jordan, a municipal judge in Jackson County, Wyo., is to officiate.

title: Chlo Schama, Michael Pyle
description: Chlo Frances Schama, the daughter of Virginia E. Papaioannou and Simon Schama of Briarcliff Manor, N.Y., was married Saturday to Michael Jason Pyle, the son of Elizabeth C. Pyle and Stephen H. Pyle of Decatur, Ill. Robert N. Jose, a friend of the brides family who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the home of her parents.

title: Susannah Friedman, Gareth Crawford
description: Susannah Ash Friedman and Gareth Marshall Crawford are to be married Sunday in Rensselaerville, N.Y. George Frangos, a friend of the brides family who became a Universal Life minister for the event, is to officiate at the Rensselaerville Meeting Center.

title: Rachel Elson, Eric Waltari
description: Rachel F. Elson and Eric Charles Waltari were married Saturday evening at their apartment in Brooklyn. Elke A. Hofmann, a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Alexandra Schagrin, Jason Rubin
description: Alexandra Zoe Schagrin, a daughter of Shelby and Charles Schagrin of Clayton, Mo., is to be married Sunday to Dr. Jason Wilder Katz Rubin, the son of Joette Katz and Philip E. Rubin of Fairfield, Conn. The Rabbi Jeffrey B. Stiffman is to officiate at the home of the brides parents.

title: Eleanor Shephard, Ty Buckelew
description: Eleanor Margaret Shephard and Ty Richard Buckelew were married Saturday at the Carlyle Hotel in New York. The Rev. Gregory P. Fryer, a Lutheran minister, officiated.

title: Lauren LaRusso, Matthew Drago
description: Lauren Elizabeth LaRusso, a daughter of Miriam F. LaRusso and William J. LaRusso of Stamford, Conn., is to be married Sunday in Worcester, Mass., to Dr. Matthew Joseph Drago, a son of Irene M. Drago and Joseph A. Drago of Western Springs, Ill. The Rev. James M. Hayes, a Roman Catholic priest, is to perform the ceremony at St. Joseph Chapel on the campus of Holy Cross, where he is an associate chaplain.

title: Laura Winthrop, Spencer Abbot
description: Laura Winthrop and Cmdr. C. Spencer Abbot were married Saturday at Ascension Memorial Church in Ipswich, Mass. The Rev. Bradford D. Clark, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Bridget Fallon, Brian Charville
description: Bridget Colleen Fallon and Brian Roger Charville were married Saturday by the Rev. Nancy Charville Goulet, a United Methodist minister and an aunt of the bridegroom, at the Church of the Covenant in Boston.

title: Jodie Gordon, Joshua Bloom
description: Jodie Melissa Gordon and Joshua Daniel Bloom are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Molly G. Kane at the Block and Hexter Vacation Center, a resort in Poyntelle, Pa.

title: Meghan McMahon, Patrick Kennedy
description: Meghan Elizabeth McMahon, the daughter of Elizabeth Ann McMahon and Dr. Patrick V. McMahon of Pelham Manor, N.Y., was married Saturday to Lt. j.g. Patrick Thomas Kennedy, a son of Thelma Kennedy and James M. Kennedy of Sugarloaf, Pa. Msgr. Stephen P. McHenry performed the ceremony at the St. Bede Catholic Church in Williamsburg, Va.

title: Sasha Ragovin-Polonsky, Adam Tulgan
description: Sasha Elena Ragovin-Polonsky and Adam Tulgan are to be married Sunday at the American Academy of Arts & Sciences in Cambridge, Mass. Rabbi Robert Scheinberg is to officiate, with Margaret H. Marshall, the former chief justice of the Supreme Judicial Court of Massachusetts, taking part.

title: Thayer Christodoulo, Philip Meicler
description: Thayer Sybil Christodoulo, the daughter of Pamela C. Christodoulo and George E. Christodoulo of Belmont, Mass., was married Saturday evening to Philip Mark Meicler, the son of Muriel Meicler and Marcel Meicler of Houston. Ron Sege, a member of the brides family who received temporary authority from Massachusetts to marry the couple, officiated at the Charles Hotel in Cambridge, Mass.

title: Steven Fuchs, Brian Lancaster
description: Steven Fuchs and Brian Peter Lancaster are to be married Sunday at their home in Washington, Conn. Rabbi Lisa J. Grushcow is to officiate.

title: Buzz Is Back for Centennial at the Brickyard
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Tony Kanaan, the gregarious racecar driver from Brazil, began hearing the stories from the old-timers and hangers-on not long after he arrived for his first Indianapolis 500 nine years ago. There was one common thread: the Indy 500 used to be a lot better.

title: Carl Edwards Forgoes Feuds and Leads Standings
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Carl Edwards wanted a celebration to remember when he won the annual Nascar All-Star race May 21 at Charlotte Motor Speedway. So he turned his car onto the grass along the front stretch of the racetrack for what he hoped would be a spectacular spin.

title: Brown Ushers in New Era for the Lakers
description: Widespread approval greeted the news last week that the Los Angeles Lakers had chosen Mike Brown to replace the retiring legend Phil Jackson. And why not?

title: Egypt Opens Border
description: Egypt lifted a four-year-old blockade on the Gaza Strips main link to the outside world Saturday, bringing relief to the crowded territorys 1.5 million Palestinians but deepening a rift with Israel since the ouster of President Hosni Mubarak earlier this year.

title: For Columbia Class of 41, It Is Always the Day After
description: Lou Gehrig, Columbias most eminent sports figure, died June 2, 1941. The next day, I received my bachelors degree from the university.

title: A Splintered Landscape
description: The tornado that carved through southwestern Missouri last Sunday leveled parts of Joplin so completely  taking landmarks, street signs, everything  that the communitys inner GPS remains out of whack.

title: Troubled Veterans and Early Deaths After Iraq
description: This month, the Department of Veterans Affairs informed the parents of William Hamilton, an Iraq war veteran, that it was not responsible for his death.

title: U.S. Has Binged. Soon Itll Be Time to Pay the Tab.
description: SAY this about all the bickering over the federal debt ceiling: at least people are talking openly about our nations growing debt load. This $14.3 trillion issue is front and center  exactly where it should be.

title: For Kyle Drabek, Its No. 4, the One and Only
description: For a pitcher with only a few months in the major leagues, Torontos Kyle Drabek is easy to identify. He is the son of Doug Drabek, the 1990 National League Cy Young Award winner; he was the Blue Jays centerpiece in the trade that sent Roy Halladay to Philadelphia; and he is the only pitcher in the majors with a single-digit uniform number.

title: Playing Through Pain Is a Playoff Ritual
description: One of the most celebrated aspects of Stanley Cup play is the pain players endure to make a contribution during the postseason. It is a point of professional pride that hockey players will dress for games with injuries that would sideline most other athletes.

title: French System Tints View of the Strauss-Kahn Case
description: PARIS  The sexual assault case against Dominique Strauss-Kahn, which continues to crowd out much other news here, is becoming something of a civics lesson in American justice  one that has inspired both biting criticism and some respect.

title: The Trouble With the Echo Chamber Online
description: ON the Web, we often see what we like, and like what we see. Whether we know it or not, the Internet creates personalized e-comfort zones for each one of us.

title: War Crimes Suspect Could Be Extradited Tuesday
description: BELGRADE, Serbia  Serbian officials vowed on Saturday to track down all those who had helped hide Ratko Mladic and other fugitives accused of war crimes, but their prime interest now is to get the former Bosnian Serb general packed off to the war crimes tribunal in The Hague, which could happen as early as Tuesday.

title: A Psychological Twister
description: Norman, Okla.

title: Consumer Complaints Made Easy. Maybe Too Easy.
description: PHONE trees that lead nowhere. Customer service drones chained to a script. The modern corporation has invented a thousand ways to tell customers with a grievance: Youre out of luck. And, no, contrary to our dulcet recording, your call is not important to us.

title: Why Are Investors Still Lining Up for Bonds?
description: THERE is nothing more intimidating than the bond market, once it starts flexing its muscles. So said James Carville, the Democratic political strategist, after finding himself on the losing side of some bruising budget battles in the 1990s.

title: Mentoring Program Is in Peril
description: On Tuesday, 14-year-old Delvon Morgan carefully removed one of his pastel pythons from a plastic tub in his Oakland bedroom. This one, he said, hes a proven breeder.

title: Can I See Your License, Registration and C.P.U.?
description: MOST of us dont trust computers completely, and for good reason. Our smartphones freeze and our hard drives crash with disconcerting regularity. Yet we frequently place our lives in the hands of computers, which are embedded in our cars, operate airplane navigation systems and even help conduct robot-guided laser surgery.

title: Tenderloin National Forest
description: Nestled between a cluster of residential buildings and hotels in San Franciscos Tenderloin district is a surprising outcropping of green  the so-called Tenderloin National Forest. Formerly known as Cohen Alley, the small urban enclave is not really a national forest but a former  dumping ground for hypodermic needles and garbage.

title: A Venture Born in the Kitchen
description: WHEN I was 3, my dad called a family meeting and told us he was sick of shoveling snow in Minneapolis. We were moving to Scottsdale, Ariz., he announced.

title: East Bay Professors Political Odyssey Leads to His Arrest in Nigeria
description: On Thanksgiving last year, Steve Torkuma Ugbah gathered with his extended family at his sisters home in Elk Grove, outside Sacramento.

title: Retired, but Doing the Work You Love
From Russia, a Motorcycle Built for Two
description: Like so many other post-Communist enterprises, the Irbit motorcycle factory seemed to be sputtering into the sunset in the 1990s, but it found a new market for its sidecar bikes in the United States.

title: 30 Seconds With Steve Nash
description: Steve Nash, the Phoenix Suns star point guard and noted soccer enthusiast, is hosting the fourth annual Showdown in Chinatown, a charity soccer match, on June 22 on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. Tony Parker, Grant Hill and Brandon Jennings are among the N.B.A. stars playing in the match, which is free and open to the public. Proceeds from an after-hours event will benefit the Steve Nash Foundation. Nash, who lives in Manhattan in the off-season, has recently become an advocate for gay rights and recently lent his voice to a same-sex marriage initiative in New York State.

title: Sony and Epsilon Agree to Testify Before Congress
description: Sony has finally agreed to testify before a Congressional hearing that will be held by Representative Mary Bono Mack, the chairwoman of the House Subcommittee on Commerce, Manufacturing and Trade.

title: The Polite Way to Say No Way
description: WASHINGTON

title: In Williamsburg, Rocked Hard
description: WHEN crowds flock to the Williamsburg Waterfront concert series this summer, most will pass the home of Genya Wolowacz on North Eighth Street, where she has lived since 1957. She will watch them as if eyeing 6,500 barbarian invaders.

title: A Generation of Slackers? Not So Much
description: YOUD think there would be a little sympathy. This month, college graduates are jumping into the job market, only to land on their parents couches: the unemployment rate for 16- to 24-year-olds is a whopping 17.6 percent.

title: Nicholas V. Riasanovsky Dies at 87; Set Standard for Russian History
description: Nicholas V. Riasanovsky, a Russian migr who came to the United States at 14, served in the Army during World War II and became one of the countrys leading scholars of Russian history, writing a college textbook that served as the American standard for teaching Russian history during the cold war, died on May 14 in Oakland, Calif. He was 87.

title: Boy, 4, Is Mauled to Death by Dog in Brooklyn Home
description: A 4-year-old boy was mauled to death by a family dog as he and his two brothers played in a bedroom of their apartment in Brooklyn, the authorities said on Saturday.

title: The Office: Sedentary No More
description: News item: Less physical activity at work may be a major but overlooked culprit in rising American obesity, researchers reported last week.

title: Ahead of the Class
description: DONT HAVE THE GRADES to get into Oxford? It might not be a problem if youve got the cash. The British education minister has proposed letting wealthy students pay for spots at top universities even though they failed to get in through the regular admissions process. Rage and confusion have been the immediate results, The Boston Globe reports. Admission to British universities is based on meritocratic competition; once students get in, they pay a low flat fee. At Oxford, it is about $6,000 a year, The Globe says. Supporters of the idea say the extra cash will bolster the educational system. Less affluent students would not lose out, they say, because these new spots would be extra ones. Critics say the two-tier idea is profoundly unfair. The proposals are likely to be criticized as a means for the wealthiest to buy places at a time when the government is to cut 10,000 publicly funded places, The Guardian reported.

title: In Texas, Budget Held Sway for 20 Weeks
description: The 82nd Texas Legislatures regular session ends as it started, with lawmakers arguing about a shrunken state budget and redistricting.

title: Prime Number
description: 48: THE PERCENTAGE OF American households represented by married couples in 2010, the first time that figure has dropped below 50 percent, the Census Bureau reports. That is down from 78 percent in 1950. The days of Ozzie and Harriet have faded into the past, said William Frey, a demographer at the Brookings Institution who analyzed the census figures. Just a fifth of households were traditional families  married couples with children. The overwhelming majority of Americans still eventually marry, though increasingly working-class people do not stay married.

title: Fighting Words
description: Congress agreed last week to reauthorize the Patriot Act just before the terrorist surveillance law was set to expire. Senator Rand Paul, Republican of Kentucky, helped lead the opposition, to the consternation of many fellow Republicans.

title: Considered: Screen Grab
description: IT WAS JULY 12, 1995, and a cameraman from Bosnian Serb television was there, in the town of Srebrenica. United Nations forces had made it a safe haven for Bosnian Muslims, but Bosnian Serb forces had wrested it from them.

title: Back Then: 1984
description: PRESIDENT OBAMA IS HARDLY the first president to travel to Ireland in search of his roots  and of Irish Catholic votes back home. In June 1984, Ronald Reagan traveled to the green hills of County Tipperary, where his great-grandfather was baptized. The Timess Steven R. Weisman went along:

title: Laugh Lines
description: JAY LENO

title: Liking Is for Cowards. Go for What Hurts.
description: A COUPLE of weeks ago, I replaced my three-year-old BlackBerry Pearl with a much more powerful BlackBerry Bold. Needless to say, I was impressed with how far the technology had advanced in three years. Even when I didnt have anybody to call or text or e-mail, I wanted to keep fondling my new Bold and experiencing the marvelous clarity of its screen, the silky action of its track pad, the shocking speed of its responses, the beguiling elegance of its graphics.

title: Kevin Longs Winding Road
description: Part of Kevin Longs job as the hitting coach for the Yankees is to build trust, to get his players to buy what he is selling. He has been far more successful doing that than he was at an off-season job in the minors, when he tried to sell Yugos in Phoenix.

title: After Combat, the Unexpected Perils of Coming Home
description: Pvt. Johnnie Stevenson cleaned his truck one last time, scraping off the barnacle-like mud and pulling crushed water bottles from under seats. But deployment to Afghanistan was almost over, and his thoughts drifted elsewhere. Was his pregnant fiance ready to be a mother? Facebook provided so few clues. Nor could it answer him this: Was he ready to be a father?

title: Battle for Libya | May 28, 2011
description: NATO warplanes struck Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis compound in Tripoli on Saturday, as the new rebel administration warned it was fast running out of money because countries that promised financial aid have not come through.

title: Tony Horton Demonstrates a Push-Up
description: The fitness guru Tony Horton says exercisers should focus on engaging their core muscles.

title: The Fitness Revolution Will Be Televised (After Leno)
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.

title: Obama Expected to Name Armys Leader to Head Joint Chiefs
description: WASHINGTON  Gen. Martin E. Dempseys peers call him a pentathlete, the kind of post-Sept. 11 commander who not only knows the art of combat but is also adept at marshaling the power of diplomacy, money, allied cooperation and information.

title: From Scott Crow's F.B.I. File
description: These documents are among 440 pages that Scott Crow, an Austin, Tex., activist, received under the Freedom of Information Act. The Federal Bureau of Investigation wielded an impressive array of tools, the documents show, to monitor Mr. Crow, who has been arrested a dozen times during demonstrations but never convicted of anything more serious than trespassing.

title: The Morning Line: All About Animal Kingdom
description: Animal Kingdom is the story today. The Kentucky Derby winners trainer, Graham Motion, announced, as definitely as one can two weeks before the race, that Animal Kingdom is headed for the Belmont Stakes. Motion was quoted by The Associated Press as sayng, He bounced out of the Preakness very well and we are looking forward to running in the Belmont Stakes.

title: For Office Civility, Cherchez La Femme
description: PARIS

title: Disguised as Breakfast, Dessert Served for Lunch
description: As spring rapidly becomes summer, the lines have been growing longer at the citys food trucks, an ever-expanding collection of mobile options  food court meets convoy  that neatly satisfies the New York demand for convenience and variety. The taxicab-yellow Wafels and Dinges truck, which has trolled the streets since 2007, has become a mainstay. Offering a variety of Belgian waffles with sweet or savory toppings, the truck  its owners also have four carts and opened their first stationary outpost on Friday in Seaside Heights, N.J.  attracts a mix of repeat customers and passers-by intrigued by the novelty. On Wednesday, along Hanover Square near Water Street in the financial district, as a group of men ogled passing women and talked on cellphones, two co-workers asked for recommendations and discussed the notion of breakfast at lunch.

title: F.Y.I.
description: Q. Who invented the ice-cream sandwich?

title: Mixing the Sacred and the Secular
description: MSGR. MARCO FRISINA and the 47 members of the Choir of the Popes Diocese of Rome whom he will lead in a concert on June 4 in Trenton are not all newcomers to the United States, but they will be performing here as a group for the first time.

title: Alive and Well, and Also Aging, Alone and Desperate
description: Early in the second act of Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris, Rona Figueroa sings Ne Me Quitte Pas (Dont Leave Me) in French, with Andy Kelso, upstage right, softly contributing a few words of translation. Listening to it at a recent matinee, I thought: Maybe they should be doing the whole thing in French.

title: Pay Attention
description: Cairo

title: Kilowatts vs. Gallons
description: Comparing the costs of driving a battery-powered Nissan Leaf versus that of a similarly sized, conventionally powered Nissan Altima.

title: The Great Kilowatt vs. Gallon Face-Off
description: WITH Memorial Day upon us, and with it a summer driving season marked by high prices at the gas pump, it seems a fitting time to look at the electric car. How do the fuel and environmental costs of running one compare with the costs of a conventional car, or even the electricity to run appliances in your home? (Such details are on the minds of federal officials, who last week unveiled new fuel-economy stickers for vehicles, starting with the 2013 model year.)

title: In Evidence: a Terrorists To-Do List
description: CHICAGO  When the authorities arrested David C. Headley, the man who has since confessed to helping plot the 2008 terrorist attacks on Mumbai, India, they confiscated two items essential to the plans for his next plot: a book titled How to Pray Like a Jew and a lemon-yellow notepad.

title: Slums Into Malls
description: KOLKATA, India

title: Threats and Arrests at a Gay Rights Rally in Moscow
description: MOSCOW  Amid shouts from gangs of men and threats of beatings, police officers arrested more than a dozen gay rights activists, including a few foreigners, who attempted to hold a rally in Moscow on Saturday.

title: Another Forest Defender Falls in the Amazon
description: John Collins Rudolf has posted a thorough overview of the latest murder on the eroding perimeter of the Amazon rain forest in Brazil. Theres been enormous progress in efforts to bring governance to forest frontiers in Brazil since the late 1980s, when I spent months in the western Amazon reporting on the life and assassination of Chico Mendes for The Burning Season, my first book. But pistols and shotguns still sometimes blaze.

title: Passive in the Senate
description: Republican leaders in the Senate have spent weeks gleefully deriding the Democrats who run the chamber for not producing a budget proposal in more than two years. It is a classic tactic, designed to deflect attention from their partys toxic plan to privatize Medicare. The truth, though, is that the Republicans also have a point.

title: Readers Comment on the Rise of India
description: My Sunday column argues that India is turning around and that its takeoff is gaining traction around the country, even in places like Bihar and West Bengal. Ive been a bit wary of India in the past, previously noting that the tech sector accomplishments are real but have tiny employment and that solid chunks of India remain abysmally undeveloped. Thats still true, but my latest trip leaves me more optimistic. India is steadily evolving in the right direction  while in China theres reason for more caution. Under President Hu Jintao, Chinas evolution has paused, and there probably wont be more movement until after the Communist Party Congress in late 2012 installs Xi Jinping as Hus successor. I still would never bet against China, but I think India may be able to narrow the gap in the coming years.

title: A Portrait of the Ravages of Alzheimers
description: To the Editor:

title: Governor Cuomos Aide Defends Proposed Tax Cap
description: To the Editor:

title: Court Street in Brooklyn, 9:08 P.M.
A Justices Literary Heroes
description: To the Editor:

title: Tornado Losses in 2011 Worst Since 1950
description: The federal Storm Prediction Center has released its latesttally of tornadoes and deaths for 2011, with the current count of523 now making this the worst year since 1950.. [May 30, 11:45 p.m. | Updated  This line and the headline have been adjusted to eliminate an error explained at the end of this post.]

title: Gender and Therapists
description: To the Editor:

title: In Libyan Rebel Capital, Shouts of Thanks to America and the West
description: BENGHAZI, Libya  Frustrated by the gridlocked traffic, the young man in fatigues was leaning on the horn of his old Chevrolet Impala, the one with the front and rear windshields shot out. The shrillness of the pointless noise made a foreigner in the car next to him wince.

title: Sunday: Is For You?
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Before we get started today, I just want to take a moment to applaud my fellow constructors, particularly todays, for their creativity and the ingenious lengths they go to in order to entertain us. I did most of the puzzle today with my mouth hanging open and I sincerely hope that when you discovered the gimmick, you were just as pleasantly surprised.

title: A Further Overreach on Political Money
description: The spree of big-money political campaigning  and the corruption that comes with it  seemed guaranteed to worsen Thursday when a federal judge in Virginia ruled that corporations are now free to make direct donations to federal candidates.

title: The Smartphone as Tour Guide for Central Park
description: APP Central Park

title: Old-School Italian in a Spruced-Up Space
description: AFTER almost a year of serious remodeling, Albas doors reopened last September onto a spiffy space with an upscale yet homey look. Done tastefully in muted tones with white architectural detailing, the large dining room is defined subtly by the varied shapes of large Oriental-style rugs that add softness and a touch of luxury.

title: Amid a Bit of Railroad History
description: Whether you roll in from the Putnam County Trailway bike path or stroll in from the nearby Putnam Music Center, the laid-back Freight House Cafe is a nifty place to unwind or rewind  a charming piece of history set well back from the busy traffic of Route 6.

title: Boutique Wines on Parade
description: Brooklyn Uncorked, a wine-and-food showcase at the Brooklyn Academy of Music this month, offered a chance to sample recent wines of Long Island boutique producers who have kept a low profile. Many of the wineswere made by contract vintners from the vintners own or from bought grapes.

title: Steak and Seafood, and Views of a Bay
description: FORGET June 21. Summer starts this weekend, and on Long Island, summer is synonymous with water  including water views. One of the best places around to enjoy them while dining out is Lombardis on the Bay in Patchogue.

title: Spammers and Their Bankers
description: In early 2004 Bill Gates claimed that two years from now, spam will be solved. Today it amounts to 70 percent of all e-mail. Yet there may be a chance to cut it back.

title: Final Goodbye to a Mars Explorer
description: After a final attempt last week, NASA has stopped trying to make contact with the Mars rover called Spirit, which was last heard from in March 2010 as the Martian winter was setting in. Hopes of hearing more from Spirit were slim even then, but there is a difference between not hearing and no longer listening.

title: Why Medical School Should Be Free
description: DOCTORS are among the most richly rewarded professionals in the country. The Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that of the 15 highest-paid professions in the United States, all but two are in medicine or dentistry.

title: Southwestern Fare, Inspired and Varied
description: CLOSE by the beaches of Sandy Hook, Atlantic Highlands has a fairly lively eating scene, with fancy and family-style restaurants alike along the lower end of First Avenue, steps away from the town marina and Raritan Bay. If youre not paying attention, though, you might walk right past one of the best: There is no sign outside the Copper Canyon Restaurant, just a rust-colored horseshoe logo above the door.

title: Animal-Free and Sermon-Free
description: Gail Doherty believes in healthy eating, but she isnt preachy about it. At Good Karma Cafe, the Red Bank restaurant and juice bar she owns with Tiffany Betts, vegan food is served with an easygoing air.

title: In a Darkened Alcove, Plenty of Bright Spots
description: ITS all very casual at the Suburban, in downtown Branford. Waiters and waitresses are clad in plaid shirts, neatly folded dish towels serve as napkins, and an extended bookshelf endows the main dining room with the feel of a home library  although not one conducive to reading.

title: The Weak Foundations of Arab Democracy
description: Durham, N.C.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, May 29
description: On this Memorial Day weekend, CNNs State of the Union and TV Ones Washington Watch are recognizing the holiday by exploring the challenges facing military personnel and veterans.

title: Novelist and His Hero Wonder, Will It Last?
description: To research his latest work of historical fiction, the post-World War I novel Remember Ben Clayton, the novelist and screenwriter Stephen Harrigan traveled to France twice so he could faithfully describe the town of Saint-tienne and the battle that took place there in 1918. In Austin, where he lives, he spent hours poring over newspaper microfiche so he could write about what movies were playing at the time and what brands of chewing gum were being advertised.

title: A Verb for Our Frantic Times
description: Sandisfield, Mass.

title: Remembering Officer Slain in Case of Mistaken Identity
description: Exactly two years after Omar J. Edwards, a New York police officer, was fatally shot in East Harlem by another officer, officials gathered on Saturday to rename the street outside his old station house in his honor.

title: A Movable Canvas
description: For some yoga practitioners, the body represents a blank, movable canvas.

title: With Scattershot Comments, Blagojevich Wagers All
description: After sitting in the witness box for a few minutes at his federal corruption trial last week, Rod R. Blagojevich shared with jurors a bit of personal insight about himself.

title: Loitering on the Fringes
description: THE culture is headed for the curb, and The New York Times is on the story.

title: Exhibit Shows the Impact of War, Through the Artists and the Soldiers
description: James Warren writes a column for the Chicago News Cooperative.

title: Promise and Peril in Utilities Smart Grid
description: David Greising writes a column for the Chicago News Cooperative.

title: Hot City, a Guide
description: Some may think that in summer, the city gets quiet, the traffic starts to die down a bit, and the brisk pace of the business suits slows to a saunter in a sundress. Some would be wrong. Thats when the city gets rowdy with music festivals, parades, celebrations of art and food, and most of it at small cost.

title: Administration Opposes Challenges to Medicaid Cuts
description: WASHINGTON  Medicaid recipients and health care providers cannot sue state officials to challenge cuts in Medicaid payments, even if such cuts compromise access to health care for poor people, the Obama administration has told the Supreme Court.

title: Return of Islamic College Raises New Questions
description: The American Islamic College, closed since 2004 when the state revoked its operating authority, is expected early next month to win approval to reopen.

title: For Anarchist, Details of Life as F.B.I. Target
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  A fat sheaf of F.B.I. reports meticulously details the surveillance that counterterrorism agents directed at the one-story house in East Austin. For at least three years, they traced the license plates of cars parked out front, recorded the comings and goings of residents and guests and, in one case, speculated about a suspicious flat object spread out across the driveway.

title: Shooting in Bronx Injures Three People
description: A day after a 5-year-old girl was wounded by a stray bullet, detectives on Saturday were searching for whoever had opened fire on a crowded Bronx street, hitting the girl and two others, the police said.

title: For the Yankees Nunez, Growth Comes With the Pains of Mistakes
description: SEATTLE  Eduardo Nunez had appeared in 23 games for the Yankees, and what happened to him in the eighth inning Friday night was his season writ small.

title: Dickey Is Willing, but the Mets Want to Be Sure He Is Able
description: With their recent history of trying to rush players back from injuries or attempting to hide the exact nature of injuries, it would seem imprudent for the Mets to allow R. A. Dickey to make his next start if there is any chance he is unfit, or unable to perform all his duties.

title: More Room to Roam on the High Line
description: This summer, the second section of the High Line, the elevated railway turned city park, will open to eager visitors.

title: High Line: the Sequel
description: IT promises to be the summers biggest sequel: the High Line, Section 2.

title: Prized Possession for Barcelona: Champions League Title
description: LONDON  With the fans at one end of Wembley Stadium singing and dancing, and those at the other sulking and leaving, the public-address announcer made the most obvious of proclamations: Barcelona was the winner of the Champions League.

title: Events on Long Island
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Calendar, Metropolitan, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405.

title: Events in New Jersey
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to New Jersey Calendar, Metropolitan, The New York Times, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405; or by e-mail tonjtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Westchester
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around the Hudson Valley. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Calendar, Metropolitan, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405.

title: Events in Connecticut
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Connecticut. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com, or by mail to Connecticut Calendar, Metropolitan, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405.

title: A New Tradition? Piqu Cuts Down the Net
description: Every basketball player watching knew exactly what Gerard Piqu was doing, but it must have seemed odd to the rest of the crowd at Wembley.

title: Graybeards of the Board to Battle for the World Title
description: Boris Gelfand, an Israeli grandmaster, was the surprise winner of the World Championship Candidates Matches in Kazan, Russia, which ended Wednesday.

title: Corrections
description: SPORTS

title: Maryland Earns Trip to Title Game Against Virginia
description: BALTIMORE  The Denver mens lacrosse team entered the N.C.A.A. semifinals as an underdog and an outlier.

title: Chelsea Purvis and Alnawaz Jiwa
description: Chelsea Elisabeth Purvis and Alnawaz Jiwa are to be married Sunday at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx. The Rev. Maria LaSala, a Presbyterian minister, will officiate, with Muhammad Virani, an uncle of the bridegroom and a prayer leader at the Richmond Jamatkhana, a mosque in Richmond, Va., taking part.

title: Chelsea & Al
description: In this homemade video, Alnawaz Jiwa and Chelsea Purvis recount how their relationship blossomed amid Connecticut's local flora.

title: For a Day, the Good in Soccer Makes One Forget the Bad
description: LONDON  For 24 hours, the world got its game back. Barcelona reiterated on the field that its team is without a scintilla of doubt the finest on earth  and totally eclipsed Manchester United.

title: Meghan & Patrick
description: In this homemade video, Meghan McMahon says she knew she'd marry Patrick Kennedy since the moment she first saw him.

title: Mina & Marcus
description: In this homemade video, Mina Kim and Marcus Mucha describe how a car accident brought them together.

title: Stacey & Matt
description: In this homemade video, Matt Balaban says he used his connections in the television industry to propose to Stacey Marmor by way of a TV commercial.

title: In Russia, a Prison for the Police
description: Correctional Colony 13 houses law enforcement officials who have committed abuses of power such as accepting bribes or beating detainees.

title: In Russia, Prisons for Police Thrive
description: NIZHNY TAIGIL, Russia  Like a scene from a felons daydream, all the inmates at a prison compound here in western Russia  some 2,000 of them  are former policemen, prosecutors, tax inspectors, customs agents and judges.

title: Lauren & Matt
description: In this homemade video, Lauren Larusso and Matt Drago tell of their first encounter as they prepare to wed on May 29.

title: An Unlikely Power Duo Emerges in the Global Fight Against Climate Change
description: WASHINGTON  Bill Clinton and Michael R. Bloomberg have circled each other warily for a decade, ever since Mr. Clinton landed in Harlem after leaving the White House and Mr. Bloomberg ascended from a hugely successful business career to become the mayor of New York City. They have appeared together at a few civic functions, dined out a couple of times a year and hacked at golf balls on the same course.

title: Bridget & Mani
description: In this homemade video, Mani Potnoru says he asked Bridget Guarasci to marry him twice--once "too early," and once "for real." Bridget said yes both times.

title: Ayoola & Nathan
description: In this homemade video, Ayoola Kellar and Nathan Carleton describe falling in love while working as volunteers in Namibia.

title: Ayoola Kellar, Nathan Carleton
description: Ayoola Bejide Kellar and Nathan Lee Carleton were married Saturday at the Carlton Savannah Hotel in Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago. Bishop Andrew John of the Covenant House of Praise, a Pentecostal church in Diego Martin, Trinidad and Tobago, officiated.

title: Retro Russian Import Lures Older Riders
description: IRBIT, Russia  This is the story of how a dying Soviet-era industry and an aging biker population in the United States met and found happiness together on the streets and highways of America.

title: Lottery Numbers
Christie & Steve
description: In this homemade video, Steve Gersh recounts how instant messaging helped him grow closer to Christie Franklin while they worked for the same company on opposite coasts.

title: Christina Franklin, Steven Gersh
description: Christina Lee Franklin, a daughter of Joy W. Hire of Granville, Ohio, and George A. Franklin of Kalamazoo, Mich., is to be married Sunday evening to Steven Philip Gersh, the son of Susan Gersh and David Gersh of Beverly Hills, Calif. The Rev. Karen Chakoian, a Presbyterian minister, is to officiate, and Cantor Danny Maseng is to assist at the Beverly Hills Hotel.

title: The Funnywoman, Alive and Well
description: THE stars of Bridesmaids  Kristen Wiig and Maya Rudolph, principally, with Ellie Kemper, Rose Byrne, Wendi McLendon-Covey and especially Melissa McCarthy in support  are very funny. This is not just my opinion, and it should not come as news, if the raucous laughter at a sold-out theater last weekend in Brooklyn is any indication. Funny, apart from being a subjective judgment, is also a commercial imperative, and it is one that Bridesmaids has fulfilled.

title: Republican Legislators Push to Tighten Voting Rules
description: MIAMI  Less than 18 months before the next presidential election, Republican-controlled statehouses around the country are rewriting voting laws to require photo identification at the polls, reduce the number of days of early voting or tighten registration rules.

title: As Potential Investor Watches, Bullpen Displays Little Security
description: In the moments after another dispiriting loss to a division rival, Fred Wilpon, the Mets principal owner, who has endured a week of bad publicity and sobering business decisions, walked slowly and quietly down a tunnel underneath Citi Field toward his waiting car.

title: License Plate Scanners Locate Vehicle Sought After Hit and Run
description: A car that was believed to have been used in a hit-and-run accident that left a traffic officer injured earlier this month was tracked down on Friday through the use of the Police Departments growing web of license-plate-reading cameras, the authorities said.

title: Ashley Sobel, Scott Sokol
description: Ashley Robin Sobel and Scott Benjamin Sokol were married Saturday at Lord Thompson Manor, an event space in Thompson, Conn. The Rev. Victoria Burdick, a Universal Brotherhood minister, officiated.

title: Stacy Black, Craig Becher
description: Stacy Diane Black, the daughter of Jane Tanger Black and Mark A. Black, both of Roanoke, Va., is to be married Sunday to Craig Ross Becher, the son of Leslie E. Becher and Steven H. Becher of Glen Rock, N.J. Rabbi Kathy S. Cohen is to officiate at the Homestead, the resort in Hot Springs, Va.

title: Jessica Schreiber, Joshua Solera
description: Jessica Elaine Schreiber and Joshua Walter Solera are to be married Sunday by Cantor Robert M. Gerber at the Houstonian Hotel in Houston.

title: Deborah Krisbergh, Benjamin Benzel
description: Deborah Susan Krisbergh and Benjamin David Benzel are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Jeffrey S. Fox at Gotham Hall, an event space in New York.

title: Mansi Shah, Sarel Gaur
description: Mansi Jayesh Shah, a daughter of Neema and Jayesh Shah of Clifton, N.J., is to be married Sunday to Dr. Sarel Gaur, a son of Sandhya S. Gaur and Raj P. S. Gaur of Athens, Pa. Pandit Vimal V. Raval is to perform the Hindu ceremony at the Aashirwad Palace, a banquet hall in Randolph, N.J., with his father, Pandit Vinod R. Raval, also a Hindu priest, taking part.

title: Luciana Vieira, Stephen Grambling
description: Dr. Luciana Alves Vieira and Stephen White Grambling are to be married Sunday evening at the Evergreen Museum in Baltimore. The Rev. Marco A. Negro, a minister of the Izunome Association U.S.A., is to officiate.

title: Patricia Maloney, Alastair Hamilton
description: Patricia Ann Maloney and Alastair Ethan Hamilton were married Saturday in New Haven. The Rev. Bret B. Hays, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Battell Chapel at Yale.

title: Jamie Schiff, Jason Sperling
description: Jamie Rose Schiff, the daughter of Judith B. Schiff and David A. Schiff of Portland, Ore., is to be married there Sunday to Jason Maxwell Sperling, the son of Rebecca W. Sperling and Louis J. Sperling of East Greenwich, R.I. Rabbi Michael Z. Cahana is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Beth Israel, with Rabbi Emanuel Rose assisting.

title: Leslie Kim, Peter Lu
description: Dr. Leslie Rhan Kim, a daughter of Jung Hee Kim of Syosset, N.Y., and Jeong Doo Kim of College Point, Queens, was married Friday night to Dr. Peter Long-Shyang Lu, the son of Mei June Lu and Cheng Yi Lu of West Hills, Calif. The Rev. Chong Kim, a United Methodist minister, officiated at the de Seversky Mansion, a party and conference center on the campus of the New York Institute of Technology in Old Westbury, N.Y.

title: Olivia Ma, Sean Kelly
description: Olivia Otey Ma, the daughter of Nathalie Preston Gilfoyle and Christopher Ma of Washington, is to be married Sunday at her parents house to Sean Uberoi Kelly, the son of Narindar U. Kelly and Michael J. Kelly of Baltimore. Judge Diana Gribbon Motz of the United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit in Baltimore is to officiate.

title: Lisa Nguyen, Shawn Anthony
description: Dr. Lisa Pham Nguyen, a daughter of Huong Lien Nguyen and Lam Thanh Nguyen Sr. of New Orleans, is to be married Sunday to Dr. Shawn Garrett Anthony, a son of Joyce A. Anthony and Larry E. Anthony of State College, Pa. The Rev. Michael E. Drea, a Roman Catholic priest, is to perform the ceremony at St. Paul Roman Catholic Church in Cambridge, Mass.

title: Discretionary Truthiness
description: I keep hearing Republicans say that Obama has increased nondefense discretionary spending by 80 percent; its one of those facts that apparently everyone on the right knows. So where does that come from?

title: Reserve Currency Mysticism
description: Oh, my. Even though it was a personal attack on me, I didnt get around to reading Steil and Hinds on why we must be totally freaked about the role of the dollar. But Brad DeLong did; and it turns out that its quite a piece of work.

title: Seattle Solves Rivera and Yankees in 12th
description: SEATTLE  If there is one guideline in baseball that managers follow almost uniformly, it is this: on the road, their closer pitches only with a lead. Manager Joe Girardi strayed from that line of thinking Saturday night because he was left with little other choice. Mariano Rivera entered with the score tied in the 12th inning, and he surprisingly emerged as the weak link in the Yankees bullpen chain. Rivera gave up the winning run in the Mariners 5-4 victory on a bases-loaded blooper to Adam Kennedy, who ignited their go-ahead rally on Friday.

title: 2010 Chiefs: What the Film Revealed
description: While we wonder whether there will be a 2011 season, this is part of a series looking back at the 2010 season, with the benefit of film analysis. This is the final installment of the series.

title: Gagosian Hosts Peytons First Solo Show in Paris
description: The American painter Elizabeth Peyton is enjoying her first solo show in Paris at the Gagosian Gallery, spotlighting new paintings and drawings, through July 28. The gallerys polished, high-ceilinged space (4 rue Ponthieu; 33-1-45-63-98-06; www.gagosian.com) may seem like an odd fit with Ms. Peytons small-scale, tightly framed portraits, but the power of her intimate style holds up in the gallery.

title: Policy Adviser Tapped to Become U.S. Ambassador to Russia
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama has decided to send the architect of his so-called Russia reset policy to Moscow as the next United States ambassador there, seeking to further bolster an improved relationship as both countries head into a potentially volatile election season.

title: At Missions End  Joy, Relief and Unexpected Perils
description: In the final installment of A Year at War, his project that chronicled the yearlong deployment of the First Battalion, 87th Infantry Regiment that was based in Kunduz Province, Afghanistan, Jim Dao reports on the new difficulties that soldiers face on their return home from the battlefield.

title: At Rolling Thunder, Waiting for Palin
description: WASHINGTON  Thousands of Harley-riding bikers from across the country began assembling in the Pentagons North Parking Lot on Sunday morning for the annual Rolling Thunder rally  and the start of Sarah Palins One Nation bus tour.

title: Civilians Are Killed in Airstrike by NATO
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghan officials said Sunday that a NATO airstrike had killed 14 civilians, most of them women and children, in the southern province of Helmand on Saturday night.

title: Vettel Dodges All Obstacles to Win Again
description: MONACO  The Monaco Grand Prix was a wild race from start to finish, with multiple accidents, two safety-car periods, a half-hour red flag break just six laps before the end and a fight to the end among three drivers separated by less than a second.

title: Vettel Dodges All Obstacles to Win Again
description: MONACO  The Monaco Grand Prix was a wild race from start to finish, with multiple accidents, two safety-car periods, a half-hour red flag break just six laps before the end and a fight to the end among three drivers separated by less than a second.

title: Federer Defeats Wawrinka to Reach Quarterfinals
description: PARIS  Roger Federer took 106 minutes to dispatch his countryman, Stanislas Wawrinka, at Roland Garros on Sunday for what could have been the Swiss national tennis championship. The final score: 6-3, 6-2, 7-5.

title: A Quarterfinals Record Worth Noting
description: PARIS  As Novak Djokovic and his 40-0 record this year took the court under the watchful eyes of tennis historians and French fans (he was playing Richard Gasquet), Roger Federer was in the interview room, having already advanced.

title: Reaction to Barcelonas Victory
description: Postgame comments from some of the principals in Saturdays Champions League final:

title: Afghan Bank Commission Absolves Presidents Brother in Fraud Case
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A commission appointed by President Hamid Karzai to assess responsibility for the massive fraud at Kabul Bank issued its report on Sunday, absolving the presidents brother of any blame.

title: Islamists Seize a Yemeni City, Stoking Fears
description: SANA, Yemen  Islamist militants consolidated control over a second city in southern Yemen on Sunday, seizing banks, government offices and the security headquarters as government forces responded with mortar fire.

title: For Palin, a Short Ride With Lots of Rumbling
description: Sarah Palin made a grand entrance at the Rolling Thunder biker rally on Sunday, wearing a black Harley-Davidson helmet and visibly enjoying herself as a crush of reporters and bikers swarmed her motorcycle.

title: Dickey Says He Is Ready to Start, but Collins Isnt So Sure
description: R.A. Dickey threw a full bullpen session before Sundays game against the Phillies and said he was prepared to make his next scheduled start on Tuesday. Terry Collins, his manager, isnt so convinced.

title: Djokovic Wins 41st Straight This Year
description: PARIS  Novak Djokovic, tenniss most successful all-surface professional player of the moment and for many years, added a 41st consecutive victory to this years list and wove a competent straight-set victory over Richard Gasquet of France, 6-4, 6-4, 6-2. on Sunday at the French Open.

title: Badminton Group Kills Controversial Dress Code Rule
description: Facing mounting criticism, the Badminton World Federation announced Sunday that it was scrapping a rule that would have forced women to wear skirts or dresses in elite competition.

title: Sudan Threatens to Occupy 2 More Disputed Regions
description: JUBA, Sudan  The northern Sudanese Army is threatening to seize two more areas along the combustible north-south border, risking war just weeks before southern Sudan is due to split off as a new country, Western and Sudanese officials said Sunday.

title: Changeovers Offer Glimpse Into Players Souls
description: PARIS  There was once not much of a changeover in tennis. Chairs were not used at Wimbledon until 1975, and until the demands of television had to be met, players stayed on their feet and quickly made their way to the opposite side of the court, taking a swig of water or perhaps something stronger along the way.

title: After Zvonarevas Loss, Schiavone Moves Into Role of Favorite
description: PARIS  Francesca Schiavone, a stunning French Open winner a year ago, is headed to this years quarterfinals suddenly cast as the tournament favorite.

title: Skee-Ball, Played for Fun and Money
description: Dressed in an orange Tony the Tiger vest and clashing red-on-black striped pants, and proudly sporting a mullet hairdo, Joe Mucha grasped ball after ball, achieving a score that reflected his years of training in the art of Skee-Ball.

title: Corruption Inquiry Leads FIFA to Bar Two More Officials
description: World soccers corruption scandal continued to widen Sunday with the suspension of two more powerful officials from the executive committee of FIFA, the sports governing body.

title: A New Radio Home for Alternative Music
description: New York Citys alternative music scene will get a lift starting Wednesday, June 1, when WNYE-FM, the city-owned noncommercial station at 91.5 on the dial, begins broadcasting the indie music service The Alternate Side from 6 a.m. to noon. The program, started in 2008 by Fordham Universitys public station WFUV-FM with support from the New York State Music Fund, has showcased artists like the Strokes and TV on the Radio as well as newer local groups like Freelance Whales.

title: 3-D Starts to Fizzle, and Hollywood Frets
description: LOS ANGELES  Has the 3-D boom already gone bust? Its starting to look that way  at least for American moviegoers  even as Hollywood prepares to release a glut of the gimmicky pictures.

title: Visiting Joplin, Obama Offers Message of Comfort
description: JOPLIN, Mo.  A week ago the Missouri Southern State University campus here was rich with celebration and smiles as the graduating seniors of the public high school paraded across stage to grasp their diplomas. Within hours, a third of the town was destroyed  including Joplin High School  and scores of residents were dead, at least one of the newly minted graduates among them.

title: Mets End Rocky Week by Thumping Phillies
description: After enduring one of the stranger and more stressful weeks in the teams 49-year history, the Mets were eager to turn the page Sunday.

title: The Morning Line: 12 Appear Ready for Belmont
description: Jerry Bossert in The Daily News reviewed the field for the Belmont Stakes to be run on June 11 and found that a field of 12 appears set. Mike Veitch in the Saratogian reviewed and rated the cast of 3-year-olds in the United States. His top four rated in order were Animal Kingdom, Shackleford, Nehro and Tobys Corner.

title: American Songbook as Fountain of Youth
description: As many of you know, Ive had three husbands and one meaningful love affair, the singer Marilyn Maye remarked. And now that Im too old to be humble, the good news is that none of em worked. This is what I love.

title: Music to Echo Natures Sounds and Voices
description: One hundred years after Mahlers death his work remains a vital influence, at least when it comes to talking animals. In a revealing recital Thursday evening at the Austrian Cultural Forum the soprano Ursula Langmayr sang two sets of Mahler songs about nature and beasts, using them to frame pieces on the same themes by three more recent, less famous Austrian composers.

title: Ranking Baseballs Best Ballparks
description: Im working on an article about the New York Mets  but that subject is perhaps too depressing for a beautiful Memorial Day weekend.

title: Winning Pair With Plenty of Experience
description: The worlds most successful single-session charity bridge tournament, the UJA-Federation of New Yorks Womens Philanthropy pro-am, was played Tuesday at the Harmonie Club in Manhattan. The winners with a huge 81 percent game were Jacqui Mitchell and Selma Schlechter of New York. Melih Ozdil and Sharon Goldman of New York finished second.

title: The Trouble With E-Mail
description: Among Internet users with secrets, including bankers, lawyers, hackers and people who visit porn sites or confide in friends  so that would be all of us  theres a widespread apprehension that the Web is no longer a safe place to spill them.

title: Are There Natural Human Rights?
description: This has been a year of uprisings. The series of popular revolts, struggles and crackdowns by governments, which continue to this day, began in Tunisia when protesters demanded the removal of president Zine al-Abidine Ben Ali. The claims of the protesters were about the right to eat (the cost of food), political corruption, freedom of speech and basic political rights. Then came Egypt, as thousands flocked to Tahrir Square in Cairo and elsewhere. Their demands were similar to those in Tunisia. Both sets of protesters were successful: the leaders of both countries fled. This was the first wave. It was largely peaceful.

title: Schiavone Advances by Keeping Her Cool
description: The stakes were high late in the third set Sunday between Jelena Jankovic and the French Open defending champion, Francesca Schiavone. Both players had squandered opportunities to run away with the match, and neither was playing their best tennis. Schiavone had won converted just 4 of 19 break-point chances. Time and again, Schiavone set up the point, only to hit the final shot into the top of the net or just wide. For her part, Jankovic allowed her emotions to run away, especially at several critical junctures late in the match.

title: The Dances of Africa, as Filtered Through the Americas
description: Theres nothing like a DanceAfrica performance to send you straight to summer. It has its own flow, and you cant fight it, no matter how chaotic, raucous and hazily dull it becomes. Chuck Davis, the groups artistic director, loves to speechify, and during the nearly two-and-a-half hour program at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Friday night  it was so long he had to cut the finale  there were two award presentations and a memorial service to honor those once connected to DanceAfrica.

title: Focus Groups That Look Like Play Groups
description: The dozen women worked in meditative silence, gingerly pasting Barbie dolls, large colorful lollipops and pieces of feather boas on black poster board panels.

title: The New Focus Group
description: An analysis of a type of market research that uses collages to learn about consumer feelings towards a brand or product.

title: DanceAfrica 2011
description: Photos of the program at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Monday: Himalayan Beast
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  All in all, this is a very straightforward Monday puzzle, with some nice entries making their first appearance today, like POLAR BEAR and AFTER GLOW, thankfully clued as a Sunset remnant.

title: Five Poets Seasoned by Life
description: One of the great pleasures of poetry is catching a good poet in midcareer. Reading a savvy verse veteran is like watching Sandy Koufax paint a 1-0 shutout in his prime  some pure high heat here, a paralyzing curve there, then a little deliberate deception way down in the dirt. Any one of the following books by midcareer poets would be a bracing warm-weather antidote to the clankety-clank-clank of Stieg Larssons alleged thrillers, or the kohl-smeared smirks that make up the Pirates of the Caribbean movies.

title: Demonstrators Rally Against Mladic Extradition
description: BELGRADE, Serbia  Groups of youths throwing stones and bottles clashed with riot police officers on Sunday evening in Belgrade, after thousands of Serbian nationalists rallied outside Parliament against the arrest and extradition of Ratko Mladic, the former Serbian military commander facing war crimes charges in The Hague for atrocities committed during the 1990s Balkans conflict.

title: Sex and the City (Atlanta), With Racial Politics
description: Even if youve never sweated through a Dolce & Gabbana bustier on a neon-lighted dance floor somewhere deep into a fifth or sixth shot of Grey Goose, you have surely, by virtue of living, absorbed the message of Beyoncs revenge-as-empowerment anthem, Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It). If not, let me boil it down for you: Most men are toddlers who get bored with their toys, dump them into the sandbox and then get ticked off when someone else on the playground dares to use them.

title: City College to Support New Theater Uptown
